original: byang chub dang nye ba'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam dag la ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //

translated: ‚ÄúIn order to eliminate the conceptual thoughts of mindfulness that are based on attachment.‚ÄùüîΩAfter that, the right efforts are for the purpose of increasing his energy by the power of mindfulness.üîΩAfter that, the bases of supernatural power are for the purpose of purifying samƒÅdhi.

analyzed: de nyid rnam grol gnyis / rnam par grol ba 'dus byas de nyid mdo las /

analyzed: 'dus ma byas nyid khams zhes bya //

analyzed: 'dod chags spangs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams yin no //

translated: In brief, there are two:

original: shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //üîΩde gnyis las kyang /
analyzed: shes pa zag bcas zag pa med // de gnyis las kyang /
translated: impure and pure knowledge.

original: dang po kun rdzob ces bya'o //
analyzed: dang po kun rdzob ces bya'o //
translated: The first is conventional knowledge.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni phal cher bum pa dang snam bu dang skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa kun rdzob 'dzin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni phal cher bum pa dang snam bu dang skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa kun rdzob 'dzin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
translated: Conventional knowledge is so called because it grasps the conventional, that is, the vase, cloth, male, female, etc.

original: zag med rnam gnyis chos dang ni /
analyzed: zag med rnam gnyis chos dang ni /
translated: Pure knowledge is twofold:

original: rjes su shes pa kho na yin //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa kho na yin //
translated: knowledge of the doctrine and subsequent knowledge.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa la rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa la rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: Pure knowledge is divided into two:

original: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of the doctrine and subsequent knowledge.

original: de ltar na shes pa 'di gnyis ni gsum yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa 'di gnyis ni gsum yin te /
translated: Thus, these two knowledges are three:

original: kun rdzob shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: conventional knowledge, knowledge of the doctrine, and subsequent knowledge.

original: de la / kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do //
analyzed: de la / kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do //
translated: Conventional knowledge has all as its object.

original: kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni ci rigs par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni ci rigs par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad yin no //
translated: The conventional cognition has for its object all factors, conditioned and unconditioned.

original: chos shes bya ba'i spyod yul ni //
analyzed: chos shes bya ba'i spyod yul ni //
translated: The cognition of the factors has for its object the unsatisfactoriness, etc.

original: 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa //
translated: of the realm of desire.

original: chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / de kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam rnams yin no //üîΩrjes su shes pa'i spyod yul ni //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / de kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam rnams yin no // rjes su shes pa'i spyod yul ni //
translated: The cognition of the factors has for its object the unsatisfactoriness, the origin, the cessation and the path of the realm of desire.üîΩThe subsequent cognition has for its object the unsatisfactoriness, etc.

original: gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs yin //
analyzed: gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs yin //
translated: of the higher realms.

original: rjes su shes pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / de kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam rnams so //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / de kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam rnams so //
translated: The subsequent cognition has for its object the unsatisfactoriness, the origin, the cessation and the path of the realms of finemateriality and of immateriality.

original: de dag nyid bden @43b bye brag gis //
analyzed: de dag nyid bden @43b bye brag gis //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising have for their object the truths in their entirety.

original: bzhi ste / chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa de dag nyid bden pa'i bye brag gis sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams dang shes pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: bzhi ste / chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa de dag nyid bden pa'i bye brag gis sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams dang shes pa bzhi yin te /
translated: There are four knowledges: knowledge of the doctrine, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of suffering, knowledge of origin, knowledge of cessation, and knowledge of the path.

original: de dag la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called knowledges because they are focused on the specific truths.

original: rnam bzhi de dag ni /
analyzed: rnam bzhi de dag ni /
translated: These four

original: mi skye ba dang zad pa shes //
analyzed: mi skye ba dang zad pa shes //
translated: are knowledge of nonarising and knowledge of elimination.

original: chos dang rjes su shes pa lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag kho nar zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang rjes su shes pa lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag kho nar zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These four knowledges, which are not by nature views, are called knowledge of elimination and knowledge of nonarising.

original: de gnyis dang po skyes pa ni //
analyzed: de gnyis dang po skyes pa ni //
translated: The first arising of these two

original: sdug bsngal rgyu rjes shes pa yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu rjes shes pa yin //
translated: is subsequent knowledge of suffering and origin.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang po skyes pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa yin te /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang po skyes pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa yin te /
translated: The first arising of knowledge of elimination and knowledge of nonarising is subsequent knowledge of suffering and origin.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i phung po la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i phung po la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they focus on the aggregates of the summit of existence as suffering and origin.

original: yang ci rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kyang de gnyis dang dmigs pa gcig pa zhig yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kyang de gnyis dang dmigs pa gcig pa zhig yin nam zhe na /
translated: Also, is the vajra like concentration the same object as those two?

original: gal te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs na ni yin no //
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs na ni yin no //
translated: If it focuses on the truths of suffering and origin, then it is.

original: 'on te 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa zhig yin na ni dmigs pa gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa zhig yin na ni dmigs pa gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it focuses on the truths of cessation and path, then it is not the same object.

original: bzhi las pha rol sems rig pa //
analyzed: bzhi las pha rol sems rig pa //
translated: Knowledge of others minds arises from four knowledges.

original: rig par byed pas na rig pa ste shes pa'o //
analyzed: rig par byed pas na rig pa ste shes pa'o //
translated: It is knowledge because it causes knowledge.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni shes pa bzhi las skye bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni shes pa bzhi las skye bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Knowledge of others minds arises from four knowledges:

original: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dang lam shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa rnams las so //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dang lam shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa rnams las so //
translated: knowledge of the truth of Dharma, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of the truth of path and conventional knowledge.

original: de'i nges pa ni 'di yin te //üîΩdes ni sa dbang gang zag 'das //
analyzed: de'i nges pa ni 'di yin te // des ni sa dbang gang zag 'das //
translated: Its determination is as follows:

original: zhig dang ma skyes mi rig go //
analyzed: zhig dang ma skyes mi rig go //
translated: It does not know higher or lower levels,üîΩthe past, the unarisen or noncognizable objects.

original: sa 'das pa mi shes pa ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i sa pas bsam gtan gong ma'i sa pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'das pa mi shes pa ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i sa pas bsam gtan gong ma'i sa pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: It does not know higher levels because the lower absorptions do not know the higher absorptions.

original: dbang po 'das pa mi shes pa ni dad pas mos pa dang dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po 'das pa mi shes pa ni dad pas mos pa dang dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam mi shes pa'o //
translated: Non-knowledge of past faculties is non-knowledge of the path of resolute faith and the path of liberation not conjoined with time, which are obtained by seeing.

original: gang zag 'das pa mi shes pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi lam rnams 'og mas gong ma mi shes pa'o //üîΩzhig pa dang ma skyes pa mi shes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag 'das pa mi shes pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi lam rnams 'og mas gong ma mi shes pa'o // zhig pa dang ma skyes pa mi shes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi shes pa ste /
translated: Non-knowledge of past persons is non-knowledge of the paths of nonreturners, arhats, sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and buddhas by those of lower paths.

original: da ltar gyi pha rol gyi sems yul yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang chos rjes blo phyogs phan tshun min //
analyzed: da ltar gyi pha rol gyi sems yul yin pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang chos rjes blo phyogs phan tshun min //
translated: Non-knowledge of destruction and non-knowledge of nonarising is non-knowledge of the past and future because the object of the knowledge of others minds is the present.üîΩMoreover, knowledge of subsequent state does not know the other.

original: @44a * // pha rol gyi sems shes pa chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pas kyang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems mi shes la /
analyzed: @44a * // pha rol gyi sems shes pa chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pas kyang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems mi shes la /
translated: Knowledge of the minds of others that is compatible with Dharma knowledge does not know the mind that is compatible with subsequent knowledge.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pas kyang chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems mi shes te /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pas kyang chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems mi shes te /
translated: Also, the mind of the aspect of subsequent knowledge does not know the mind of the aspect of Dharma knowledge.

original: de gnyis ni 'dod pa'i khams dang khams gong ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'dod pa'i khams dang khams gong ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two focus on the antidote of the desire realm and higher realms.

original: mthong ba'i lam la pha rol gyi sems shes pa med do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la pha rol gyi sems shes pa med do //
translated: The knowledge of others' minds does not exist on the path of seeing.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni yod de /
translated: But its focal object exists.

original: de la pha rol gyi sems shes pas mthong ba'i lam shes par 'dod pas sbyor ba byas na /
analyzed: de la pha rol gyi sems shes pas mthong ba'i lam shes par 'dod pas sbyor ba byas na /
translated: If one wishes to know the path of seeing through the knowledge of others' minds, one should prepare for it.

original: nyan thos mthong ba'i skad cig gnyis //
analyzed: nyan thos mthong ba'i skad cig gnyis //
translated: ≈örƒÅvakas know two moments of seeing.

original: rig ste bse ru lta bus gsum //
analyzed: rig ste bse ru lta bus gsum //
translated: Rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddhas know three.

original: sangs rgyas sbyor ba med par kun //üîΩnyan thos kyis ni pha rol gyi sems shes pas mthong ba'i lam las skad cig ma gnyis shes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sbyor ba med par kun // nyan thos kyis ni pha rol gyi sems shes pas mthong ba'i lam las skad cig ma gnyis shes te /
translated: Buddhas know all without preparation.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa'o //
translated: ≈örƒÅvakas who know the minds of others know two moments of the path of seeing: perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa la dmigs pa ni sbyor ba gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de ji srid kyis sbyor ba rtsom pa de srid gyis  des sems bcu drug rjes su 'thob par 'gyur bas bar du ni mi shes so
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa la dmigs pa ni sbyor ba gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de ji srid kyis sbyor ba rtsom pa de srid gyis  des sems bcu drug rjes su 'thob par 'gyur bas bar du ni mi shes so
translated: The subsequent knowledge of the summit of existence is not known in the interval because it focuses on the aspect of subsequent knowledge and is established by other preparations.

original: // rang sangs rgyas kyis ni dang po gnyis dang brgyad pa kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang / gsum shes te /
analyzed: // rang sangs rgyas kyis ni dang po gnyis dang brgyad pa kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang / gsum shes te /
translated: Pratyekabuddhas know three: the first two and the eighth, subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin,

original: sbyor ba chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because their preparations are small.

original: gzhan dag na re dang po dang gnyis pa dang bco lnga pa rnams shes so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dang po dang gnyis pa dang bco lnga pa rnams shes so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say they know the first, second and fifteenth moments.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni sbyor ba med par mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma thams cad mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni sbyor ba med par mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma thams cad mkhyen to //
translated: Buddhas know all moments of the path of seeing without preparation.

original: yang zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /üîΩzad pa shes pa bden rnams la //
analyzed: yang zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag la khyad par ci yod ce na / zad pa shes pa bden rnams la //
translated: What is the difference between the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising?üîΩThe knowledge of elimination is definite

original: yongs shes la sogs nges pa'o //
analyzed: yongs shes la sogs nges pa'o //
translated: knowledge of complete knowledge and so on of the truths.

original: yongs shes byar med ces la sogs //
analyzed: yongs shes byar med ces la sogs //
translated: There is no more to know, etc.

original: mi skye ba yi blor 'dod do //
analyzed: mi skye ba yi blor 'dod do //
translated: This is called the cognition of nonarising.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:

original: zad pa shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: zad pa shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cognition of elimination?

original: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya bar shes pa dang / kun 'byung spangs so //
analyzed: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya bar shes pa dang / kun 'byung spangs so //
translated: It is the cognition, seeing, awareness, intelligence, discernment, wisdom, illumination, and realization that arises from the cause of the knowledge that I have fully known suffering, I have abandoned origin,

original: 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
translated: I have manifested cessation,

original: lam bsgoms so zhes bya bar shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i shes pa dang mthong ba dang rig ba dang blo dang rtogs pa dang shes rab dang snang ba dang mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni zad pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam bsgoms so zhes bya bar shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i shes pa dang mthong ba dang rig ba dang blo dang rtogs pa dang shes rab dang snang ba dang mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni zad pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: I have meditated on the path. This is called the cognition of elimination.

original: mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cognition of nonarising?

original: bdag gis @44b sdug bsngal yongs su shes te /
analyzed: bdag gis @44b sdug bsngal yongs su shes te /
translated: It is the cognition, seeing, awareness, intelligence, discernment, wisdom, illumination, and realization that arises from the cause of the knowledge that I have fully known suffering and there is no more to fully know,üîΩI have abandoned origin and there is no more to abandon,

original: yang yongs su shes par byar med do zhes bya bar shes pa nas bdag gis lam bsgoms te yang bsgom du med do zhes bya ba'i bar du shes pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang yongs su shes par byar med do zhes bya bar shes pa nas bdag gis lam bsgoms te yang bsgom du med do zhes bya ba'i bar du shes pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Again, the knowledge that there is nothing to be fully known, up to the knowledge that there is no path to be cultivated, since I have cultivated the path, and there is no more to cultivate.

original: ji ltar na zag pa med pa'i shes pas de ltar shes she na /üîΩkha che ba rnams na re bstan bcos las /
analyzed: ji ltar na zag pa med pa'i shes pas de ltar shes she na / kha che ba rnams na re bstan bcos las /
translated: How does uncontaminated knowledge know in that way?

original: de'i rjes la langs bas de ltar shes te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la langs bas de ltar shes te /
translated: The Kashmiri Vaibhasikas say: It knows in that way through subsequent knowledge.

original: de'i phyir de'i bye brag gis de gnyis kyi bye brag bstan to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i bye brag gis de gnyis kyi bye brag bstan to zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, their distinction is taught by their distinction.

original: gzhan dag na re zag pa med pas kyang de ltar shes te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zag pa med pas kyang de ltar shes te /
translated: Others say: Uncontaminated knowledge also knows in that way.

original: mthong ba smos pa ni bshad pa 'phangs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mthong ba smos pa ni bshad pa 'phangs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The term seeing is mentioned because it is a derivation of the explanation,

original: yang na mngon sum du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na mngon sum du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because it engages directly.

original: de nyid kyi phyir re zhig shes pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba yang yin no zhes 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir re zhig shes pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba yang yin no zhes 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore it is said: First, any knowledge is also seeing.

original: de ltar na de dag ni shes pa bcu yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni shes pa bcu yin te /
translated: Thus they are the ten knowledges.

original: 'di lta ste chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang /
translated: They are: the cognition of the doctrine, the subsequent cognition, the cognition of the conventional, the cognition of another's thoughts, the cognition of suffering, the cognition of the origin of suffering, the cognition of the cessation of suffering, the cognition of the path,

original: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: the cognition of exhaustion, and the cognition of non-production.

original: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la gcig gi cha yang yin no //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la gcig gi cha yang yin no //
translated: Among these, the cognition of the conventional is one cognition and a part of one other.

original: chos shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la bdun gyi cha yang yin te /
analyzed: chos shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la bdun gyi cha yang yin te /
translated: The cognition of the doctrine is one cognition and a part of seven others.

original: rjes su shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The subsequent cognition is also like that.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la bzhi'i cha yang yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la bzhi'i cha yang yin te /
translated: The cognition of suffering is one cognition and a part of four others.

original: kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa shes pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa shes pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The cognition of the origin of suffering and the cognition of the cessation of suffering are also like that.

original: lam shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la lnga'i cha yang yin no //
analyzed: lam shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la lnga'i cha yang yin no //
translated: The cognition of the path is one cognition and a part of five others.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la bzhi'i cha yang yin no //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la bzhi'i cha yang yin no //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts is one cognition and a part of four others.

original: zad pa ni shes pa gcig yin la /
analyzed: zad pa ni shes pa gcig yin la /
translated: Exhaustion is one knowledge.

original: drug gi cha yang yin te /
analyzed: drug gi cha yang yin te /
translated: It is also a part of six knowledges.

original: mi skye ba shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Nonarising is also like that.üîΩWhy are they established as three but ten in number?üîΩTen are established by nature, antidote,üîΩaspect, object,

original: ci'i phyir de dag gsum yod la bcur rnam par gzhag ce na /üîΩrang bzhin dang ni gnyen po dang // rnam pa rnam pa spyod yul dang // sbyor dang bya ba byas nyid dang // rgyu rgyas pa las bcu yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gsum yod la bcur rnam par gzhag ce na / rang bzhin dang ni gnyen po dang // rnam pa rnam pa spyod yul dang // sbyor dang bya ba byas nyid dang // rgyu rgyas pa las bcu yin no //
translated: application, function,üîΩand extensive cause.

original: rgyu bdun gyis shes pa bcur rnam par gzhag go zhes grag ste /üîΩrang bzhin las ni kun rdzob shes pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu bdun gyis shes pa bcur rnam par gzhag go zhes grag ste / rang bzhin las ni kun rdzob shes pa ste /

original: par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: par bya'o zhes zer ro //

analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yin no zhes zer ro //

original: de skad du mi brjod de /

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: This contradicts the treatise attainment of knowledge, which states:

analyzed: sems kun du bsdus pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: One perfectly knows contracted mind as it is.

original: de shes pa'i shes pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de shes pa'i shes pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The knowledge that knows that is four:

analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / lam shes pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sems zhum pa ni le lo dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa yin no //
translated: A contracted mind is afflicted because it is concomitant with laziness.

original: rab tu bzung ba ni brtson 'grus dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
analyzed: rab tu bzung ba ni brtson 'grus dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
translated: An extended mind is virtuous because it is concomitant with effort.

original: chung ngu ni rnam par byang ba chung du dag gis bsten pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu ni rnam par byang ba chung du dag gis bsten pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yin no //

analyzed: chen por gyur pa ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //

analyzed: rtsa ba dang / rin dang / 'khor dang / rjes su 'brang ba dang / stobs che chung gi yang phyir te /
translated: It is also because of the root, the price, the retinue, the following, and the strength.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis kyis rtsa ba dang bcas pa yin no //

analyzed: dge ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum gyis so //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rin chung ba yin no //
translated: The unwholesome is of little price because it is not to be accomplished with effort.

analyzed: dge ba ni tshogs chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rin che ba yin no //
translated: The wholesome is of great price because it is to be accomplished with a great accumulation.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa'i phyir 'khor mang ba ma yin la phung po gsum gyis rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa yin no //

analyzed: dge ba ni 'khor mang ba yin la phung po bzhis rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa yin no //

original: yang nyon mongs pa can ni stobs chung ba yin no //
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa can ni stobs chung ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the defiled is weak,

original: dge ba ni stobs che ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba ni stobs che ba yin no //

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa gcig gis kyang phra rgyas bcu gtan du 'joms par byed pas @46b de'i phyir yang nyon mongs pa ni chung ba yin la dge ba ni chen por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa gcig gis kyang phra rgyas bcu gtan du 'joms par byed pas @46b de'i phyir yang nyon mongs pa ni chung ba yin la dge ba ni chen por gyur pa yin no //
translated: And because one single receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness completely destroys the ten proclivities, the defiled is weak and the wholesome is strong.

original: rgod pa ni rgod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: rgod pa ni rgod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yin no //
translated: Agitation is defiled because it is associated with agitation.

analyzed: rgod pa ma yin pa ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
translated: Non-agitation is wholesome because it is the counter-agent to agitation.

original: rnam par ma zhi ba dang / rnam par zhi ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma zhi ba dang / rnam par zhi ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to non-calmness and calmness.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: Non-concentration is defiled because it is associated with distraction.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
translated: Concentration is wholesome because it is the counter-agent to that.

original: ma bsgoms pa ni 'thob pa dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa dag gis ma bsgoms pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can no ;
analyzed: ma bsgoms pa ni 'thob pa dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa dag gis ma bsgoms pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can no ;
translated: The defiled is that which is not cultivated by the cultivation of attainment and the cultivation of reliance.

original: / bsgoms pa ni de gnyis kyis bsgoms pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
analyzed: / bsgoms pa ni de gnyis kyis bsgoms pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
translated: The wholesome is that which is cultivated by those two.

original: rnam par ma grol ba ni rang bzhin dang rgyud rnam par ma grol ba dag gis rnam par grol ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: rnam par ma grol ba ni rang bzhin dang rgyud rnam par ma grol ba dag gis rnam par grol ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yin no //
translated: The defiled is that which is not liberated by natural liberation and liberation from the bonds.

original: rnam par grol ba ni de gnyis kyis rnam par grol ba'i phyir dge ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni de gnyis kyis rnam par grol ba'i phyir dge ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The wholesome is that which is liberated by those two.

original: de lta na ni mdo dang mi mthun par byas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de lta na ni mdo dang mi mthun par byas pa yang yin la /
translated: But this explanation is not in agreement with the sutras,

original: tshig de rnams kyi don gyi khyad par yang ma bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig de rnams kyi don gyi khyad par yang ma bshad pa yin no //
translated: and the specific meanings of the terms are not explained.

original: ji ltar na mdo dang mi mthun par byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mdo dang mi mthun par byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not in agreement with the sutras?üîΩThe sutras state:

original: mdo las ji ltar na sems nang du kun du bsdus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las ji ltar na sems nang du kun du bsdus pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the mind internally contracted?

original: sems gang rmugs pa dang gnyid dang lhan cig par gyur cing nang du kun du 'gog pa dang lhan cig par gyur la lhag mthong dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems gang rmugs pa dang gnyid dang lhan cig par gyur cing nang du kun du 'gog pa dang lhan cig par gyur la lhag mthong dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa yin no //
translated: The mind is sluggish and sleepy, and it is not associated with insight.

original: ji ltar na phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it distracted outwardly?

original: sems gang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la rjes su g-yengs pa yin zhing rnam par 'phros pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems gang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la rjes su g-yengs pa yin zhing rnam par 'phros pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mind is distracted and scattered toward the five sense pleasures.

original: sems de nyid kun du bsdus pa yin la rnam par g-yengs pa yang yin par 'gyur ro zhes kyang bshad pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sems de nyid kun du bsdus pa yin la rnam par g-yengs pa yang yin par 'gyur ro zhes kyang bshad pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not also explained that the same mind is both contracted and distracted?

original: de skad du ni bshad mod kyi rigs par bshad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad du ni bshad mod kyi rigs par bshad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is explained, but it is not a correct explanation.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi gnyid dang lhan cig par gyur ba rnam par g-yengs pa nyid du dam ma bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi gnyid dang lhan cig par gyur ba rnam par g-yengs pa nyid du dam ma bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is not admitted that the mind is distracted when it is associated with sleepy sluggishness.

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not also explained that this contradicts the treatise?

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ni bla'i mdo dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ni bla'i mdo dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is better to contradict the treatises than to contradict the s≈´tras.

original: ji ltar na tshig de rnams kyi don gyi khyad par ma bshad pa yin zhe na /üîΩsems rnam @47a * //
analyzed: ji ltar na tshig de rnams kyi don gyi khyad par ma bshad pa yin zhe na / sems rnam @47a * //
translated: How is it that the distinctive meanings of those terms are not explained?

original: par g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang rnam par ma zhi ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / ma bsgoms pa dang / rnam par ma grol ba rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyang tha mi dad par bshad pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: par g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / rgod pa dang rnam par ma zhi ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / ma bsgoms pa dang / rnam par ma grol ba rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyang tha mi dad par bshad pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because the characteristics of a distracted mind, a depressed mind, an excited mind, an uncalm mind, an unconcentrated mind, an undeveloped mind, and an unrestrained mind are explained without distinction.

original: kun du bsdus pa dang / rab tu bzung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang tha mi dad par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du bsdus pa dang / rab tu bzung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang tha mi dad par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the characteristics of a contracted mind, an expanded mind, and so on are explained without distinction.

original: tshig rnams kyi don gyi khyad par ni ma bshad pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshig rnams kyi don gyi khyad par ni ma bshad pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: The distinctive meanings of the terms are not explained.

original: nyon mongs pa can du mtshungs kyang 'di ltar sems nyon mongs pa can 'di ni rnam par g-yengs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can du mtshungs kyang 'di ltar sems nyon mongs pa can 'di ni rnam par g-yengs pa yin no //
translated: Although they are similar in being afflicted, in this way this afflicted mind is distracted.

original: 'di ni zhum pa yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par de'i nyes pa'i khyad par yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'di ni zhum pa yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par de'i nyes pa'i khyad par yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir la /
translated: This is slackness.

original: de bzhin du dge ba yang yon tan gyi khyad par yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir don gyi khyad par bshad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba yang yon tan gyi khyad par yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir don gyi khyad par bshad pa kho na yin no //
translated: In the same way, in order to demonstrate the special qualities of virtue, the special meaning of the words is explained.

original: mdo dang 'gal ba ma spangs pa'i phyir de ni tshig de rnams kyi don ma yin no //üîΩgal te mdo las sems de nyid zhum pa yang yin la de nyid rgod pa yang yin no zhes bya bar bshad na ni gang gi tshe sems zhum pa dang zhum par dogs pa de'i tshe shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: mdo dang 'gal ba ma spangs pa'i phyir de ni tshig de rnams kyi don ma yin no // gal te mdo las sems de nyid zhum pa yang yin la de nyid rgod pa yang yin no zhes bya bar bshad na ni gang gi tshe sems zhum pa dang zhum par dogs pa de'i tshe shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: But since it does not avoid contradicting the sutra, that is not the meaning of those words.

original: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag rnams bsgom pa'i dus ma yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag rnams bsgom pa'i dus ma yin no //
translated: If the sutra explains that the same mind is slack and also excited, then when the mind is slack or fears becoming slack, it is not the time to cultivate the enlightenment factors of pliancy, concentration,üîΩand equanimity.

original: gang gi tshe sems rgod pa dang rgod par dogs pa de'i tshe chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag rnams bsgom pa'i dus ma yin no zhes pa 'di dag gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems rgod pa dang rgod par dogs pa de'i tshe chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag rnams bsgom pa'i dus ma yin no zhes pa 'di dag gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is excited or in danger of becoming excited, it is not the right time to cultivate the enlightenment factors of full awareness, vigor, and joy.

original: ci 'di la byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so sor bsgom mam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di la byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so sor bsgom mam zhe na /
translated: Are the enlightenment factors cultivated separately?

original: 'di dag yid la byed pa bsgom pa yin par 'dod kyi mngon sum du gyur pa ni ma yin pas nyes pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag yid la byed pa bsgom pa yin par 'dod kyi mngon sum du gyur pa ni ma yin pas nyes pa med pa nyid do //
translated: They are cultivated as mental attentions, not as manifest action, so there is no fault.

original: 'di las le lo lhag pa'i sems ni zhum pa zhes bshad la /
analyzed: 'di las le lo lhag pa'i sems ni zhum pa zhes bshad la /
translated: In this text, slackness is explained as a mental state that is more depressed than it should be, and excitement is explained as a mental state that is more excited than it should be.

original: rgod pa lhag pa ni rgod pa zhes bshad pas 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: rgod pa lhag pa ni rgod pa zhes bshad pas 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction, because these two states are simultaneous.

original: de gnyis kyang lhan cig pa yin pa'i phyir sems de nyid zhum pa yang yin la de nyid rgod pa yang yin zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang lhan cig pa yin pa'i phyir sems de nyid zhum pa yang yin la de nyid rgod pa yang yin zhes smra'o //
translated: The same mental state can be both slack and excited.

original: bsam pa can gyi tshig la ni bzlog pa med kyi mdo'i dgongs pa ni 'di ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: bsam pa can gyi tshig la ni bzlog pa med kyi mdo'i dgongs pa ni 'di ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: But the intention of the sutra is not that.

original: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems thams cad 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin no zhes gang bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems thams cad 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin no zhes gang bshad pa /
translated: It has been said that all minds associated with attachment are associated with attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems @47b gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems @47b gang zhig yin /
translated: What is a mind associated with attachment?

original: gal te 'dod chags kyi thob pa dang lhan cig pa yin no zhe na ni slob pa'i sems zag pa med pa yang 'dod chags dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyi thob pa dang lhan cig pa yin no zhe na ni slob pa'i sems zag pa med pa yang 'dod chags dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a mind that is simultaneous with the obtainment of attachment, then the uncontaminated mind of a trainee would be associated with attachment.

original: gal te 'dod chags kyi dmigs pa yin no zhe na ni dgra bcom pa'i sems zag pa dang bcas pa yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes bya bar gzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyi dmigs pa yin no zhe na ni dgra bcom pa'i sems zag pa dang bcas pa yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes bya bar gzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the focal object of attachment, then the contaminated mind of an arhat would be associated with attachment.

original: 'dod chags kyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the focal object of attachment.

original: yang na ji ltar de zag pa dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar de zag pa dang bcas pa yin /
translated: Or else, how could that mind be contaminated?

original: gal te nyon mongs pa spyi ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa spyi ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that it is because it is the focal object of attachment in general,

original: de lta na yang gti mug dang bcas par gzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gti mug dang bcas par gzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: But then the mind would be grasped as associated with delusion,

original: gti mug gi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug gi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because delusion would be its object.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni thob pa la dmigs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni thob pa la dmigs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another does not have as its object the possession of the mind,

original: sems de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la dmigs pa can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sems de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la dmigs pa can yang ma yin no //
translated: nor does it have as its object the attachment that has that mind as its object.

original: de lta bas na 'dir 'dod chags dang ldan pas 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su 'dod par mi bya'o ;
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir 'dod chags dang ldan pas 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su 'dod par mi bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, in this context, one should not say that a mind is associated with attachment because it is associated with attachment.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mdo'i dgongs pa ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: mdo'i dgongs pa ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: The intention of the Sutra is that a mind associated with attachment is associated with attachment,

original: 'dod chags dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i sems ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no zhes bya bar snang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i sems ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no zhes bya bar snang ngo //
translated: and a mind not associated with attachment is free from attachment.

original: gang las 'di'i sems 'dod chags dang bral ba yin /
analyzed: gang las 'di'i sems 'dod chags dang bral ba yin /
translated: From what source does it follow that this mind is free from attachment?

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bral ba yin /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bral ba yin /
translated: It is free from hatred and free from delusion.

original: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid par phyir mi ldog pa'i chos can yin zhes gsungs pa der ni de'i thob pa dang bral ba las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid par phyir mi ldog pa'i chos can yin zhes gsungs pa der ni de'i thob pa dang bral ba las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The s≈´tra declares that one is irreversible from the state of existence of the desire realm, the state of existence of the form realm, and the state of existence of the formless realm.üîΩBut isn‚Äôt it explained that the mind concomitant with other afflictions is free from attachment because it is not concomitant with attachment?

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyang 'dod chags dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ma yin nam dgongs pa 'di ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyang 'dod chags dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ma yin nam dgongs pa 'di ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in this intention.

original: de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya bar mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya bar mi gzung ngo //
translated: It is not held to be free from attachment.

original: 'o na ci lta zhe na /üîΩzhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'o na ci lta zhe na / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par gzung ngo //
translated: What is it?üîΩIt is held to be concomitant with aversion and concomitant with delusion.

original: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: Enough with this digression.

original: grub pa'i mtha' brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' brjod par bya ste /
translated: The tenets should be stated.

original: ci pha rol gyi sems shes pa pha rol gyi sems kyi rnam pa 'am dmigs pa 'dzin zhe na /üîΩmi 'dzin to //
analyzed: ci pha rol gyi sems shes pa pha rol gyi sems kyi rnam pa 'am dmigs pa 'dzin zhe na / mi 'dzin to //
translated: Does knowledge of the mind of another grasp the aspect or object of the mind of another?
It does not grasp them.üîΩIt is

original: ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa la mi ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa la mi ltos pa yin te /
translated: not dependent on the aspect or object.

original: sems 'di chags pa yin no zhes bya bar shes kyi gzugs che ge mo zhig la chags so zhes bya bar ni mi shes so //
analyzed: sems 'di chags pa yin no zhes bya bar shes kyi gzugs che ge mo zhig la chags so zhes bya bar ni mi shes so //
translated: It knows that this mind is desirous, but it does not know that it is desirous of a certain form.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were otherwise,

original: de gzugs la dmigs par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de gzugs la dmigs par yang 'gyur la /
translated: it would also have form as its object.

original: de la dmigs pa'i pha rol gyi sems 'dzin pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i pha rol gyi sems 'dzin pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid 'dzin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And the mind of another would grasp its own nature.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa thams cad ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang / rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / da ltar byung ba dang / pha rol gyi rgyud dang 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa'i yul can mthong ba'i lam bkag pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa thams cad ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang / rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / da ltar byung ba dang / pha rol gyi rgyud dang 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa'i yul can mthong ba'i lam bkag pa dang /
translated: All knowledge of the mind of another has the nature of the mind and mental factors, the nature of substance, the present, the mind of another continuum, the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, and is not a subject that is blocked by the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la dmigs pa dang / stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang mi ldan pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pas ma bsdus pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam bkag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la dmigs pa dang / stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang mi ldan pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pas ma bsdus pa dang / bar chad med pa'i lam bkag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The path of cultivation is not associated with emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, nor with the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of nonarising, nor with the uninterrupted path.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa bshad zin to //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts has been discussed.

original: lhag ma rnam pa bcu bzhi can //
analyzed: lhag ma rnam pa bcu bzhi can //
translated: The rest have fourteen aspects,

original: stong dang bdag med ma gtogs so //
analyzed: stong dang bdag med ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding emptiness and nonself.

original: lhag ma ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ste /
translated: The rest are the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of nonarising.

original: de gnyis ni stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag ma gtogs pa rnam pa bcu bzhi can yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag ma gtogs pa rnam pa bcu bzhi can yin no //
translated: These two have fourteen aspects, excluding the aspects of emptiness and nonself.

original: don dam pa pa dag yin yang de dag gi stobs kyi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i sgo nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: don dam pa pa dag yin yang de dag gi stobs kyi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i sgo nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: Although they are ultimate, they are taught conventionally, following the power of the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of nonarising, which are conventional.üîΩThe cognition of exhaustion is taught conventionally, following the power of the cognition of exhaustion, which is ultimate.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan rab tu mi shes so zhes kun rdzob la ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan rab tu mi shes so zhes kun rdzob la ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of nonarising is taught conventionally, following the power of the cognition of nonarising, which is ultimate.

original: ci zag pa med pa la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa yod dam /
analyzed: ci zag pa med pa la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa yod dam /
translated: Do the uncontaminated have aspects of their own characteristics?

original: 'on te med ce na /
analyzed: 'on te med ce na /
translated: But if they do not exist,

original: re zhig kha che ba rnams kyi ltar na /
analyzed: re zhig kha che ba rnams kyi ltar na /
translated: then according to the Kashmiri Vaibhasikas,

original: dri med bcu drug gzhan rnams med //
analyzed: dri med bcu drug gzhan rnams med //
translated: the uncontaminated have sixteen aspects, the others do not.üîΩThe uncontaminated have sixteen aspects,

original: rnam pa bcu drug las ma gtogs pa zag pa med pa'i rnam pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug las ma gtogs pa zag pa med pa'i rnam pa med do //
translated: but the contaminated do not have aspects that are distinct from those sixteen.

original: gzhan yod ces bya bstan bcos las //
analyzed: gzhan yod ces bya bstan bcos las //
translated: The treatise declares that others exist.

original: gzhan nyi 'og pa rnams na re yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyi 'og pa rnams na re yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: The Aparntakas say that they exist.

original: ji ltar na khong du chud ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na khong du chud ce na /
translated: How do they understand this?üîΩThe treatise declares that it is so.

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The treatise declares that it is so, because it says:

original: bstan bcos las 'di skad du mi ldan pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams shes par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos las 'di skad du mi ldan pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams shes par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is it possible for the mind that does not possess the factors associated with the desire realm to know those factors?

original: shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes par 'gyur te /
translated: It is possible,

original: rigs pas bskyed pa'i sgo nas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab @48b tu skye ba dang / rkyen dang / 'di ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: rigs pas bskyed pa'i sgo nas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab @48b tu skye ba dang / rkyen dang / 'di ni gnas yod do //
translated: because it knows them through the generation of reasoning, such as impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, cause, origin, strong generation, condition and so on.

original: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩgal te gang las 'di ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo // gal te gang las 'di ni gnas yod do //
translated: This is the knowledge that the basis exists.

original: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes de snyam du shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes de snyam du shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin te /
translated: If this is the meaning of the passage, then the meaning of the passage is not that the knowledge that the basis exists is the knowledge that the object exists.

original: 'on kyang mi rtag pa la sogs pa shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi rtag pa la sogs pa shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas yod do //
translated: But rather, the knowledge that things are impermanent and so on is the knowledge that the basis exists.

original: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the knowledge that the object exists.

original: zhe na / ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: gzhan nas mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nas mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not occur elsewhere.

original: gal te 'di bstan bcos kyi don yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di bstan bcos kyi don yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If this were the meaning of the treatise,

original: 'di skad du mthong bas spang par bya ba'i sems kyis 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams shes par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di skad du mthong bas spang par bya ba'i sems kyis 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams shes par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: then it would say, ‚ÄúIs there a mind that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing that knows the phenomena of the desire realm?‚Äù

original: shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes par 'gyur te /
translated: It would say, ‚ÄúThere is such knowledge.‚Äù

original: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i sgo nas bdag dang / bdag gi dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / rgyu med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa dang / mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i sgo nas bdag dang / bdag gi dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / rgyu med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa dang / mchog dang / gtso bo dang / khyad par du 'phags pa dang /
translated: and that they are generated by improper mental activity.üîΩThey will understand the self, what belongs to the self, permanence, annihilation, causelessness, inaction, denial, supremacy, preeminence, superiority,

original: dam pa dang / dag pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'dzin par byed pa dang / nem nur dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom du shes par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dam pa dang / dag pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'dzin par byed pa dang / nem nur dang / yid gnyis dang / the tshom du shes par 'gyur zhing /
translated: purity, liberation, grasping, doubt, uncertainty, and hesitation.üîΩThey will be attached, hostile, conceited, and confused.‚Äù

original: chags pa dang / sdang ba dang / rlom pa dang / rmongs par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa der yang 'di skad du 'di ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: chags pa dang / sdang ba dang / rlom pa dang / rmongs par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa der yang 'di skad du 'di ni gnas yod do //
translated: But this is not what the Buddha said.

original: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúThis is possible, this is the case,‚Äù

original: de skad kyang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de skad kyang mi 'byung ste /
translated: but he did not say, ‚ÄúThis is the case because of this.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na 'di ni de'i don ma yin no //üîΩci rnam pa bcu drug po 'di dag ming gi sgo nas sam /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni de'i don ma yin no // ci rnam pa bcu drug po 'di dag ming gi sgo nas sam /
translated: Therefore, this is not the meaning of the Buddha‚Äôs teaching.

original: 'on te rdzas su zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rdzas su zhe na /
translated: Are these sixteen aspects taught from the point of view of name or from the point of view of substance?

original: kha cig na re rdzas su ni bdun yin la ming gi sgo nas ni bcu drug yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re rdzas su ni bdun yin la ming gi sgo nas ni bcu drug yin te /
translated: Some say: There are seven in substance but sixteen by name.

original: kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams rdzas su re re yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams rdzas su re re yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because the truths of origin, cessation and path are one in substance.

original: 'di skad du brjod de rdzas su rnam pa bcu drug go //
analyzed: 'di skad du brjod de rdzas su rnam pa bcu drug go //
translated: This is said: There are sixteen aspects in substance.

original: de la rkyen la rag lus pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la rkyen la rag lus pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Among them, impermanence is because of dependence on conditions.

original: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Suffering is because of the nature of harm.

original: bdag gir lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gir lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis stong pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is because of the discordant side of the view of mine.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bdag med pa'o //üîΩsa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis rgyu'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bdag med pa'o // sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis rgyu'o //
translated: Selflessness is because of the discordant side of the view of self.üîΩCause is because of the mode of the seed of phenomena.

original: 'byung ba'i chos kyi tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i chos kyi tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: Origin is because of the mode of the arising of phenomena.

original: 'brel ba'i tshul gyis rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel ba'i tshul gyis rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: Production is because of the mode of connection.

original: @49a * // mngon par sgrub pa'i don gyis ni rkyen te /
analyzed: @49a * // mngon par sgrub pa'i don gyis ni rkyen te /
translated: Condition is because of the meaning of establishment.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu dang thal zhar dang 'khor lo dang thag gu dang chu rnams 'dus pa las bum pa mngon par grub pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu dang thal zhar dang 'khor lo dang thag gu dang chu rnams 'dus pa las bum pa mngon par grub pa de bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a pot that is produced from the combination of a lump of clay, a stick, a wheel, a thread, and water.

original: phung po zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: phung po zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is cessation because the aggregates are destroyed.

original: me gsum zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: me gsum zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace because the three fires are extinguished.

original: 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
translated: It is sublime because it is free from harm.

original: skyon thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skyon thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is definite emergence because it is free from all faults.

original: bgrod pa'i don gyis lam mo //üîΩrigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs pa'o //
analyzed: bgrod pa'i don gyis lam mo // rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs pa'o //
translated: It is the path because it has the meaning of going.üîΩIt is correct because it is endowed with reasoning.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i don gyis sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i don gyis sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is practice because it has the meaning of correct accomplishment.

original: shin tu yang dag par 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu yang dag par 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is definite release because it causes the attainment of complete transcendence.

original: yang na gtan du ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //üîΩkhur lta bur gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na gtan du ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o // khur lta bur gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, it is impermanent because it is not permanent.

original: sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: It is suffering because it is like a burden.

original: nang gi skyes bu dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi skyes bu dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty because it is free from an inner being.

original: 'dod dgur byed pa med pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o //üîΩ'ong ba'i tshul gyis rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'dod dgur byed pa med pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o // 'ong ba'i tshul gyis rgyu'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúselfless‚Äù because it is not a self that can do as it pleases.üîΩIt is a ‚Äúcause‚Äù in the sense of a coming.

original: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is an ‚Äúorigin‚Äù in the sense of a going forth.

original: 'phel ba'i tshul gyis rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i tshul gyis rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: It is a ‚Äúproduction‚Äù in the sense of an increase.

original: so sor 'brad ba'i tshul gyis rkyen no //
analyzed: so sor 'brad ba'i tshul gyis rkyen no //
translated: It is a ‚Äúcondition‚Äù in the sense of a separate contact.

original: 'brel ba med pas 'brel pa zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel ba med pas 'brel pa zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is a ‚Äúcessation‚Äù because it is the destruction of the connection with the absence of a connection.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang 'bral ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang 'bral ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúpeaceful‚Äù because it is free from the three characteristics of conditioned states.

original: dge ba'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúexcellent‚Äù because it is virtuous.

original: yid brtan pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yid brtan pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is a ‚Äúdefinite release‚Äù because it is the highest refuge.

original: lam ngan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis lam mo //
analyzed: lam ngan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis lam mo //
translated: It is a ‚Äúpath‚Äù because it is the opposite of a bad path.

original: rigs pa ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis rigs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis rigs pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù because it is the opposite of incorrect.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong dang / mi 'gal ba'i don gyis sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong dang / mi 'gal ba'i don gyis sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúpractice‚Äù because it is not in conflict with the city of nirvana.

original: srid pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is a ‚Äúdefinite issue‚Äù because it is the antidote to all of existence.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa brjod par bya ste skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa brjod par bya ste skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
translated: We will explain them as they are understood. Impermanent because it is subject to arising and cessation.

original: mi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Unsatisfactory because it is in disagreement with it.

original: bdag dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: Empty because it is devoid of a self.

original: bdag nyid kyis bdag ma yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o //üîΩrgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen nyid ni gang mdo las nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bdag ma yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o // rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen nyid ni gang mdo las nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can /
translated: Nonself because it is not a self, that is, because it is not a master.üîΩThe causes, the origin, the production, the appearance of the five appropriative aggregates are craving.

original: 'dun pa las kun 'byung ba /üîΩ'dun pa dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: 'dun pa las kun 'byung ba / 'dun pa dang 'dra ba /
translated: Craving is the origin of the five appropriative aggregates.üîΩCraving is the cause of the five appropriative aggregates.

original: 'dun pa las rab tu skye ba dag yin no zhes gsungs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dun pa las rab tu skye ba dag yin no zhes gsungs pa kho na yin te /
translated: Craving is the production of the five appropriative aggregates.

original: rab tu skye ba zhes bya ba'i sgra tha mar gdon ba 'ba' zhig tu @49b zad do //
analyzed: rab tu skye ba zhes bya ba'i sgra tha mar gdon ba 'ba' zhig tu @49b zad do //
translated: The word production is added to the end of the above four sentences.

original: yang 'di dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yang 'di dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between these four?

original: 'dun pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Craving is of four types:

original: nga'o snyam pa ni bye brag med par lus pa 'dun pa yin no //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa ni bye brag med par lus pa 'dun pa yin no //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is the desire for the mere continuation of the self without distinction.

original: gyur cig snyam pa ni bye brag tu med par yang srid pa la 'dun pa yin no //üîΩ'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa ni /
analyzed: gyur cig snyam pa ni bye brag tu med par yang srid pa la 'dun pa yin no // 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa ni /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúMay I be‚Äù is the desire for the mere continuation of the self without distinction.

original: bye brag tu yang srid pa la 'dun pa yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu yang srid pa la 'dun pa yin no //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúMay I be like this‚Äù is the desire for a particular kind of future existence.üîΩThe thought ‚ÄúMay I exist‚Äù is the desire for a particular kind of future existence.

original: bzhi pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba la 'dun pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'ching ba la 'dun pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is the desire for the fetter of rebirth.

original: yang na las mngon par 'du byed pa la 'dun pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na las mngon par 'du byed pa la 'dun pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the fourth is the desire for the performance of action.

original: de la dang po ni sdug bsngal gyi dang po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni sdug bsngal gyi dang po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Among these, the first is the root cause of suffering, because it is the cause of the first suffering.

original: 'bras bu'i sa bon bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sa bon bzhin no //
translated: It is like the seed of a fruit.

original: gnyis pa ni kun 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni kun 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The second is the origin of suffering,

original: des de yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des de yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the cause of the production of suffering.

original: 'bras bu'i myu gu la sogs pa skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i myu gu la sogs pa skye ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the production of the sprout of a fruit.

original: gsum pa ni de dang 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rkyen yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni de dang 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rkyen yin te /
translated: The third is the condition of suffering,

original: 'bras bu'i zhing dang chu dang lud la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i zhing dang chu dang lud la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a field, water, fertilizer, etc. for the production of a fruit.

original: zhing la sogs pa'i dbang gis ni 'bras bu'i dri dang ro dang / nus pa dang / smin pa dang mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhing la sogs pa'i dbang gis ni 'bras bu'i dri dang ro dang / nus pa dang / smin pa dang mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The field, etc., are the cause of the fruit's smell, taste, potency, ripening, and strength.

original: bzhi pa ni rab tu skye ba ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rab tu skye ba ste /
translated: The fourth is the fruit of human action, because it is the fruit of the action of the person.

original: de kho na las de skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i tha ma me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: de kho na las de skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i tha ma me tog bzhin no //
translated: The last fruit is like a flower, because it is the cause of the fruit of human action.

original: yang na sred pa rnam par spyad pa rnams kyi 'dun pa bzhi ni sred pa'i bye brag rnams las lnga tshan gnyis dang / bzhi tshan gnyis yin te /
analyzed: yang na sred pa rnam par spyad pa rnams kyi 'dun pa bzhi ni sred pa'i bye brag rnams las lnga tshan gnyis dang / bzhi tshan gnyis yin te /
translated: Or else, the four kinds of aspiration of those who practice craving are two groups of five and two groups of four, which are the varieties of craving.

original: dge slong dag nga'o snyam pa yod na nga 'di lta bu'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge slong dag nga'o snyam pa yod na nga 'di lta bu'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Monks, if there is the thought I am, there arises the thought I am thus,

original: nga ni 'di 'dra'o snyam pa dang / nga de lta ma yin no snyam pa dang / nga bzang ngo snyam pa dang / nga ngan no snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga ni 'di 'dra'o snyam pa dang / nga de lta ma yin no snyam pa dang / nga bzang ngo snyam pa dang / nga ngan no snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I am like this, I am not like this, I am good, and I am bad.

original: de la 'byung bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la 'byung bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam par 'gyur zhing /
translated: With regard to that, there arises the thought I will come to be.

original: de la 'byung bar 'gyur bar mi bya'o snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'byung bar 'gyur bar mi bya'o snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur bar bya'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúMay it not occur‚Äù arises, the thought ‚ÄúMay it occur in such a way,‚Äù the thought ‚ÄúMay it occur in that way,‚Äù the thought ‚ÄúMay it not occur in that way.‚Äù

original: de la gyur cig snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la gyur cig snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúMay it be‚Äù arises,

original: de la 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa dang / de 'dra bar gyur cig snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur cig snyam pa dang / gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa dang / de 'dra bar gyur cig snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur cig snyam pa dang / gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang /
translated: the thought ‚ÄúMay it be in such a way,‚Äù the thought ‚ÄúMay it be in that way,‚Äù the thought ‚ÄúMay it not be in that way,‚Äù the thought ‚ÄúHow good it would be if it were,‚Äù the thought ‚ÄúHow good it would be if it were in such a way,‚Äù

original: 'di 'dra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur @50a * //üîΩro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'dra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur @50a * // ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the thought ‚ÄúHow good it would be if it were in that way,‚Äù the thought ‚ÄúHow good it would be if it were not in that way.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa med pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa med pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is cessation because there is no longer any engagement.

original: sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir zhi ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir zhi ba ste /
translated: It is peace because it is free from suffering.

original: dge slong dag de ltar na 'du byed rnams ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na 'du byed rnams ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Bhikshus, thus conditioned states are suffering,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and nirvana is peace.

original: gong na med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: gong na med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
translated: It is sublime because there is nothing higher.

original: yang phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is emancipation because there is no return.

original: lam lta bur gyur pa'i phyir lam mo //
analyzed: lam lta bur gyur pa'i phyir lam mo //
translated: It is the path because it is like a path.

original: yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du zhugs pa'i phyir rigs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du zhugs pa'i phyir rigs pa'o //
translated: It is correct because it is engaged in accordance with reality.

original: so sor nges pa'i phyir sgrub ba ste /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i phyir sgrub ba ste /
translated: It is practice because it is individually discerned.

original: ji skad du mthong ba rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir 'di lam yin gyi gzhan ni med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du mthong ba rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir 'di lam yin gyi gzhan ni med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThis is the path, there is no other, for the purification of insight and for the attainment of heaven and liberation.

original: gtan du nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: gtan du nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa'o //
translated: It is the emancipator because it causes emancipation that is permanent.

original: yang na rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag gi dang / bdag tu lta pa spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por go rims bzhin du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: yang na rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag gi dang / bdag tu lta pa spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por go rims bzhin du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
translated: Or else, the aspects of impermanence, suffering, empty, and selflessness are the antidotes to the views of permanence, happiness, purity, and a self, respectively.

original: rgyu med pa dang / rgyu gcig pu dang / 'gyur ba dang / blo sngar btang ba dang / lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por go rims bzhin du rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang / rgyu gcig pu dang / 'gyur ba dang / blo sngar btang ba dang / lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por go rims bzhin du rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa dag yin no //
translated: The aspects of cause, origin, strong generation, and condition are the antidotes to the views that there is no cause, that there is only one cause, that causes are transformed, and that there is no antecedent cause, respectively.

original: thar pa med do snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por 'gog pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: thar pa med do snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por 'gog pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of cessation is the antidote to the view that there is no liberation.

original: sdug bsngal la thar pa yin no snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen bor zhi ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la thar pa yin no snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen bor zhi ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of peace is the antidote to the view that suffering is liberation.

original: bsam gtan gyi bde ba gya nom pa yin par lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por gya nom pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bde ba gya nom pa yin par lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por gya nom pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of excellence is the antidote to the view that the bliss of the absorptions is excellence.

original: yang dang yang yongs su nyams bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas thar ba ni gtan du ma yin no snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa yin no //üîΩlam med do snyam pa dang / lam 'di yin no snyam pa dang / gzhan yang lam yin no snyam pa dang / lam 'di yang lhag go snyam du lta bar spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por go rims bzhin du lam dang / regs pa dang /
analyzed: yang dang yang yongs su nyams bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas thar ba ni gtan du ma yin no snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa yin no // lam med do snyam pa dang / lam 'di yin no snyam pa dang / gzhan yang lam yin no snyam pa dang / lam 'di yang lhag go snyam du lta bar spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por go rims bzhin du lam dang / regs pa dang /
translated: The aspect of definite emergence is the antidote to the view that liberation is not permanent because it degenerates again and again.üîΩThe aspects of path, correct method,

original: sgrub pa dang / des par 'byin pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang / des par 'byin pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
translated: accomplishment and definite release are respectively the antidotes to the view that there is no path, that this is the path, that this is another path and that this path is incomplete.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is the phenomenon called an aspect?

original: rnam pa shes rab /
analyzed: rnam pa shes rab /
translated: An aspect is wisdom.

original: de lta na ni 'o na shes rab gzhan dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na shes rab gzhan dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then wisdom would not be concomitant with others.
