original: shes rab rnam pa dang bcas @50b par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa dang bcas @50b par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: but not as having an aspect.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i bye brag ni rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i bye brag ni rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is reasonable to say that an aspect is the particular mode in which the mind and mental factors apprehend their object.

original: yang ci shes rab kho nas 'dzin par byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci shes rab kho nas 'dzin par byed dam zhe na /
translated: Does only wisdom apprehend?

original: smras bam yin no //
analyzed: smras bam yin no //
translated: No, it is said.

original: 'on ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pas 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: de dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pas 'dzin par byed /
translated: It is apprehended by that which possesses it, i.e., by the mind and mental factors that possess the object.

original: shes rab dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos gzhan thams cad kyis kyang 'dzin par byed do //üîΩyod pa thams cad gzung bya yin //
analyzed: shes rab dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos gzhan thams cad kyis kyang 'dzin par byed do // yod pa thams cad gzung bya yin //
translated: It is also apprehended by wisdom and by all other dharmas that possess an object.üîΩEverything that exists is apprehended.

original: gang ci yod kyang rung thams cad gzung bar bya ba yin no //üîΩde ltar byas na shes rab ni rnam ba yang yin /
analyzed: gang ci yod kyang rung thams cad gzung bar bya ba yin no // de ltar byas na shes rab ni rnam ba yang yin /
translated: Whatever exists is apprehended.

original: 'dzin par byed pa yang yin /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa yang yin /
translated: Thus, wisdom is both an aspect and that which apprehends.

original: gzung bar bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba yang yin no //
translated: It is also apprehended by other dharmas.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa gzhan ni 'dzin par byed pa dang / gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa gzhan ni 'dzin par byed pa dang / gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The others, which are associated with a cognitive object, are both.

original: dmigs pa med pa rnams ni gzung bar bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa rnams ni gzung bar bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: Those that are not associated with a cognitive object are only the cognitive object of the mental consciousness.

original: 'di man chad ni shes pa bcu po 'di dag gi dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni shes pa bcu po 'di dag gi dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste /
translated: From here on, the author will explain the distinctions of the ten cognitions as wholesome, etc.üîΩThe first is of three types; the others are wholesome.

original: dang po rnam gsum gzhan rnams dge / kun rdzob shes pa ni tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po ni yod pa'i phyir dang po ste /
analyzed: dang po rnam gsum gzhan rnams dge / kun rdzob shes pa ni tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po ni yod pa'i phyir dang po ste /
translated: Conventional cognition is the first, because it exists.

original: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: It is of three types: wholesome, unwholesome, nondefined.

original: shes pa gzhan dgu ni dge ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan dgu ni dge ba kho na yin no //
translated: The other nine cognitions are wholesome only.

original: dang pos rnams thams cad na /
analyzed: dang pos rnams thams cad na /
translated: The first exists in all the stages.

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar na yod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar na yod do //
translated: It exists from the realm of desire up to the summit of cyclic existence.

original: drug na chos shes bya /
analyzed: drug na chos shes bya /
translated: The cognition of the factors exists in six stages.

original: chos shes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / mi lcogs pa med ba dang / bsam gtan khyad par can na yod do //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / mi lcogs pa med ba dang / bsam gtan khyad par can na yod do //
translated: The cognition of the factors exists in the six stages: the four meditations, the intermediate meditation and the realm of desire.

original: dgu na rjes shes bya ba /
analyzed: dgu na rjes shes bya ba /
translated: The ninth is called subsequent cognition.

original: rjes su shes pa ni sa drug po de dag nyid dang gzugs med pa gsum na yod do //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ni sa drug po de dag nyid dang gzugs med pa gsum na yod do //
translated: Subsequent cognition exists in the six levels of the realm of fine-materiality and in the three stages of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are like the cognition of the factors with regard to the four noble truths.üîΩThe cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, like the cognition of the factors, in the nine stages.

original: de bzhin du drug / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog ba dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyang bye brag med bar ni sa dgu po de dag nyid na yod do //üîΩdbye ba ni chos shes pas bsdus pa rnams ni sa drug na yod do//
analyzed: de bzhin du drug / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog ba dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyang bye brag med bar ni sa dgu po de dag nyid na yod do // dbye ba ni chos shes pas bsdus pa rnams ni sa drug na yod do//
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, like the cognition of the factors, in the nine stages.

original: rjes su shes pas bsdus pa rnams ni sa dgu na yod do //üîΩgzhan yid shes pa bsam gtan bzhi //
analyzed: rjes su shes pas bsdus pa rnams ni sa dgu na yod do // gzhan yid shes pa bsam gtan bzhi //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, like the cognition of the factors, in the nine stages.üîΩThe cognition of another's thoughts is in the four meditations.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi kho na na yod kyi gzhan na med do //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi kho na na yod kyi gzhan na med do //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts is in the four meditations, not elsewhere.

original: de na 'dod dang gzugs rten can //
analyzed: de na 'dod dang gzugs rten can //
translated: It is manifested in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa de ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi @51a * //üîΩkhams dag tu mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa de ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi @51a * // khams dag tu mngon sum du byed do //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts is manifested in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: chos shes bya ba 'dod rten can //
analyzed: chos shes bya ba 'dod rten can //
translated: The cognition of the factors is manifested in the realm of desire.

original: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten can kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten can kho na yin gyi /
translated: The cognition of the factors is supported by a body of the realm of desire.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu ni mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu ni mngon sum du mi byed do //
translated: It is not realized in the realm of fine-materiality or in the realm of immateriality.

original: khams gsum pa yi rten can gzhan //
analyzed: khams gsum pa yi rten can gzhan //
translated: The others are supported by the three realms.

original: gzhan gang zhe na ;
analyzed: gzhan gang zhe na ;
translated: Which ones?

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / chos shes pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / chos shes pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts and the cognition of exhaustion and of non-arising, with the exception of the cognition of the factors.

original: sa dag dang rten bshad zin to //
analyzed: sa dag dang rten bshad zin to //
translated: The stages and the persons who can acquire the cognitions have been discussed.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis bsdus pa brjod par bya ste /üîΩde smras pa /üîΩ'gog blo dran pa nyer gzhag pa //üîΩgcig ste blo dang shes rab dang // shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis bsdus pa brjod par bya ste / de smras pa / 'gog blo dran pa nyer gzhag pa // gcig ste blo dang shes rab dang // shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
translated: We must now explain the relationship between the applications of mindfulness and the cognitions.üîΩThe cognition of cessation is one application of mindfulness.

original: 'gog pa shes pa ni gcig ste /üîΩchos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ni gcig ste / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of cessation is one application of mindfulness, namely, the application of mindfulness to the factors.

original: pha rol gyi sems blo ni gsum mo //üîΩpha rol gyi sems shes pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems blo ni gsum mo // pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni gsum ste /
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts is three applications of mindfulness.

original: tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran ba nye bar gzhag pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran ba nye bar gzhag pa rnams yin no //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts is three applications of mindfulness, namely, the applications of mindfulness to the factors, to the mind, and to the factors and the mind.

original: lhag ma bzhi yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma bzhi yin no //
translated: The other cognitions are four applications of mindfulness.üîΩThe other cognitions are four applications of mindfulness.

original: 'gog pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dag las gzhan pa'i shes pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dag las gzhan pa'i shes pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no //
translated: The other cognitions are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: shes pa gang gis dmigs pa shes pa du zhig yin zhe na /üîΩchos blo'i spyod yul dgu yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gang gis dmigs pa shes pa du zhig yin zhe na / chos blo'i spyod yul dgu yin no //
translated: How many cognitions are there in the cognitive object of each cognition?üîΩNine cognitions are the object of the cognition of the factors.

original: chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ni shes pa dgu yin te ;
analyzed: chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ni shes pa dgu yin te ;
translated: The cognition of the factors has nine cognitions for its object,

original: rjes su shes pa ma gtogs so //üîΩlam rjes blo yi dgu yin no //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ma gtogs so // lam rjes blo yi dgu yin no //
translated: with the exception of the subsequent cognition.üîΩNine cognitions are the object of the cognition of another‚Äôs thoughts.

original: rjes su shes pa'i dmigs pa yang shes pa dgu yin te /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i dmigs pa yang shes pa dgu yin te /
translated: The cognition of another‚Äôs thoughts has nine cognitions for its object,

original: chos shes pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: chos shes pa ma gtogs so //
translated: with the exception of the cognition of the factors.üîΩNine cognitions are the object of the cognition of the path.

original: lam shes pa'i dmigs pa yang dgu yin te /
analyzed: lam shes pa'i dmigs pa yang dgu yin te /
translated: The cognition of the path has nine cognitions for its object,

original: kun rdzob shes pa ma gtogs so //üîΩsdug bsngal rgyu blo'i gnyis yin no ;
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ma gtogs so // sdug bsngal rgyu blo'i gnyis yin no ;
translated: with the exception of the cognition of the conventional.üîΩTwo cognitions are the object of the cognition of unsatisfactoriness and of the cognition of the origin.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag gi dmigs pa dag ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag gi dmigs pa dag ni gnyis te /
translated: The cognition of unsatisfactoriness and the cognition of the origin have two cognitions for their object,

original: kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa yin no //
translated: the cognition of the conventional and the cognition of another‚Äôs thoughts.

original: bzhi yi bcu yin /
analyzed: bzhi yi bcu yin /
translated: Ten cognitions are the object of the cognition of cessation and of the cognition of the path.üîΩThe cognition of cessation and the cognition of the path have ten cognitions for their object.

original: kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni shes pa bcu char yang yin no //üîΩgcig gi min /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni shes pa bcu char yang yin no // gcig gi min /
translated: The conventional cognition, the cognition of another's thoughts, the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising have ten cognitions for their cognitive object.üîΩThe cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising do not have the cognition of another's thoughts for their cognitive object, for this latter has only the factors associated with the thought-continuum of another for its object-field.

original: 'gog pa shes pa ni gcig phu'i dmigs pa ni shes pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ni gcig phu'i dmigs pa ni shes pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The cognition of cessation does not have any cognition for its object.

original: chos bcu dag ni sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: chos bcu dag ni sbyar bar bya /
translated: The ten factors should be combined.

original: bcu gang dag ce na /
analyzed: bcu gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the ten factors?

original: khams gsum pa dang dri med chos //
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang dri med chos //
translated: The factors of the three realms and pure factors.

original: 'dus ma byas rnams gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams gnyis gnyis so //
translated: The unconditioned factors are divided into two categories.

original: chos 'dus byas rnams la @51b 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med ba na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad du bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'dus byas rnams la @51b 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med ba na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad du bya'o //
translated: The conditioned factors are divided into eight categories: factors of the realm of desire, factors of the realm of fine-materiality, factors of the realm of immateriality, pure factors, each of these four categories being either associated with thought or non-associated with thought.

original: 'dus ma byas rnams la dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis rnam ba gnyis su bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams la dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis rnam ba gnyis su bya'o //
translated: The unconditioned factors are divided into two categories: wholesome and non-defined.

original: chos bcu po 'di dag ji ltar sbyar bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos bcu po 'di dag ji ltar sbyar bar bya zhe na /
translated: How are the ten factors combined?

original: shes pa gang gis dmigs pa du zhig yin zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa gang gis dmigs pa du zhig yin zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The question should be asked, ‚ÄúHow many objects does any consciousness have?‚Äù

original: de la kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos bcu po thams cad yin no //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos bcu po thams cad yin no //
translated: Conventional knowledge has all ten as its object.

original: chos shes pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa ni lnga ste /
translated: Knowledge of the truth of Dharma has five as its object:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / gzhi dang / 'dus ma byas dge ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / gzhi dang / 'dus ma byas dge ba yin no //
translated: the five that are virtuous unconditioned states and uncontaminated states in the desire realm.

original: rjes su shes pa ni bdun te /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ni bdun te /
translated: Knowledge of the truth of subsequent suffering has seven as its object:

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / drug dang / 'dus ma byas dge ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / drug dang / 'dus ma byas dge ba yin no //
translated: the six that are virtuous unconditioned states and uncontaminated states in the form and formless realms.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung shes pa dag gi ni drug ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung shes pa dag gi ni drug ste /
translated: Knowledge of the truths of origin and path have six as their object:

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams yin no //
translated: those that are contaminated in the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: 'gog pa shes pa'i ni gcig ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa'i ni gcig ste /
translated: Knowledge of the truth of cessation has one as its object:

original: 'dus ma byas dge ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas dge ba kho na yin no //
translated: only the virtuous unconditioned state.

original: lam shes pa'i ni gnyis te /
analyzed: lam shes pa'i ni gnyis te /
translated: Knowledge of the truth of the path has two as its object:

original: zag pa med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dag yin no //
translated: the two uncontaminated states.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i ni gsum ste /
translated: Knowledge of others‚Äô minds has three as its object:

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa dang mtshungs par ldan ba rnams yin no //üîΩzad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ni chos dgu yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa dang mtshungs par ldan ba rnams yin no // zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ni chos dgu yin te /
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are associated with the realm of desire, the realm of fine-materiality, the realm of immateriality, and the pure realm.üîΩThe cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising have nine factors as their cognitive object, with the exception of the unconditioned factor which is neutral.

original: 'dus ma byas lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising have nine factors as their cognitive object, with the exception of the unconditioned factor which is neutral.

original: shes pa gcig gis chos thams cad shes par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa gcig gis chos thams cad shes par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there a single cognition which cognizes all factors?üîΩNo.

original: med do / 'on kyang /üîΩkun rdzob gcig pus rang tshogs las //üîΩgzhan ni bdag med nyid rigs 'gyur //
analyzed: med do / 'on kyang / kun rdzob gcig pus rang tshogs las // gzhan ni bdag med nyid rigs 'gyur //
translated: However,üîΩthe conventional cognition cognizes all factors of its own stage and of another stage, as being without a self.

original: kun rdzob shes pas ni rang gi tshogs las gzhan pa'i chos thams cad ni bdag med ba'i zhes bdag med pa nyid du shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pas ni rang gi tshogs las gzhan pa'i chos thams cad ni bdag med ba'i zhes bdag med pa nyid du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The conventional cognition cognizes all factors of its own stage and of another stage, as being without a self.

original: de'i rang gi tshogs ni rang gi ngo bo dang de dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang gi tshogs ni rang gi ngo bo dang de dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i chos rnams yin te /
translated: The factors of its own stage are the factors of the realm of desire, the realm of fine-materiality, the realm of immateriality, the pure realm.

original: de dag ni yul dang yul can tha dad pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir dang / ha cang nye ba'i phyir mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: de dag ni yul dang yul can tha dad pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir dang / ha cang nye ba'i phyir mi 'dzin to //
translated: They do not grasp the mind of another, because the object and subject are different, because the object is single, and because it is too close.

original: de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa ni thos pa dang / bsam pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa ni thos pa dang / bsam pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the mind of another in the realm of desire is derived from listening and reflection.

original: gzugs na spyod pa ni thos pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa ni thos pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: In the realm of form, it is derived from listening.

original: bsgom pa las byung ba ni ma yin te /üîΩde ni sa rnam pa chad pa las @52a * //
analyzed: bsgom pa las byung ba ni ma yin te / de ni sa rnam pa chad pa las @52a * //
translated: It is not derived from cultivation,

original: dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of a stage that is discontinuous.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad las cig car 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad las cig car 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, one would be detached from all at one time.

original: 'di ni rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'di ni rdzogs so /
translated: This is the end of the exposition of the mind of another.

original: // / gang zhig shes pa du dang ldan //
analyzed: // / gang zhig shes pa du dang ldan //
translated: How many cognitions does one possess when one possesses a certain cognition?

original: zhes bya ba 'di brjod bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di brjod bar bya ste /
translated: This is what we will explain now.

original: re zhig so so'i skye bo ni kun rdzob shes pa gcig bu dang ldan no //
analyzed: re zhig so so'i skye bo ni kun rdzob shes pa gcig bu dang ldan no //
translated: The ordinary man possesses only conventional cognition.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang yang ldan no //
translated: If he is detached, he also possesses the cognition of the mind of another.

original: 'phags pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni /
translated: The noble ones,

original: zag med skad cig dang po la //
analyzed: zag med skad cig dang po la //
translated: One possessing uncontaminated states possesses one.

original: chags can shes pa gcig dang ldan //
analyzed: chags can shes pa gcig dang ldan //
translated: One possessing attachment possesses one.

original: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig yin na /
translated: If one is not free from attachment to the desire realm,

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la kun rdzob shes pa gcig kho na dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la kun rdzob shes pa gcig kho na dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: one possesses one conventional knowledge alone, since one possesses perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: gnyis pa la gsum /üîΩsdug bsngal la chos shes pa la ni kun rdzob shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la gsum / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la ni kun rdzob shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa ste /
translated: One possessing three possesses three.

original: gsum dang ldan no //üîΩyan chad ni /
analyzed: gsum dang ldan no // yan chad ni /
translated: One possessing three possesses three: conventional knowledge, Dharma knowledge and knowledge of the truth of suffering.üîΩOne possessing four possesses four.

original: bzhi la re re 'phel dang ldan //üîΩde yan chad kyi skad cig ma bzhi la ni /üîΩde la shes pa re re /üîΩ'phel bar shes bar bya ste /
analyzed: bzhi la re re 'phel dang ldan // de yan chad kyi skad cig ma bzhi la ni / de la shes pa re re / 'phel bar shes bar bya ste /
translated: One possessing four possesses four:

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes ba la ni rjes su shes pa 'phel la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes ba la ni rjes su shes pa 'phel la /
translated: conventional knowledge, Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge and knowledge of the truth of suffering.üîΩOne possessing five possesses five.üîΩOne possessing five possesses five:üîΩconventional knowledge, Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of the truth of suffering and knowledge of the truth of origin.

original: kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa rnams la ni kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams 'phel bas lam la chos shes pa la shes pa bdun dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa rnams la ni kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams 'phel bas lam la chos shes pa la shes pa bdun dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of the factors with regard to the origin, the cessation, the path, are accompanied by seven cognitions, because the cognition of the origin, the cessation, the path are added to the four above-mentioned cognitions.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni thams cad du gzhan gyi sems shes pa lhag par ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni thams cad du gzhan gyi sems shes pa lhag par ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: If the person is detached, he is accompanied by the cognition of another's thoughts.

original: yang na gnas skabs gang du shes pa du dag cig 'thob ce na /
analyzed: yang na gnas skabs gang du shes pa du dag cig 'thob ce na /
translated: In which state does one acquire how many cognitions?üîΩThe future cognitions are acquired in the path of insight,

original: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa ji ltar skyes pa rnams //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa ji ltar skyes pa rnams //
translated: to the extent that the acceptances and the cognitions arise.üîΩIn the path of insight, one acquires the future cognitions, to the extent that the acceptances or cognitions arise.

original: ma 'ongs pa 'thob /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'thob /
translated: One acquires four future cognitions, namely:

original: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa'am /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa'am /
translated: the cognition of the factors with regard to the truth presently seen,üîΩthe cognition of the mind of another, when this cognition is of the family of the cognition of the factors,üîΩthe cognition of exhaustion,

original: shes pa gang dang gang skyes pa de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi kho na 'thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa gang dang gang skyes pa de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi kho na 'thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the cognition of non-arising.

original: ci'i phyir / mthong ba'i lam la shes pa dang // rnam ba 'dra ba kho na 'thob ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / mthong ba'i lam la shes pa dang // rnam ba 'dra ba kho na 'thob ce na /
translated: Why does one acquire only cognitions of the same aspect as the present cognitions?

original: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has not acquired the family of the other cognitions.

original: de nyid las /
analyzed: de nyid las /
translated: The same text states:

original: rjes gsum la ni kun rdzob kyang //
analyzed: rjes gsum la ni kun rdzob kyang //
translated: On the three subsequent cognitions, conventional knowledge is also obtained.

original: mthong ba'i lam de nyid la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes ba gsum la kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo //üîΩchos shes pa @52b la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam de nyid la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes ba gsum la kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo // chos shes pa @52b la ni ma yin te /
translated: On the path of seeing, one obtains conventional knowledge on the three subsequent cognitions of the truths of suffering, origin and cessation.

original: bden pa zad par mngon par ma rtogs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa zad par mngon par ma rtogs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not obtained on Dharma knowledge because one does not fully comprehend the truths.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mngon rtogs mtha' zhes bya ba /üîΩde nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob shes pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mngon rtogs mtha' zhes bya ba / de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob shes pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore it is called the end of realization.

original: bden pa re re mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes la 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa re re mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes la 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore that conventional knowledge is called arisen from the end of realization because it is obtained subsequent to the realization of each truth.

original: ci'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa na 'thob bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa na 'thob bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not obtained on subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path?

original: lam gyi bden ba ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang / zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi bden ba ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang / zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the truth of the path is not fully comprehended by the mundane path and it is not fully comprehended.

original: sdug bsngal zad par yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang ; 'gog pa mngon du bya bar ni nus kyi /üîΩlam ni zad par bsgom par mi nus pas mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad par yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang ; 'gog pa mngon du bya bar ni nus kyi / lam ni zad par bsgom par mi nus pas mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir /
translated: One can completely understand the truth of suffering, abandon the truth of origin, and realize the truth of cessation.üîΩBut one cannot cultivate the truth of the path to the point of exhausting it.

original: de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba mi 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, one does not obtain the result of the ‚Äúnever-returner‚Äù at the end of the realization of the truths.

original: de'i tshe kun 'byung ba la yang thams cad spangs pa ma yin pas mngon par rtogs ba'i mtha' las byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe kun 'byung ba la yang thams cad spangs pa ma yin pas mngon par rtogs ba'i mtha' las byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: At that time, one has not abandoned all the origin of suffering, so one does not obtain the result of the ‚Äúnever-returner‚Äù at the end of realization.

original: de'i bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba thams cad spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba thams cad spangs pa yin no //
translated: But one has abandoned all the origin of suffering that is to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: lam ni rigs mang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lam ni rigs mang ba'i phyir /
translated: The path is a great antidote to the origin of suffering.

original: mthong bas spang ba'i gnyen por thams cad bsgom par mi nus pas khyad par cher yod do //
analyzed: mthong bas spang ba'i gnyen por thams cad bsgom par mi nus pas khyad par cher yod do //
translated: But one cannot cultivate all the antidotes to the origin of suffering that are to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: gzhan dag na re mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Because it is the retinue of the path of vision.

original: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a means of knowing because it is what is to be known.

original: ci kun rdzob shes pa mngon par rtogs ba'i mtha' las byung ba de res 'ga' mngon sum du byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci kun rdzob shes pa mngon par rtogs ba'i mtha' las byung ba de res 'ga' mngon sum du byed dam zhe na /
translated: Does conventional knowledge that arises at the end of the realization of the truths ever manifest?

original: nam yang mi byed de /
analyzed: nam yang mi byed de /
translated: It never manifests.

original: gcig kho nar de ni mi skye ba'i chos can yin /
analyzed: gcig kho nar de ni mi skye ba'i chos can yin /
translated: It is a future dharma that will never arise.

original: ji ltar na de thob pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar na de thob pa yin te /
translated: How can it be obtained?

original: ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is obtained when what was not previously obtained is obtained.

original: da ni gal te de mngon sum du bya ba mi nus pa kho na yin na ji ltar na de rnyed pa yin /
analyzed: da ni gal te de mngon sum du bya ba mi nus pa kho na yin na ji ltar na de rnyed pa yin /
translated: But if it is impossible for it to manifest, how can it be obtained?

original: thob pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: thob pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: It is obtained through obtainment.

original: gang gi phyir rnyed pa de'i phyir rnyed do zhes ston pa 'di ni sngon ma byung ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnyed pa de'i phyir rnyed do zhes ston pa 'di ni sngon ma byung ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The fact that it is obtained is taught by the statement, ‚ÄúIt is obtained because it is obtained.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na de lta na ni thob pa mi 'grub pa nyid kyis sngon gyi slob dpon dag ji skad zer ba de lta na 'grub bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de lta na ni thob pa mi 'grub pa nyid kyis sngon gyi slob dpon dag ji skad zer ba de lta na 'grub bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since the obtainment of conventional knowledge is not established in this way, it is established in the way the former masters explained it.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon dag ji skad zer zhe na /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon dag ji skad zer zhe na /
translated: How did the former masters explain it?

original: 'jig rten las 'das ba'i lam gyi mthus de las langs nas 'jig rten pa'i shes pa ches khyad par du 'phags @53a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das ba'i lam gyi mthus de las langs nas 'jig rten pa'i shes pa ches khyad par du 'phags @53a * //
translated: Having arisen from that through the power of the supramundane path, a mundane consciousness that is very special arises.üîΩ

original: pa bden pa la dmigs ba mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba kun rdzob shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa bden pa la dmigs ba mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba kun rdzob shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the power of the transcendent path, one rises from that and a conventional knowledge that is a very special mundane knowledge that directly realizes the truth is generated.

original: de mngon sum du 'gyur bar nus pa'i rten rnyed pa gang yin pa de nyid rnyed pa yin te /
analyzed: de mngon sum du 'gyur bar nus pa'i rten rnyed pa gang yin pa de nyid rnyed pa yin te /
translated: That is obtained by obtaining the basis that is capable of manifesting it.

original: rigs rnyed na rigs las byung ba yang rnyed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rigs rnyed na rigs las byung ba yang rnyed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: If the lineage is obtained, that derived from the lineage is also obtained.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'di mi 'dod do //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'di mi 'dod do //
translated: Vaibhasikas do not assert this.

original: sa du pa'i kun rdzob shes pa de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: sa du pa'i kun rdzob shes pa de 'thob ce na /
translated: On what level is that conventional knowledge obtained?

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis ni /üîΩrang dang 'gog pa mthong ba'i lam las sa gang pa yin pa sa de pa dang / sa 'og ma pa'i kun rdzob shes pa 'thob ba ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis ni / rang dang 'gog pa mthong ba'i lam las sa gang pa yin pa sa de pa dang / sa 'og ma pa'i kun rdzob shes pa 'thob ba ste /
translated: The path of seeingüîΩobtains conventional knowledge of its level and lower levels.

original: gal te mthong ba'i lam mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i lam mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If the path of seeing is the level of unrestricted access concentration, it obtains conventional knowledge of its level and lower levels.üîΩIf it is the level of the first absorption, it obtains conventional knowledge of the three levels of unrestricted access concentration, the first absorption and the special first absorption.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / sa gnyis pa thob la /
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / sa gnyis pa thob la /
translated: It is on the level of unrestricted access concentration, it is on the level of the realm of desire, and it is on the second level.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam /
translated: Similarly, the path of seeingüîΩis on the level of the fourth absorption.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin na sa bdun pa'i kun rdzob shes pa thob ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin na sa bdun pa'i kun rdzob shes pa thob ba'i bar du'o //
translated: It is on the seven levels up to the acquisition of conventional knowledge on the second level.

original: de yang dran ba nye bar gzhag pa du dag cig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang dran ba nye bar gzhag pa du dag cig yin zhe na /
translated: How many applications of mindfulness are there?

original: 'gog pa'i mtha'/ 'gog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i kun rdzob shes pa gang yin pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa tha ma ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i mtha'/ 'gog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i kun rdzob shes pa gang yin pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa tha ma ste /
translated: The conventional knowledge that arises at the end of the realization of cessation is the final application of mindfulness,

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: the application of mindfulness to phenomena.

original: gcig grangs bcad pas lhag ma ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //üîΩkun rdzob shes pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba de ni rang bden rnams can /
analyzed: gcig grangs bcad pas lhag ma ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no // kun rdzob shes pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba de ni rang bden rnams can /
translated: Since one is specified, the remaining ones are established as the four applications of mindfulness.üîΩThat conventional knowledge that arises at the end of realization is of the nature of its own truth.

original: bden pa gang zhig mngon bar rtogs pa'i 'thob pa bden pa de'i rnam pa can kho na yin no //
analyzed: bden pa gang zhig mngon bar rtogs pa'i 'thob pa bden pa de'i rnam pa can kho na yin no //
translated: It has the aspect of the truth that is realized.

original: de'i rnam pa can yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can yin no //
translated: It has the aspect of that.

original: zhes smos pas 'di'i dmigs pa yang bden pa de nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes smos pas 'di'i dmigs pa yang bden pa de nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since this is stated, it is explained that its focal object is also that truth.

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyis 'thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'bad las byung ba sbyor ba las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyis 'thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'bad las byung ba sbyor ba las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is derived from exertion, that is, derived from preparation, because it is obtained by the path of seeing.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa la sogs pa smos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa la sogs pa smos pa'i phyir /
translated: It is said to be accompanied by its retinue and so on.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa ni phung po bzhi dang lnga'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa ni phung po bzhi dang lnga'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: It is by nature the four or five aggregates that occur in the desire realm and form realm.

original: chags bcas bcu drug pa la drug /'thob ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: chags bcas bcu drug pa la drug /'thob ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Those with attachment obtain six on the sixteenth.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa las shes pa gnyis da ltar byung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa las shes pa gnyis da ltar byung ba yin la /
translated: Those not free from attachment have two present knowledges on the sixteenth moment, subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.

original: ma 'ongs pa drug 'thob ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa drug 'thob ste /
translated: They obtain six in the future.

original: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal @53b dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal @53b dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams so //
translated: They are Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of suffering, origin, cessation and path.

original: 'dod la chags dang bral bas bdun //
analyzed: 'dod la chags dang bral bas bdun //
translated: Those who are detached obtain seven.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni bdun pa pha rol gyi sems shes pa 'thob bo //üîΩde yi gong ma chags bcas kyi //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni bdun pa pha rol gyi sems shes pa 'thob bo // de yi gong ma chags bcas kyi //
translated: Those who are detached from attachment to the realm of desire obtain the cognition of the mind of another.

original: bsgom ba'i lam la bdun 'thob po //
analyzed: bsgom ba'i lam la bdun 'thob po //
translated: Those who are not detached obtain seven.üîΩThose who are not detached from attachment to the realm of desire obtain seven cognitions in the path of cultivation.

original: skad cig ma bcu drug gi gong ma'i bsgom pa'i lam la ni ji srid du 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bam yin pa de srid du sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par can gyi lam thams cad la shes pa bdun 'thob ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu drug gi gong ma'i bsgom pa'i lam la ni ji srid du 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bam yin pa de srid du sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par can gyi lam thams cad la shes pa bdun 'thob ste /
translated: On the path of cultivation which is higher than the sixteenth moment, as long as one is not detached from the realm of desire, one obtains seven cognitions in all the paths of application, of liberation, and of distinctive progress.

original: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang kun rdzob shes pa rnams so //üîΩgal te bsgom ba'i lam 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang kun rdzob shes pa rnams so // gal te bsgom ba'i lam 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: The seven cognitions are: cognition of the doctrine, subsequent cognition, cognition of the mind of another, cognition of suffering, cognition of the origin, cognition of cessation, cognition of the path, conventional cognition.üîΩIf the path of cultivation is mundane, conventional cognition is present.

original: gal te 'jig rten las 'das pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten las 'das pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If it is supramundane, cognition of exhaustion and cognition of non-arising are added.

original: chos shes pa bzhi las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin no ;
analyzed: chos shes pa bzhi las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin no ;
translated: One of the four knowledges of dharmas is present.üîΩOne obtains seven knowledges on the uninterrupted paths

original: / sa bdun las rgyal mngon shes dang // mi g-yo 'thob dang spel bsgoms pa'i //üîΩbar chad med pa'i lam dag dang // gong ma'i grol ba'i lam brgyad la'ang //
analyzed: / sa bdun las rgyal mngon shes dang // mi g-yo 'thob dang spel bsgoms pa'i // bar chad med pa'i lam dag dang // gong ma'i grol ba'i lam brgyad la'ang //
translated: that conquer the seven levels and on the eight liberated pathsüîΩof the higher stages.

original: shes pa bdun 'thob bo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: shes pa bdun 'thob bo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: One obtains seven knowledges on the uninterrupted paths that conquer the seven levels and on the eight liberated paths of the higher stages.

original: sa bdun ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum mo //
analyzed: sa bdun ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum mo //
translated: The seven levels are the four absorptions and the three formless states.

original: de dag las rgyal ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de dag las rgyal ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: Conquering them is freedom from attachment.

original: slob pas bdun po de dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed pa dang / bsam gtan spel mar bsgom pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam ji snyed ba de dag thams cad la shes pa bdun 'thob ste /
analyzed: slob pas bdun po de dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed pa dang / bsam gtan spel mar bsgom pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam ji snyed ba de dag thams cad la shes pa bdun 'thob ste /
translated: Learners who are free from attachment to those seven levels, who manifest the five types of higher perception, who manifest the stage of immutability, and who cultivate the meditative attainment of the enhanced fourth absorption obtain seven knowledges on all the uninterrupted paths and on the eight liberated paths of the higher stages.

original: de dag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag nyid do //
translated: Those seven are the same as before.

original: gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If the path of meditation is mundane, then the knowledge of elimination and nonarising are excluded.

original: kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: Conventional cognition is present.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhig yin na ni rjes su shes pa bzhi dang chos shes pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhig yin na ni rjes su shes pa bzhi dang chos shes pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: If it is supramundane, one of the four subsequent cognitions or two cognitions of the doctrine is present.

original: mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed ba la ni kun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob ste ;
analyzed: mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed ba la ni kun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob ste ;
translated: One does not obtain conventional cognition in the realization of the unshakable.

original: srid pa'i tse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i tse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the counteragent of the summit of existence.

original: der ni zad pa shes ba bdun ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: der ni zad pa shes ba bdun ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the cognition of exhaustion is the seventh.

original: sa bdun las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yang gong ma srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad la yang shes pa bdun kho na 'thob ste /üîΩchos @54a * //
analyzed: sa bdun las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yang gong ma srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad la yang shes pa bdun kho na 'thob ste / chos @54a * //
translated: Also, one obtains only seven cognitions on the eight paths of liberation of detachment from the summit of existence, which is above the seven stages.

original: shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog ba dang / lam dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog ba dang / lam dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa rnams so //
translated: The cognition of the doctrine, subsequent cognition, cognition of unsatisfactoriness, of the origin, of cessation, of the path, and cognition of another's thoughts.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni mi 'thob ste /
translated: One does not obtain conventional cognition.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the antidote of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi dang / chos shes pa rnam pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi dang / chos shes pa rnam pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: One obtains either one of the four subsequent knowledges or one of the two knowledges of the truths, depending on the case.

original: slob pa sbyong ba'i grol ba la //
analyzed: slob pa sbyong ba'i grol ba la //
translated: In the case of a learner, one who is freed through the practice of the faculties,

original: shes pa drug dang bdun 'thob bam //
analyzed: shes pa drug dang bdun 'thob bam //
translated: how many knowledges are obtained?

original: slob pa 'dod chags dang bcas pas ni dbang po sbyor ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam la drug 'thob ste /
analyzed: slob pa 'dod chags dang bcas pas ni dbang po sbyor ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam la drug 'thob ste /
translated: A learner who is not free from attachment obtains six knowledges on the uninterrupted path that is the practice of the faculties.

original: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams so //üîΩ'dod chags dang bral bas ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa bsnan te /
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams so // 'dod chags dang bral bas ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa bsnan te /
translated: These are the knowledge of the mind of another, the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origin, the knowledge of cessation, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of elimination.

original: bdun 'thob bo //
analyzed: bdun 'thob bo //
translated: One who is free from attachment obtains seven knowledges by adding the knowledge of cessation.

original: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kha cig na re gnyi gas kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo zhes zer ba'i lugs tha dad pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kha cig na re gnyi gas kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo zhes zer ba'i lugs tha dad pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word or indicates that some say that both obtain conventional knowledge.

original: sbyor ba'i lam la ni de gnyis kyis kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la ni de gnyis kyis kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo //
translated: On the path of preparation, they also obtain conventional knowledge.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam la drug / slob pa 'dod chags dang bral ba yang rung /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam la drug / slob pa 'dod chags dang bral ba yang rung /
translated: On the uninterrupted path, they obtain six.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba yang rung /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba yang rung /
translated: Whether learners are free of attachment or not,

original: dbang po sbyor ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam la drug 'thob ste /
analyzed: dbang po sbyor ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam la drug 'thob ste /
translated: on the uninterrupted path that is the entry to the stage of an ƒÅrya, they obtain six:

original: snga ma bzhin no //üîΩkun rdzob shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no // kun rdzob shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: the five such as Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir /üîΩpha rol gyi sems shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir / pha rol gyi sems shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not obtain conventional knowledge because it is similar to the path of seeing.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad la bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad la bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They also do not obtain knowledge of others' minds because it is blocked on all uninterrupted paths.

original: ci'i phyir bkag pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bkag pa ci zhe na /
translated: Why is it blocked?

original: gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not an antidote.

original: de bzhin srid rtse'i rnam rgyal la //
analyzed: de bzhin srid rtse'i rnam rgyal la //
translated: So too, on the path of the supreme mundane state.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam rnams la yang de bzhin du drug 'thob bo //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam rnams la yang de bzhin du drug 'thob bo //
translated: So too, on the uninterrupted path that is the entry to the stage of an ƒÅrya, they obtain six:üîΩthe five such as Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge.

original: zad pa shes pa la dgu'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa la dgu'o //
translated: On the knowledge of elimination, they obtain nine.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba la rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa ni zad pa shes pa yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba la rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa ni zad pa shes pa yin te /
translated: The ninth liberated path in the detachment from the summit of existence is the knowledge of elimination ksayajnana.

original: de la mi skye ba shes pa ma gtogs pa shes pa dgu 'thob po //
analyzed: de la mi skye ba shes pa ma gtogs pa shes pa dgu 'thob po //
translated: One obtains nine knowledges on that, excluding the knowledge of nonarising.üîΩOne who is immutable obtains ten.

original: mi g-yo bas ni bcu 'thob bo //
analyzed: mi g-yo bas ni bcu 'thob bo //
translated: One who is immutable obtains ten,üîΩbecause he obtains the knowledge of nonarising.üîΩOne who is liberated from the peak of cyclic existence obtains nine.üîΩOne who is liberated from the peak of cyclic existence obtains nine knowledges, excluding the knowledge of elimination.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gang yin pa des ni bcu 'thob ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gang yin pa des ni bcu 'thob ste /
translated: One who is liberated from the peak of cyclic existence and transfers to immutability obtains ten.üîΩOne who is liberated from the peak of cyclic existence and transfers to immutability obtains ten knowledges, because he obtains the knowledge of nonarising.üîΩOne who is immutable obtains ten.

original: mi skye ba shes pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is immutable obtains ten knowledges, because he obtains the knowledge of nonarising.

original: der 'pho ba'i grol ba tha ma la'ang //
analyzed: der 'pho ba'i grol ba tha ma la'ang //
translated: One who is liberated from the peak of cyclic existence and transfers to immutability obtains ten.üîΩOne who is liberated from the peak of cyclic existence and transfers to immutability obtains ten knowledges, because he obtains the knowledge of nonarising.üîΩOne who is liberated from the peak of cyclic existence and transfers to immutability obtains ten.

analyzed: gang zhig mi g-yo ba nyid du 'pho ba de'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma la yang bcu 'thob @54b bo ;üîΩ/ bshad pa'i lhag ma la brgyad 'thob bo //üîΩlhag ma yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: One who is liberated from the peak of cyclic existence and transfers to immutability obtains ten knowledges, because he obtains the knowledge of nonarising.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa dang / sa bdun las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mngon par shes pa dang spel mar bsgom pa dag gis rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa dang / sa bdun las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mngon par shes pa dang spel mar bsgom pa dag gis rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad dang /
translated: the eight liberated paths that realize the immoveable state,

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sbyor ba dang / khyad par can gyi lam thams cad de /
translated: all the special paths and the preparatory paths for freedom from attachment

analyzed: de dag thams cad la ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa ma gtogs pa shes pa brgyad ma 'ongs pa 'thob pas 'thob pa ste /
translated: all obtain eight future knowledges except for the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: slob pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: slob pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the case for learners.

original: mi slob pa'i mngon pa shes pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par can gyi lam rnams la shes pa dgu 'am bcu 'thob bo //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mngon pa shes pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par can gyi lam rnams la shes pa dgu 'am bcu 'thob bo //
translated: Nonlearners obtain nine or ten knowledges on the paths of preparation, liberation and the special path of higher perception and so on.

original: mngon par shes pa dang spel mar bsgom pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam rnams la ni brgyad dam dgu 'thob po //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang spel mar bsgom pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam rnams la ni brgyad dam dgu 'thob po //
translated: On the uninterrupted paths of the higher perceptions and the alternating cultivation, one obtains eight or nine.

original: mngon par shes pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gnyis ni lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa cung zad kyang mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gnyis ni lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa cung zad kyang mi 'thob bo //
translated: On the two liberated paths of the higher perceptions, one obtains none because they are neutral.

original: so so'i skye bo ni 'dod pa dang / bsam gtan gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma rnams dang / bsam gtan gyis pa dag gi sbyor ba rnams dang / mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni 'dod pa dang / bsam gtan gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma rnams dang / bsam gtan gyis pa dag gi sbyor ba rnams dang / mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang /
translated: Ordinary beings obtain the final liberated paths free from attachment to the desire realm and the first three absorptions, the preparations of those possessing absorption and the liberated paths of the three higher perceptions.

original: tshad med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa rnams la kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag gi sbyor ba rnams dang / mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba ma gtogs pa pha rol gyi sems shes pa yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: tshad med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa rnams la kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag gi sbyor ba rnams dang / mngon par shes pa gsum gyi rnam par grol ba ma gtogs pa pha rol gyi sems shes pa yang 'thob bo //
translated: One obtains future conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds, except for the three liberated paths of the three higher perceptions, in the preparations for the first two liberations and in the preparations for the five types of clairvoyance.

original: de dag la ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa yang mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa yang mi 'thob ste /
translated: One does not obtain knowledge of others' minds in those states.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the retinue of the path of seeing.

original: sngon med pa'i lam thob pa gzhan la ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na ma 'ongs pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i lam thob pa gzhan la ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na ma 'ongs pa 'thob bo //
translated: One obtains future conventional knowledge alone in other instances of obtaining paths not previously possessed.

original: yang lam gang las du pa'i shes pa thob ce na /
analyzed: yang lam gang las du pa'i shes pa thob ce na /
translated: How many types of knowledge are obtained from which path?

analyzed: re zhig kun rdzob shes pa ni lam sa gang pa'i yin pa dang / dang po nyid du sa gang 'thob pas de pa'i ma 'ongs pa 'thob bo //
translated: Conventional knowledge is obtained in the future in the level of the path and in the level obtained for the first time.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam gang yin pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam gang yin pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad do //
translated: Not only on the uncontaminated path.

analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na / gang las @55a * //
translated: What is the difference?üîΩThe path of liberation is obtained

analyzed: chags bral bya phyir gang // 'thab pa der yang 'og ma'ang 'thob //
translated: from the object of detachment.

original: sa gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba la yang lam yang sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis yin la /
analyzed: sa gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba la yang lam yang sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis yin la /
translated: The path of liberation is of two types: the path of preparation and so on.üîΩOne obtains the uncontaminated knowledge of the level of detachment and the level below.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba sa gang zhig thob ba de'i sa ba dang sa 'og ma ba'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa rnams 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba sa gang zhig thob ba de'i sa ba dang sa 'og ma ba'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa rnams 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One also obtains contaminated qualities

original: zad pa shes la zag bcas kyang //üîΩsa kun zad pa shes pa la ni zad pa shes pas 'thob pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i yon tan mi sdug pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa rjes su dran pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshad med pa dang /üîΩrnam par thar pa la sogs pas thams cad sprog ma thag pa bcad de /
analyzed: zad pa shes la zag bcas kyang // sa kun zad pa shes pa la ni zad pa shes pas 'thob pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i yon tan mi sdug pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa rjes su dran pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pas thams cad sprog ma thag pa bcad de /
translated: through the knowledge of elimination.üîΩOne also obtains contaminated qualities through the knowledge of elimination.

original: dbugs phyin pa lta bu dang / chos mthun pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: dbugs phyin pa lta bu dang / chos mthun pa 'thob ste /
translated: One obtains all contaminated qualities such as repulsiveness, mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four immeasurables, the four formless states, the eight liberations, the eight bases of subjugation, the ten bases of totality and so on, like a person who has cut the rope of a bundle of goods and obtained relief.üîΩThey are obtained through the knowledge of elimination.

original: rgyal srid chen po thob na /
analyzed: rgyal srid chen po thob na /

analyzed: yul gyi mi rnams kyis dbul bar bya bas bsu ba bzhin du rang gi sems la rgyal srid chen po nyid 'thob pa la dge ba'i chos thams cad 'thob pa rnams kyis bsu ba'i phyir ro // gang ci rnyed pa de thams cad 'thob bam zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa / gang sngon med pa las rnyed pa yin pas / de thams cad ni 'thob kyi / sngon rnyed zin pa ni mi 'thob bo // gang rnam par nyams pa las yang rnyed ba de yang mi 'thob ste /
translated: It is obtained in all its aspects when it is obtained that was not previously obtained.üîΩBut it is not obtained in all its aspects when it is obtained that was previously lost.

original: thob pa btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not obtained in all its aspects when it is obtained again after having been lost, because one gives up the possession of that which was previously obtained.

original: ci 'thob pa rnyed pa kho na yin nam zhe na /üîΩsmras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci 'thob pa rnyed pa kho na yin nam zhe na / smras pa ma yin no //
translated: Is acquisition always possession?

original: 'thob pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'thob pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

original: nyen pa 'thob pa dang / bsten pa 'thob pa dang / gnyen po 'thob pa dang / thag bsring ba 'thob ba'o //üîΩde la rnyed pa dang bsten ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyen pa 'thob pa dang / bsten pa 'thob pa dang / gnyen po 'thob pa dang / thag bsring ba 'thob ba'o //üîΩde la rnyed pa dang bsten ces bya ba ni /

analyzed: dge ba 'dus byas 'thob bo // gnyen po dang ni thag bsring ba'i //

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi ni gcig go //

analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams kyi ni gnyi ga'o // gnyen po dang thag bsring ba 'thob pa dag ni /

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi yin te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi yin te /

analyzed: de ltar na dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi ni 'thob pa bzhi yin no //

analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi ni gnyis yin no //

analyzed: chos mngon pa pa nyi 'og pa rnams kyi ltar na 'thob pa drug ste /

analyzed: bzhi po de dag dang / sdom pa 'thob pa @55b dang / rnam par 'jig pa 'thob pa'o //

original: snga ma ni dbang po rnams kyi yin la /
analyzed: snga ma ni dbang po rnams kyi yin la /

original: phyi ma ni lus kyi yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma ni lus kyi yin te /

translated: The S≈´tra says, ‚ÄúThese six sense faculties are very well refined, very well developed, up to very well perfected.

analyzed: gang dag kha che ba rnams na re de gnyis ni gnyen po dang thag bsring ba 'thob pa'i khongs su 'dus so zhes zer ro //

original: gang zag thams cad kyis zad pa shes pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang zag thams cad kyis zad pa shes pa'i tshe /
translated: When all persons acquire the cognition of exhaustion,

original: yon tan 'thob pa'i phyir bshad kyi //
analyzed: yon tan 'thob pa'i phyir bshad kyi //

original: sangs rgyas chos ni ma 'dres pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos ni ma 'dres pa //

analyzed: bco brgyad gang zhe na /

analyzed: thun mong ma yin pas na ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o // de la / gnas dang gnas min shes pa bcu //

analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni shes pa bcu yin no // las 'bras la brgyad /
translated: The power of knowledge of what is right and wrong is ten knowledges.üîΩThe power of knowledge of the results of the act and its consequences is eight knowledges.

analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa 'am mkhyen pa'i stobs ni shes pa brgyad de /

analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dag ma gtogs so // bsam gtan sogs /

original: dbang po mos dang khams la ni /
analyzed: dbang po mos dang khams la ni /
translated: The power of knowledge of the absorptions, etc.üîΩThe power of knowledge of the absorptions, the liberations, the samƒÅdhis, and the samƒÅpattis is nine knowledges.

original: dgu'o // bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni shes pa dgu yin te /
analyzed: dgu'o // bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni shes pa dgu yin te /
translated: The power of knowledge of the absorptions, the liberations, the samƒÅdhis, and the samƒÅpattis is nine knowledges,

original: 'gog pa shes pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the knowledge of cessation.

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //

original: lam dag la bcu'am /
analyzed: lam dag la bcu'am /
translated: The power of knowledge of the paths that lead to all destinies is ten knowledges.

analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dgu 'am zhes lugs tha dad pa'i don te /

original: 'gog pa shes pa ma gtogs so //üîΩgnyis ni kun rdzob shes pa yin //üîΩsngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / shi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs ni kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ma gtogs so // gnyis ni kun rdzob shes pa yin // sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / shi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs ni kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
translated: If it is not associated with its result, then it consists of nine knowledges.

original: zad pa @56a * //
analyzed: zad pa @56a * //
translated: The power of knowledge of the extinction of contaminants

original: drug gam bcu yin no //
analyzed: drug gam bcu yin no //
translated: consists of six or ten.

analyzed: 'on te zad pa shes pa zad pa zad pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i shes pa yin na ni /

original: des na shes pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: des na shes pa bcu yin no //

original: rang bzhin bshad zin to //
analyzed: rang bzhin bshad zin to //

original: bsam gtan dag na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag na /

original: 'chi 'pho ba ni 'chi 'pho ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba ni 'chi 'pho ba kho na ste /

analyzed: sngon gyi gnas dang / shi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs ni bsam gtan bzhi'i sa ba yin no //

analyzed: de dag kyang 'dod pa'i khams dang / mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'o // thams cad kyang 'dzam bu'i gling gi skyes pa'i rten can yin te /
translated: They are in the desire realm, in the special meditative state of unrestricted access concentration to the first meditation, in the four meditations, and in the formless realm.

analyzed: gzhan du sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: All of them are based in Jambudvƒ´pa, for a buddha does not appear elsewhere.

translated: They are called powers only for a Buddha.üîΩWhy? Because his knowledge is unimpeded with regard to them.

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di'i mkhyen pa shes bya thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' bar 'jug pa de'i phyir stobs yin no //
translated: Because his knowledge proceeds unimpededly with regard to all knowables, it is a power.

analyzed: gzhan dag gi shes pa ni la lar 'dod kyang mi 'jug pa'i phyir /

analyzed: re zhig de ltar na mkhyen pa la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of the unimpededness of his knowledge,

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs kyi stobs ni shes bzhin du mtha' yas pa yin no // sku la sred med bu yi stobs //
translated: The power of the mind of the Buddhas is infinite.üîΩThe power of the body of the Buddha is equal to that of NƒÅrƒÅya·πáa.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku la ni srid med bu'i stobs mnga'o zhes brjod do //
translated: The power of the body of the Buddha is equal to that of NƒÅrƒÅya·πáa.

original: gzhan dag tshigs na /

translated: According to the Bhadanta, the power of the body of the Buddha is infinite like the power of his mind.

analyzed: de lta ma yin na mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas pas bzod par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
