original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni rgyu gsum po sngon gyi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa dang / chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub pa dang / 'jig rten gyi don spyod pas mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni rgyu gsum po sngon gyi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa dang / chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub pa dang / 'jig rten gyi don spyod pas mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: All Buddhas are the same in three respects: they are perfectly accomplished through the same causes, i.e. the accumulations of merit and knowledge; they are the same in that they have accomplished the Dharma Body; and they are the same in that they perform benefit for the world.

original: sku tshe dang / rigs dang / gdung dang / sku bong tshod du mdzad pa la ni bye brag yod de dus ji lta ba bzhin du yun shin tu ring ba dang / thung ngur 'tsho ba'i phyir dang / rgyal rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs tha dad pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: sku tshe dang / rigs dang / gdung dang / sku bong tshod du mdzad pa la ni bye brag yod de dus ji lta ba bzhin du yun shin tu ring ba dang / thung ngur 'tsho ba'i phyir dang / rgyal rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs tha dad pa'i phyir dang /
translated: There is a difference in their life span, family, clan, and physical size, because they live for a very long or short time, as is appropriate; because there is a difference in their being of the warrior or priestly estates;

original: 'od srungs dang sh'akya la sogs pa gdung tha dad pa'i phyir dang / sku bong tshod chung ba dang / chung ba ma yin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od srungs dang sh'akya la sogs pa gdung tha dad pa'i phyir dang / sku bong tshod chung ba dang / chung ba ma yin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a difference in their clans, such as KƒÅ≈õyapa and ≈öƒÅkya; and because there is a difference in their physical size, whether small or large.

original: phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum po 'di kho na yid la byed pa mkhas pas ni /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum po 'di kho na yid la byed pa mkhas pas ni /
translated: The wise one who keeps in mind just this threefold perfection

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la dga' ba dang / gus pa chen po skyed par nus te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la dga' ba dang / gus pa chen po skyed par nus te /
translated: It is able to generate great joy and reverence for the Lord Buddhas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //üîΩde la rgyu phun sum tshogs pa @58a * //
analyzed: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o // de la rgyu phun sum tshogs pa @58a * //
translated: The perfection of cause, the perfection of effect, the perfection of benefit, and the perfection of intuition.

original: ni ; rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ni ; rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of cause is fourfold:

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la goms pa dang / yun ring po nas goms pa dang / bar chad med par goms pa dang / gus par byas te goms pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la goms pa dang / yun ring po nas goms pa dang / bar chad med par goms pa dang / gus par byas te goms pa'o //
translated: Habituation to the collections of merit and intuition, habituation for a long time, habituation without interruption, and habituation with devotion.

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa ba ni ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa ba ni ste /
translated: The perfection of effect is also fourfold:

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spang ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spang ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of intuition, the perfection of abandonment, the perfection of might, and the perfection of the form body.

original: phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of benefit is also fourfold:

original: ngan song gsum dang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las gtan du thar bar mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song gsum dang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las gtan du thar bar mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the elimination of suffering is the permanent liberation from the three miserable realms and from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: yang na theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god par mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god par mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, the perfection of the elimination of suffering is the establishment of beings in the three vehicles and in happy rebirths.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge is fourfold:

original: ma bstan par mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / ma 'bad par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: ma bstan par mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / ma 'bad par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: knowledge without teaching, knowledge of all things, knowledge of all aspects, and effortless knowledge.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of abandonment is fourfold:

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib ba thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib ba thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: abandonment of all the afflictions, abandonment forever, abandonment together with the traces, and abandonment of all obscurations of meditative stabilization and of the attainments.

original: mthu phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mthu phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of power is fourfold:

original: phyi'i yul sprul pa dang / yongs su bsgyur ba dang / sku tshe gtong ba dang / byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgrib pa dang nam mkha' dang shin tu ring ba la myur du gshegs pa dang / chung ngur mang po 'jug par mdzad pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: phyi'i yul sprul pa dang / yongs su bsgyur ba dang / sku tshe gtong ba dang / byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgrib pa dang nam mkha' dang shin tu ring ba la myur du gshegs pa dang / chung ngur mang po 'jug par mdzad pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: The power of emanation of external objects, the power of complete transformation, the power of relinquishing life, the power of complete mastery of blessing, the power of swift movement to obscured places, to space and to extremely distant places, and the power of complete mastery of causing many to enter a small place.

original: ya mtshan gyi chos nar ma rnam ba sna tshogs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ya mtshan gyi chos nar ma rnam ba sna tshogs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: 1. Mastery of emanation of external objects, 2. mastery of transformation of external objects, 3. mastery of prolonging or relinquishing life, 4. mastery of blessing, 5. mastery of rapid movement through resistance, through space, and over water as if on the ground, 6. mastery of making many out of one and one out of many, 7. mastery of causing the elements to appear in a different manner than usual, 8. mastery of causing the past, future, and present to enter into the present moment, 9. mastery of causing the great and small to enter into a small space, 10. mastery of causing the far to become near, 11. mastery of causing the heavy to become light, 12. mastery of causing the light to become heavy, 13. mastery of causing the cessation of the supernormal powers of others, 14. mastery of causing the enjoyment of all objects of desire, 15. mastery of causing the manifestation of various kinds of extraordinary and marvelous phenomena.

original: gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of the form body is also fourfold:

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpe byad bzang po phun sum tshogs pa dang / stobs phun sum tshogs pa dang / sku gdung rdo rje ltar sra ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpe byad bzang po phun sum tshogs pa dang / stobs phun sum tshogs pa dang / sku gdung rdo rje ltar sra ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: 1. perfection of the major marks, 2. perfection of the minor marks, 3. perfection of the powers, 4. perfection of the vajra-like indestructible body.

original: de ltar na de dag ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid mdor bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid mdor bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these are the brief characteristics of the greatness of the Buddhas.

original: de dbyen ni mtha' yas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dbyen ni mtha' yas par 'gyur te /
translated: They are infinite in number.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das rnams kho na nas gal te sku tshe bskal pa grangs med pa du mar byin gyis brlabs par gyur na mtha' dag mkhyen pa dang brjod par spyod do //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das rnams kho na nas gal te sku tshe bskal pa grangs med pa du mar byin gyis brlabs par gyur na mtha' dag mkhyen pa dang brjod par spyod do //
translated: The Bhagavans themselves know and express all things, if they so will for many countless eons.

original: re zhig @58b de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni yon tan dang ye shes dang mthu dang phan 'dogs pa mtha' yas shing rmad du byung ba ni rin po che chen po'i 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: re zhig @58b de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni yon tan dang ye shes dang mthu dang phan 'dogs pa mtha' yas shing rmad du byung ba ni rin po che chen po'i 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: Thus the Tathagatas are the source of the jewel of infinite, marvelous qualities, knowledge, power, and benefit.

original: 'on kyang byis pa rang nyid yon tan dbul bas mos pa bcom pa rnams ni yon tan 'byor pa de lta bu de thos su zin kyang sangs rgyas dang de'i chos la gus par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa rang nyid yon tan dbul bas mos pa bcom pa rnams ni yon tan 'byor pa de lta bu de thos su zin kyang sangs rgyas dang de'i chos la gus par mi byed kyi /
translated: But the childish, themselves poor in good qualities, are overcome by lack of interest. Even when they hear of such an abundance of good qualities, they do not respect the Buddha or his Dharma.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni rkang yan chad nas kyang /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni rkang yan chad nas kyang /
translated: But the wise, even at the risk of their lives,

original: bcom ldan 'das de dang de'i chos la mngon par rab tu dang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dang de'i chos la mngon par rab tu dang bar 'gyur te /
translated: have utmost faith in the Bhagavat and his Dharma.

original: gcig tu rab tu dang ba de dag ni dang ba tsam gyis kyang rnam par smin par ma nges pa'i sdig pa'i tshogs rnams zil gyis mnan te lha dang mi'i legs pa nyams su myong nas bgrod par bya ba'i mchog mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig tu rab tu dang ba de dag ni dang ba tsam gyis kyang rnam par smin par ma nges pa'i sdig pa'i tshogs rnams zil gyis mnan te lha dang mi'i legs pa nyams su myong nas bgrod par bya ba'i mchog mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have perfect faith, even by mere faith, overcome the mass of non-virtue whose result is not certain, experience the excellence of gods and humans, and attain the supreme goal, nirvana.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: For this very reason, the Tathagatas are called the unsurpassed field of merit.

original: 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / mchog tu gyur pa dang / myur ba dang / mtha' bzang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / mchog tu gyur pa dang / myur ba dang / mtha' bzang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not fruitless, they are delightful, they are supreme, they are swift, and they have a good end.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /üîΩgang dag rgyal ba rnam 'dren la //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang / gang dag rgyal ba rnam 'dren la //
translated: The Blessed One also said:

original: bya ba chung ngu byed 'gyur ba'ang //
analyzed: bya ba chung ngu byed 'gyur ba'ang //
translated: Those who do even a small actionüîΩfor the Victorious Ones, the guides,

original: de dag mtho ris sna tshogs dag / bgrod nas bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob //
analyzed: de dag mtho ris sna tshogs dag / bgrod nas bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob //
translated: having gone to various heavens,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: attain the state of immortality.

original: re zhig de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas.

original: chos gzhan slob dang thun mong min //
analyzed: chos gzhan slob dang thun mong min //
translated: Other qualities are common to disciples.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yon tan gzhan dag ni nyan thos dang thun mong yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yon tan gzhan dag ni nyan thos dang thun mong yin no //
translated: Other qualities of the Buddhas are common to disciples.

original: kha cig so so'i skye bo dang / de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: kha cig so so'i skye bo dang / de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are these qualities common to disciples?

original: ci rigs par /
analyzed: ci rigs par /
translated: They are:

analyzed: nyon mongs med dang smon nas shes // so so yang dag rig sngon sogs //
translated: Absence of conflict, cognition by resolve,üîΩthe analytical knowledges, the superknowledges,üîΩthe dhyanas, the formless attainments,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang /

analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa'o //

original: de la nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa la sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal ni nyon mongs pa las rab tu skye ba dang / bdag nyid kyang yon gnas gyi  khyad par yin par rig nas pha rol po dag de la dmigs nas /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa la sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal ni nyon mongs pa las rab tu skye ba dang / bdag nyid kyang yon gnas gyi  khyad par yin par rig nas pha rol po dag de la dmigs nas /
translated: The term nonafflicted refers to arhats who, knowing that the suffering of sentient beings arises from affliction and that they themselves are special fields of merit, focus on that and then give rise to compassion.üîΩ

original: nyon mongs pa skye ba yongs su spangs @59a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skye ba yongs su spangs @59a * //
translated: The so-called absence of conflict is the knowledge of the arhat, which, knowing that the suffering of sentient beings arises from the defilements and that he himself is a special field of merit, wishes to completely abandon the arising of the defilements in others.

original: par 'dod de /
analyzed: par 'dod de /

translated: This path is the absence of conflict because it does not cause the generation of any defilements.

original: kun rdzob shes /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes /
translated: The absence of conflict is conventional knowledge.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni 'di yin no //

original: bsam gtan mtha' na bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan mtha' na bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin te /

original: lam sla ba rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi g-yo ba'i chos /
analyzed: lam sla ba rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro // mi g-yo ba'i chos /

original: dgra bcom pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /

analyzed: mis skyed / gling gsum du mi dag gi nang kho nar skyed par byed do //

analyzed: nyon mongs 'dod gtogs pa / ma skyed gzhir bcas spyod yul can /

translated: The perfected being who is immovable has for his object the future defilements of the realm of desire, together with their basis.üîΩThe perfected being who is immovable has for his object the future defilements of the realm of desire, together with their basis.üîΩThe perfected being who is immovable has for his object the future defilements of the realm of desire, together with their basis.üîΩThe perfected being who is immovable has for his object the future defilements of the realm of desire, together with their basis.üîΩThe perfected being who is immovable has for his object the future defilements of the realm of desire, together with their basis.üîΩThe perfected being who is immovable has for his object the future defilements of the realm of desire, together with their basis.üîΩThe perfected being who is immovable has for his object the future defilements of the realm of desire, together with their basis.üîΩThe perfected being who is immovable has for his object the future defilements of the realm of desire, together with their basis.üîΩThe perfected being who is immovable has for his object the future defilements of the realm of desire, together with their basis.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhi med pa rnams ni yongs su spang bar mi nus te /
translated: The perfected being who is immovable has for his object the future defilements of the realm of desire, together with their basis.üîΩThe perfected being

original: smon nas shes pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: smon nas shes pa'ang de bzhin no //

original: de yang kun rdzob shes pa dang // bsam gtan mtha' na yod pa dang // mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi yin pa dang / mi'i rten can yin no //üîΩde'i dmigs pa thams cad do //

analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dang spyod pa'i bye brag las shes te / 'dir dpe ni zhing ba lta bu'o zhes zer ro //

original: smon pa sngar btang ba'i shes pa ni smon nas shes pa ste /
analyzed: smon pa sngar btang ba'i shes pa ni smon nas shes pa ste /
translated: It is a cognition of the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality, for it is produced in the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩIt is a cognition of the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality, for it is produced in the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩIt is a cognition of the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality, for it is produced in the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩIt is a cognition of the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality, for it is produced in the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩIt is a cognition of the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality, for it is produced in the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩIt is a cognition of the realm of desire

analyzed: 'di shes par bya'o snyam du smon nas rab kyi mtha'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug cing /
translated: Having aspired to understand this, he enters the fourth absorption of the summit of existence.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de'i yul du ji tsam zhig gyur pa gang yin pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //

original: @59b de bzhin chos don des tshig dang // spobs pa so so yang dag rig / so so yang dag par rig pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: @59b de bzhin chos don des tshig dang // spobs pa so so yang dag rig / so so yang dag par rig pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The correct knowledges are four:üîΩthe correct knowledge of phenomena,üîΩthe correct knowledge of the meaning,üîΩthe correct knowledge of dialectic,

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: and the correct knowledge of the higher and higher.

analyzed: de dag kyang nyon mongs pa med pa ji lta ba de dang 'dra'o //

original: de dag gi de dang 'dra ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi de dang 'dra ba ci zhe na /

original: 'di dag gi dmigs pa dang / sa dang rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag ni tha dad par brjod de /
analyzed: 'di dag gi dmigs pa dang / sa dang rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag ni tha dad par brjod de /
translated: Their objects, stages, and individual natures are described as distinct.üîΩThe three are, respectively, knowledge free from the obstructions

original: gsum ni go rims bzhin ming dang // don dang ngag la thogs med shes //
analyzed: gsum ni go rims bzhin ming dang // don dang ngag la thogs med shes //

translated: The analytical knowledges of the teaching, meaning, and expression are, respectively, knowledge free from the obstructions of name, meaning, and expression.

analyzed: bzhi pa rigs pa thags thogs med // mngon brjod lam la dbang nyid dang // thogs pa med par shes pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /

original: de yi dmigs pa ngag dang lam //
analyzed: de yi dmigs pa ngag dang lam //

original: de'i dmigs pa ni ngag kyang yin la lam yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni ngag kyang yin la lam yang yin no //

original: shes pa dgu'o //

analyzed: sems shes pa las mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //

original: mngon par shes pa mngon par grub na ni gzugs la mi ltos par mngon par shes so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa mngon par grub na ni gzugs la mi ltos par mngon par shes so //

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'dod pa ni yid kyi @61b rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa'i mtshan ma bzung nas de'i lugs las bzlog ste /üîΩmtshams sbyor ba'i sems kyi bar du de ma thag pa'i gnas skabs gzhan rnams yin la byed do //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'dod pa ni yid kyi @61b rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa'i mtshan ma bzung nas de'i lugs las bzlog ste / mtshams sbyor ba'i sems kyi bar du de ma thag pa'i gnas skabs gzhan rnams yin la byed do //
translated: up to the mind of conception.

original: de nas srid pa bar ma'i skad cig ma gcig dran na yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas srid pa bar ma'i skad cig ma gcig dran na yang grub pa yin no //
translated: If one recollects one moment of the intermediate existence, one is successful.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi yang dran no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi yang dran no //
translated: One recollects the past lives of others in the same way.

original: mngon par grub nas ni thod rgal du yang dran no //
analyzed: mngon par grub nas ni thod rgal du yang dran no //

original: sngon nyams su myong ba kho na dran no //
analyzed: sngon nyams su myong ba kho na dran no //

analyzed: gnas gtsang ma rnams ji ltar dran zhe na /

original: thos pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //

original: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa na pha rol pa'i rgyud la brten nas skyed de ;
analyzed: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa na pha rol pa'i rgyud la brten nas skyed de ;
translated: One who dies in the formless realm and is born here generates recollection in dependence on the continuum of another.

original: / gzhan dag ni rang gi rgyud la brten nas so //
analyzed: / gzhan dag ni rang gi rgyud la brten nas so //

original: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i sbyor ba ni yang ba dang / sgra dang / snang ba yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i sbyor ba ni yang ba dang / sgra dang / snang ba yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The application of the superknowledge of magical power is the mental attention to lightness, sound, and light.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga po 'di dag ni /
translated: These five superknowledges

original: rang dang 'og sa'i yul can yin //
analyzed: rang dang 'og sa'i yul can yin //

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa gang yin pa des sa de 'am 'og mar 'gro ba'am sprul par byed kyi gong du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa gang yin pa des sa de 'am 'og mar 'gro ba'am sprul par byed kyi gong du ni ma yin no //

original: de bzhin du lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pas kyang rang gi sa kho na'am sa 'og ma ba'i sgra thos kyi sa gong ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pas kyang rang gi sa kho na'am sa 'og ma ba'i sgra thos kyi sa gong ma ni ma yin no //

original: sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pas kyang sa gong ma pa'i sems ni mi shes so //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pas kyang sa gong ma pa'i sems ni mi shes so //

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pas kyang mi dran no //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pas kyang mi dran no //

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mngon par shes pas kyang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mngon par shes pas kyang mi mthong ngo //

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs med pa'i sa pa'i sems ni sa gong ma pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs med pa'i sa pa'i sems ni sa gong ma pa yin pa'i phyir /

original: sems kyi rnam grangs dang / sngon gyi gnas mngon par shes pa gnyis kyis mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs dang / sngon gyi gnas mngon par shes pa gnyis kyis mi 'dzin to //

original: 'di dag ji ltar 'thob ce na /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar 'thob ce na /

original: ma 'dres pa rnams kyi sbyor bas //üîΩthob bya 'dris pa chags bral bas //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa rnams kyi sbyor bas // thob bya 'dris pa chags bral bas //

analyzed: mngon par shes pa tshe rabs gzhan na goms pa rnams ni 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob bo //

original: bye brag can rnams ni sbyor bas so //
analyzed: bye brag can rnams ni sbyor bas so //

original: thams cad kyang sbyong bas bskyed pa yin no //

original: gsum pa dran pa nyer gzhag gsum //

analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum gyi rang bzhin no //

analyzed: dang po rdzu 'phrul rna ba mig / mngon par shes pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi dmigs pa ni phyi'i skye mched bzhi yin te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi dmigs pa ni phyi'i skye mched bzhi yin te /

analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pas 'di ltar sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyad pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par shes she na /

analyzed: de ni des mi shes kyi 'phags pa rnams la de las gzhan pa gang gis na de lta bur shes par 'gyur ba mngon par shes pa'i 'khor du gyur pa'i shes pa skye'o //

analyzed: lhag ma ni dmigs kyis ma phye ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char gyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //

original: mig dang rna ba'i mngon shes ni //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i mngon shes ni //
translated: The superknowledges of the eye and earüîΩare neutral. The remaining are virtuous.

analyzed: lung du ma bstan lhag rnams dge / lha'i mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: de dag kyang mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan ba'i shes rab yin no //

analyzed: 'o na de dag ji ltar bsam gtan bzhi'i sa par grub ce na ;

analyzed: rten gyi dbang gis de'i sa bstan pa'i phyir te /

original: gzhan bzhi ni dge ba dag yin no //

analyzed: shes pa dge ba yin no zhes gang bshad pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: It is a wholesome cognition.‚Äù

original: de ni gtso bo'am phal che ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gtso bo'am phal che ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: This text indicates the principal element or the most important element.

original: mngon par shes pa 'di rnams las //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa 'di rnams las //
translated: Among the superknowledges,

original: gsum ni rig pa /
analyzed: gsum ni rig pa /

analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag kho na yin gyi gzhan dag ma yin zhe na / sngon mtha' sogs /

analyzed: 'di dag gis ni go rims bzhin du sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / bar la kun du rmongs pa bzlog par byed do //

original: de dag las kyang don dam par /
analyzed: de dag las kyang don dam par /

original: @62b mi slob tha ma /

analyzed: zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba kho na mi slob pa'i rig pa yin no //

original: gnyis ni de'i /

analyzed: rgyud las skyes phyir de zhes bya //

analyzed: mngon par shes pa 'di dag slob ba'i yin par mi 'dod dam zhe na gang gi phyir slob pa'i rig pa dag ces mi bya zhe na /

analyzed: slob la 'dod de ma rig dang // bcas rgyud phyir na rig ma bshad //

original: mngon par shes pa 'di dag las //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa 'di dag las //

original: dang po gsum pa drug pa ni //
analyzed: dang po gsum pa drug pa ni //

analyzed: cho 'phrul rnams yin rdzu 'phrul dang // sems kyi rnam grangs dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams ni go rims bzhin du cho 'phrul gsum yin te /
translated: The three kinds of supernormal knowledge are the three miracles.

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang kun rdzob pa dang rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul rnams yin no // dang po nyid du gdul bya'i yid shen tu 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir cho 'phrul dag yin pa 'am /
translated: The three miracles are the miracle of supernatural power, the miracle of reading others‚Äô minds, and the miracle of scriptural instruction.üîΩThey are miracles because they captivate the minds of those to be disciplined.

analyzed: 'di dag gis zhe 'gras pa dang / bar mar gnas pa rnams kyi yid 'phrog par byed pas na cho 'phrul dag yin no //

original: 'di dag gi nang na /üîΩbstan pa mchog /
analyzed: 'di dag gi nang na / bstan pa mchog /

analyzed: rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul ni //
translated: The miracle of scriptural instruction is the best,üîΩbecause it is nonerroneous,

analyzed: mi 'khrul phyir dang phan pa dang // yid 'ong 'bras la sbyor byed phyir // mchog yin no //

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang kun brjod pa dag ni rig sngags kyis kyang /
translated: The miracle of supernatural power and the miracle of reading others‚Äô minds are also found among magicians.

original: byed de / ghan dha ri zhes bya ba'i rig sngags gang gis na nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / rtog byed ces bya ba'i rig sngags gang gis na pha rol gyi sems shes pa yang yod mod kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su bstan pa ni gzhan gyis bya bar mi nus pas mi 'khrul pa'i phyir 'di ni gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: byed de / ghan dha ri zhes bya ba'i rig sngags gang gis na nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / rtog byed ces bya ba'i rig sngags gang gis na pha rol gyi sems shes pa yang yod mod kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su bstan pa ni gzhan gyis bya bar mi nus pas mi 'khrul pa'i phyir 'di ni gtso bo yin no //
translated: But since no one else can teach the truth as it is, this is the best, because it is nonerroneous.

original: de gnyis kyis ni gtod pa tsam du zad kyi rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis ni thabs nye bar bstan pa'i sgro nas phan pa dang / yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la sbyor bas 'di nyid mchog yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni gtod pa tsam du zad kyi rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis ni thabs nye bar bstan pa'i sgro nas phan pa dang / yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la sbyor bas 'di nyid mchog yin no //

original: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is this so-called ‚Äúmiracle‚Äù?

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ting nge 'dzin /
translated: The miracle is concentration.

original: 'dis 'byor par byed pas na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'byor par byed pas na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is called ‚Äúmiracle‚Äù because it is the basis of the miracle.

original: des ci zhig yang @63a * //
analyzed: des ci zhig yang @63a * //
translated: What is the miracle?

original: dag par 'byor par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dag par 'byor par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask what is the purpose of the superknowledges,

original: de las ni /
analyzed: de las ni /
translated: it is this:

original: sprul dang 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sprul dang 'gro ba ste /

original: de la 'gro ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
