analyzed: yul thag shin tu ring por yang thugs bskyed pa'i dus kyi byon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he arrives at the time of the thought of going to a very distant place.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes bya ba gsungs so //üîΩ'gro ba gzhan dag ni ma bshad kyang sangs rgyas la mnga' bar grub po //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes bya ba gsungs so // 'gro ba gzhan dag ni ma bshad kyang sangs rgyas la mnga' bar grub po //
translated: Therefore the Blessed Lord Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe sphere of the Buddha is inconceivable. ‚Äù

original: gzhan dag la /
analyzed: gzhan dag la /
translated: The other kinds of going are established as belonging to the Buddha, even though they are not mentioned.üîΩThe going by the speed of magical power and the going by the speed of the mind are also established as belonging to others,

original: phyin byed mos pa las byung yang //
analyzed: phyin byed mos pa las byung yang //
translated: but not the going by the speed of thought.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la ni lus phyin byed kyi 'gro ba yang yod de /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la ni lus phyin byed kyi 'gro ba yang yod de /
translated: ≈örƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas also have the going of bodily movement.

original: bya bzhin du rim gyis lus phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya bzhin du rim gyis lus phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They go by gradually moving their bodies, like a bird flies through the air with wings.

original: mos pa las byung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: mos pa las byung ba yang yod de /
translated: They also have the going of resolve.

original: thag ring po la nye bar mos nas myur du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thag ring po la nye bar mos nas myur du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They go quickly by resolving to go a long distance.

original: sprul pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩ'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa ni rnam pa gnyis te / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'o //
translated: Emanation has two types:üîΩemanation belonging to the desire realm and emanation belonging to the form realm.

original: de la re zhig /'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig /'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni /
translated: Emanation belonging to the desire realm

original: phyi'i skye mched bzhi /
analyzed: phyi'i skye mched bzhi /
translated: is the nature of the four external bases.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa ni gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa ni gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Emanation belonging to the desire realm is the nature of the bases of form, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: de yang rnam gnyis /
analyzed: de yang rnam gnyis /
translated: It is twofold:

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang sprul pa'o //üîΩgzugs gtogs gnyis /üîΩgzugs na spyod pa'i sprul pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang sprul pa'o // gzugs gtogs gnyis / gzugs na spyod pa'i sprul pa ni /
translated: emanation of one‚Äôs own body and emanation of another‚Äôs body.üîΩEmanation belonging to the form realmüîΩis the nature of the two bases.

original: de na dri dang ro med pa'i phyir gzugs dang reg bya'i skye mched gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de na dri dang ro med pa'i phyir gzugs dang reg bya'i skye mched gnyis yin no //
translated: Emanation belonging to the form realm is the nature of the bases of form and tactility because smell and taste do not exist there.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du rnam pa gnyis yin te /üîΩ'di ni sprul pa rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du rnam pa gnyis yin te / 'di ni sprul pa rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: The same holds for the realm of fine-materiality.

original: gzugs kyi khams na yang de dang 'dra bas mdor bsdu na sprul pa ni rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na yang de dang 'dra bas mdor bsdu na sprul pa ni rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: In brief, there are eight types of emanations.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa sprul pa na ji ltar na dri dang ro dag dang mi ldan pa yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa sprul pa na ji ltar na dri dang ro dag dang mi ldan pa yang yin zhe na /
translated: But, in the realm of fine-materiality, how can one produce an emanation in the realm of desire that is endowed with smell and taste?

original: gos dang / rgyan bzhin du mi ldan no //
analyzed: gos dang / rgyan bzhin du mi ldan no //
translated: It is not endowed with them, just as clothing and ornaments are not.

original: gzhan dag na re skye mched gnyis sprul par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re skye mched gnyis sprul par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: According to other masters, one produces two sense-spheres of the emanation.

original: yang ci mngon par shes pa kho nas sprul pa sprul par byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci mngon par shes pa kho nas sprul pa sprul par byed dam zhe na /
translated: Is it only by means of the superknowledge of emanation that one produces an emanation?

original: smras pa / ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no // 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Objection: They are not.üîΩIf that is so, then how are they?üîΩ

original: mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu /üîΩsprul sems dag gis de @63b dag kyang ni bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu / sprul sems dag gis de @63b dag kyang ni bcu bzhi'o //
translated: By means of the thought of emanation, one produces an emanation.üîΩThe thought of emanation is of fourteen types.

original: sprul pa'i sems bcu bzhi po de dag ni /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems bcu bzhi po de dag ni /
translated: The thought of emanation is of fourteen types.

original: bsam gtan 'bras gnyis nas lnga'i bar rim bzhin /üîΩbsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu sprul pa'i sems ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bsam gtan 'bras gnyis nas lnga'i bar rim bzhin / bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu sprul pa'i sems ni gnyis te /
translated: The result of the first absorption is the emanation mind of the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa dag go //üîΩbsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'bras bu ni gsum ste /üîΩ'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i sa pa dag go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa dag go // bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'bras bu ni gsum ste / 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa'i sa pa dag go //
translated: The result of the second absorption is the emanation mind of the desire realm, the first absorption and the second absorption.üîΩSimilarly, the result of the third absorption is the emanation mind of the desire realm, the first absorption, the second absorption and the third absorption.

original: da bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i sa pa dag kyang bzhi dang lngar spyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: da bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'i sa pa dag kyang bzhi dang lngar spyor bar bya'o //
translated: The result of the fourth absorption is the emanation mind of the desire realm, the first absorption, the second absorption, the third absorption and the fourth absorption.

original: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu sprul pa'i sems ni rang gis pa dang sa 'og ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu sprul pa'i sems ni rang gis pa dang sa 'og ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The emanation mind of the absorptions is known as its own level and lower level.

original: gong ma las skyes min /
analyzed: gong ma las skyes min /
translated: It is not born from higher levels.

original: bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bus gong ma'i sprul pa'i sems ni med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bus gong ma'i sprul pa'i sems ni med do //
translated: The emanation mind of lower levels is not the result of higher levels.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The emanation mind of the desire realm that is the result of the second absorption and so on is not the result of the second absorption and so on.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa de'i 'bras bu las 'gros kyi sgo nas khyad par du 'phags so //üîΩde rnyed bsam gtan bzhin /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa de'i 'bras bu las 'gros kyi sgo nas khyad par du 'phags so // de rnyed bsam gtan bzhin /
translated: The first absorption is superior to the result of the second absorption through the power of its movement.üîΩObtaining it is like the absorptions.

original: sprul pa'i sems de dag rnyed pa ni bsam gtan bzhin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems de dag rnyed pa ni bsam gtan bzhin no //
translated: Obtaining the mind of emanation is like the absorptions.

original: yang ci sprul pa'i sems kho na las ldang bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci sprul pa'i sems kho na las ldang bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Do beings arise from the mind of emanation alone?

original: de lta bu ni med de /üîΩ'di ltar / de ni /
analyzed: de lta bu ni med de / 'di ltar / de ni /
translated: No, they do not.

original: dag dang rang las skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dag dang rang las skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: They arise from pure and emanation minds.

original: sprul pa'i sems ni bsam gtan dag pa pa'am sprul pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su skye'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems ni bsam gtan dag pa pa'am sprul pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su skye'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind of emanation arises from pure and emanation minds of the absorptions and not from other minds.

original: de las gnyis /üîΩsprul pa'i sems las kyang bsam gtan dag pa pa dang sprul pa'i sems skye ste /
analyzed: de las gnyis / sprul pa'i sems las kyang bsam gtan dag pa pa dang sprul pa'i sems skye ste /
translated: Two arise from it.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Pure and emanation minds arise from the mind of emanation and not from other minds.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa ni yang ting nge 'dzin la ma zhugs par ting nge 'dzin de las ldang ba med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa ni yang ting nge 'dzin la ma zhugs par ting nge 'dzin de las ldang ba med do //
translated: One who abides in the result of concentration does not arise from that concentration without again entering concentration.

original: sprul pa thams cad kyang /
analyzed: sprul pa thams cad kyang /
translated: All emanations

original: rang gi sa pas sprul par byed /
analyzed: rang gi sa pas sprul par byed /
translated: Emanations emanate through their own level.

original: sa gzhan pa'i sprul pa'i sems kyis sa gzhan pa'i sprul par ni mi byed do //
analyzed: sa gzhan pa'i sprul pa'i sems kyis sa gzhan pa'i sprul par ni mi byed do //
translated: Emanations of one level do not emanate through the minds of other levels.

original: smrar 'jug pa ni 'og mas kyang /
analyzed: smrar 'jug pa ni 'og mas kyang /
translated: Speech is caused by those of lower level.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang gi sa pas kyang smrar 'jug go zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang gi sa pas kyang smrar 'jug go zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The word also indicates that speech is caused by those of its own level.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i sprul pa ni rang gis pa'i sems kho nas smrar 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i sprul pa ni rang gis pa'i sems kho nas smrar 'jug go //
translated: Emanations of the desire realm and the first absorption are caused to speak by minds of their own level.

original: sa gong ma pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa ste /
analyzed: sa gong ma pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa ste /
translated: Emanations of higher levels are caused to speak by minds of the first absorption.

original: yan chad na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan chad na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no motivation that is indicative form of higher levels.

original: sprul pa mang po rnams smra ba ni ston min sprul pa dang bcas /
analyzed: sprul pa mang po rnams smra ba ni ston min sprul pa dang bcas /
translated: Many emanations speak when they are possessed by a teacher.

original: sangs rgyas las gzhan @64a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas las gzhan @64a * //
translated: Emanations of others

original: pa'i sprul pa ni sprul pa dang bcas te /üîΩsmra bas gang gi tshe sprul pa mang po zhig yin pa de'i tshe cig car smra ste /
analyzed: pa'i sprul pa ni sprul pa dang bcas te / smra bas gang gi tshe sprul pa mang po zhig yin pa de'i tshe cig car smra ste /
translated: are possessed by a teacher.üîΩWhen there are many emanations, they speak simultaneously.

original: gcig cig smra bar byed pa na //
analyzed: gcig cig smra bar byed pa na //
translated: When one speaks,

original: sprul pa thams cad smra bar byed //
analyzed: sprul pa thams cad smra bar byed //
translated: All emanations speak when the first speaks,

original: gcig mi smra bar gyur pa dang // de dag thams cad smrar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig mi smra bar gyur pa dang // de dag thams cad smrar mi 'gyur //
translated: and all are silent when the first is silent.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in the verse.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa ni snga phyi ji ltar bzhed par smra'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa ni snga phyi ji ltar bzhed par smra'o //
translated: The emanations of a Buddha speak as he wishes, either simultaneously or sequentially.

original: gang gi tshe smrar 'jug pa'i sems yod pa de'i tshe sprul pa'i sems med pa'i phyir sprul pa med na ji ltar smrar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe smrar 'jug pa'i sems yod pa de'i tshe sprul pa'i sems med pa'i phyir sprul pa med na ji ltar smrar 'jug ce na /
translated: When the mind that causes speech exists, the mind of emanation does not exist. If the emanation does not exist, how can it speak?

original: byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan 'jug phyir //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan 'jug phyir //
translated: Because it engages another through blessing.

original: gnas par 'dod pas sprul pa byin gyis brlabs nas yid gzhan rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pas ngag 'jug par byed do //üîΩci gson po kho na la byin gyi rlabs yod dam /üîΩ'on te shi ba la yod ce na /
analyzed: gnas par 'dod pas sprul pa byin gyis brlabs nas yid gzhan rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pas ngag 'jug par byed do // ci gson po kho na la byin gyi rlabs yod dam / 'on te shi ba la yod ce na /
translated: One who wishes to remain blesses the emanation and engages speech by causing another mind to manifest speech.üîΩDoes blessing exist only for the living or also for the dead?

original: shi ba la yang byin gyi rlabs yod /
analyzed: shi ba la yang byin gyi rlabs yod /
translated: Blessing exists for the dead.

original: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i rus pa'i keng rus gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i rus pa'i keng rus gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The skeleton of the noble MahƒÅkƒÅ≈õyapa remains by the power of his blessing.

original: de yang mi brtan la med /
analyzed: de yang mi brtan la med /
translated: But that is not the case for unstable things.

original: mi brtan pa'i dngos po la ni byin gyi rlabs med de /
analyzed: mi brtan pa'i dngos po la ni byin gyi rlabs med de /
translated: There is no blessing of unstable things.

original: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen pos sha la sogs pa byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen pos sha la sogs pa byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The noble MahƒÅkƒÅ≈õyapa did not bless his flesh, etc.

original: gzhan dag min gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag min gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: shi ba la byin gyi rlabs med kyi /
analyzed: shi ba la byin gyi rlabs med kyi /
translated: There is no blessing of the dead.

original: rus pa'i keng rus gnas pa ni lha'i mthus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rus pa'i keng rus gnas pa ni lha'i mthus so zhes zer ro //
translated: The skeleton remains by the power of the gods.

original: ci sems gcig gis sprul pa gcig kho na sprul bar byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci sems gcig gis sprul pa gcig kho na sprul bar byed dam zhe na /
translated: By how many minds is a single emanation created?

original: dang por du mas gcig yin te //
analyzed: dang por du mas gcig yin te //
translated: By many at first, then by one.

original: bya bar gyur nas bzlog pa'o //üîΩdang po nyid du ni sprul pa'i sems du mas sprul pa gcig sprul par byed do //
analyzed: bya bar gyur nas bzlog pa'o // dang po nyid du ni sprul pa'i sems du mas sprul pa gcig sprul par byed do //
translated: The reverse when the work is done.üîΩAt first, by many emanation minds, a single emanation is created.

original: mngon par shes pa byang nas ni sems gcig gis sprul pa po ji snyed dod pa du ma sprul par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa byang nas ni sems gcig gis sprul pa po ji snyed dod pa du ma sprul par byed do //
translated: But when the superknowledge is perfected, by a single mind, as many emanations as one wishes are created.

original: yang sprul pa'i sems thams cad lung du ma bstan pa yin nam zhe na /üîΩbsgoms las skyes pa lung ma bstan //
analyzed: yang sprul pa'i sems thams cad lung du ma bstan pa yin nam zhe na / bsgoms las skyes pa lung ma bstan //
translated: Are all emanation minds indeterminate?üîΩThe emanation mind derived from meditation is indeterminate.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni nges par lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni nges par lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The emanation mind that is the result of meditation is necessarily indeterminate.

original: skye ba las skyes rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: skye ba las skyes rnam gsum mo //
translated: The emanation mind obtained from birth is of three types.

original: lha dang / klu dang / sha za la sogs pa'i skye bas thob pa'i sprul pa'i sems ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / sha za la sogs pa'i skye bas thob pa'i sprul pa'i sems ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The emanation mind obtained from birth of gods, nagas, pisacas, and so on is virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: de dag gis byas pa'i sprul ba rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba ni sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis byas pa'i sprul ba rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba ni sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The emanation created by them that is related to their own body or the body of another is a form base that is not sound.

original: @64b skye mched dug pa yin te /
analyzed: @64b skye mched dug pa yin te /
translated: It is a sense base because it is form.

original: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a sense faculty because it is not different from the sense faculty.

original: dbang po ni sprul par mi byed do //
analyzed: dbang po ni sprul par mi byed do //
translated: The sense faculty does not emanate.

original: ci bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / skye bas thob pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnam pa 'di gnyis kho nar zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / skye bas thob pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnam pa 'di gnyis kho nar zad dam zhe na /
translated: Are these two types of superknowledge, that derived from meditation and that obtained from birth, the only types of superknowledge?

original: rdzu 'phrul rnam pa gnyis pa de dang / gsang sngags sman dag dang / las las skyes dang rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rnam pa gnyis pa de dang / gsang sngags sman dag dang / las las skyes dang rnam pa lnga //
translated: that derived from meditation, that obtained from birth, that produced by spells, that produced by medicine, and that produced by karma.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga'o zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga'o zhes brjod de /
translated: In brief, supernatural power is fivefold:

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang / skye bas thob pa dang / gsang sngags las skyes pa dang / sman las skyes pa dang / las las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang / skye bas thob pa dang / gsang sngags las skyes pa dang / sman las skyes pa dang / las las skyes pa ste /
translated: that derived from meditation, that obtained from birth, that produced by spells, that produced by medicine, and that produced by karma.

original: dper na nga las nu dang / srid pa bar ma pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nga las nu dang / srid pa bar ma pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the supernatural power of the Buddha, that of beings in the intermediate state, and so on.

original: lha'i rna ba dang mig tu bshad pa gang yin pa de dag ci lha'i kho na yin nam /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba dang mig tu bshad pa gang yin pa de dag ci lha'i kho na yin nam /
translated: Are the divine eye and ear only divine?

original: 'on te byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'khor los sgyur ba dang / khyim bdag rin po che rnams kyi lta bur lha'i dang 'dra bas lha'i yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'khor los sgyur ba dang / khyim bdag rin po che rnams kyi lta bur lha'i dang 'dra bas lha'i yin zhe na /
translated: Or are they divine because they are like the divine eye and ear of the gods, the bodhisattva, the cakravartin, and the householder ratna?üîΩThe divine eye and ear

original: lha yi mig dang rna ba yin //
analyzed: lha yi mig dang rna ba yin //
translated: are the divine eye and ear.

original: 'di ltar de gnyis ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis ni /
translated: Because they are

original: bsam gtan sa pa'i gzugs dang ba /
analyzed: bsam gtan sa pa'i gzugs dang ba /
translated: the form and sound of the level of the absorptions.

original: bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa'i mig dang rna ba'i thod kor du sgra dang / snang ba la gtod pa'i sbyor bas bsam gtan gyis pa'i 'byung ba rnams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / sgra dag mthong ba dang / thos pa'i rgyu mngon par 'grub pas bsam gtan gyis pa yin pa'i phyir mig dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa'i mig dang rna ba'i thod kor du sgra dang / snang ba la gtod pa'i sbyor bas bsam gtan gyis pa'i 'byung ba rnams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / sgra dag mthong ba dang / thos pa'i rgyu mngon par 'grub pas bsam gtan gyis pa yin pa'i phyir mig dang /
translated: The form and sound that are the cause of seeing and hearing are established as the cause of the form and sound that are derived from the primary elements of the absorptions, through the application of focusing on sound and form while entering meditative attainment.

original: rna ba de dag ni lha'i kho na yin no //
analyzed: rna ba de dag ni lha'i kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eye and ear are of the absorptions.

original: de gnyis kyang rtag tu brten bcas ma tshang med /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang rtag tu brten bcas ma tshang med /
translated: Those two are always possessed, not incomplete.

original: thag ring phra sogs spyod yul can //
analyzed: thag ring phra sogs spyod yul can //
translated: They have a distant and subtle domain.

original: lha'i mig dang rna ba ni rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de dang mtshungs pa med do //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang rna ba ni rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de dang mtshungs pa med do //
translated: The divine eye and ear are always possessed of consciousness, so they are not similar to those two.

original: zhar ba dang 'on pa med pa'i phyir ma tshang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zhar ba dang 'on pa med pa'i phyir ma tshang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not incomplete because they are not blind or deaf,

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can bzhin no //
translated: like sentient beings in the form realm.

original: de gnyis kyi yul ni gzugs dang / sgra thag ring ba dang / phra ba dang / bsgribs pa dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi yul ni gzugs dang / sgra thag ring ba dang / phra ba dang / bsgribs pa dag kyang yin no //
translated: The objects of these two are also form, sound, distant, subtle, and obscured.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gang phyir sha yi mig gis gzugs //
analyzed: gang phyir sha yi mig gis gzugs //
translated: Because the fleshly eye does not see

original: thag ring gnas dang bsgribs pa dang // phra rgyas thams cad mi mthong ba //
analyzed: thag ring gnas dang bsgribs pa dang // phra rgyas thams cad mi mthong ba //
translated: form that is distant, obscured, or subtle,

original: de phyir lha yis mthong bar 'dod //üîΩlha'i mig gis thag ji srid cig mthong zhe na /
analyzed: de phyir lha yis mthong bar 'dod // lha'i mig gis thag ji srid cig mthong zhe na /
translated: it is accepted that the divine eye sees.üîΩHow far does the divine eye see?

original: gang gi mig ji lta bu yin ba'o //üîΩnyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par stong dang stong gnyis pa @65a * //
analyzed: gang gi mig ji lta bu yin ba'o // nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par stong dang stong gnyis pa @65a * //
translated: It sees as far as the eye can reach.

original: dang stong gsum pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ngo //
analyzed: dang stong gsum pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ngo //
translated: Sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and buddhas see the world systems of a thousand, a million, and countless world systems without exertion.

original: mngon par 'du byed pas ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pas ni /
translated: With exertion,

original: dgra bcom bse ru ston rnams kyis //
analyzed: dgra bcom bse ru ston rnams kyis //
translated: the arhats, rhinoceroses, and teachers

original: stong gnyis gsum dang grangs med mthong //
analyzed: stong gnyis gsum dang grangs med mthong //
translated: see two, three, and countless

original: nyan thos chen pos kyang mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis lha'i mig gis stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos chen pos kyang mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis lha'i mig gis stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ngo //
translated: The great disciples, by means of the divine eye produced through action, see a chiliocosm.

original: bse ru lta bus ni stong gsum pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: bse ru lta bus ni stong gsum pa mthong ngo //
translated: The rhinoceros, by means of the divine eye acquired through meditation, sees a dichiliochosm.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni ji tsam bzhed par 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa gzigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni ji tsam bzhed par 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa gzigs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas see as many universes as they desire.

original: ci rdzu 'phrul kho na skye bas 'thob pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci rdzu 'phrul kho na skye bas 'thob pa yin nam /
translated: Is the superknowledge of the divine eye the only one that can be acquired through birth?üîΩOr are there others?

original: 'on te gzhan yang yin zhe na /üîΩgzhan yang skye bas kyang 'thob /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yang yin zhe na / gzhan yang skye bas kyang 'thob /
translated: There are others.

original: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi yang skye bas 'thob bar bya ba yod mod kyi /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi yang skye bas 'thob bar bya ba yod mod kyi /
translated: The four superknowledges of divine hearing and knowledge of the mind, memory of past lives and knowledge of the destruction of the cankers can also be acquired through birth.

original: skye bas thob pa ni cung zad kyang mngon par shes pa'i ming mi 'thob bo //üîΩskye bas 'thob pa'i lha'i mig gang yin pa /
analyzed: skye bas thob pa ni cung zad kyang mngon par shes pa'i ming mi 'thob bo // skye bas 'thob pa'i lha'i mig gang yin pa /
translated: But the divine eye acquired through birth does not receive the name of superknowledge.

original: des ni / srid pa bar ma mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: des ni / srid pa bar ma mi mthong ngo //
translated: The divine eye acquired through birth does not see the intermediate beings.

original: srid pa bar ma ni mngon par shes pa'i mig kho nas mthong gi / skye bas thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni mngon par shes pa'i mig kho nas mthong gi / skye bas thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The intermediate beings see it by means of the eye of superknowledge, not by means of the eye obtained through rebirth.

original: sems shes de ni rnam pa gsum /üîΩskye bas 'thob pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sems shes de ni rnam pa gsum / skye bas 'thob pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another is of three types.üîΩThe knowledge of the mind of another obtained through birth is of three types: wholesome, unwholesome, nondefined.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa skye bas 'thob pa de ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang rnam pa gsum yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩgang rtogs dang rig sngags kyis byas pa'ang /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa skye bas 'thob pa de ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang rnam pa gsum yin par rig par bya'o // gang rtogs dang rig sngags kyis byas pa'ang /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another produced through meditation is wholesome.üîΩThe knowledge of the mind of another produced through the power of a spell is of three types.

original: gang yang mtshan ma pa rnams kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang rtog ge ba dang / gang yang rig sngags kyis byas pa de yang rnam pa gsum yin bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang mtshan ma pa rnams kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang rtog ge ba dang / gang yang rig sngags kyis byas pa de yang rnam pa gsum yin bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another produced through the power of a spell is of three types: wholesome, unwholesome, nondefined.

original: ji ltar bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dge ba kho na yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dge ba kho na yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another produced through meditation is wholesome, for it is the effect of a wholesome cause.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa skye bas thob pa dag gis ni dmyal ba pas ni dang po shes /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa skye bas thob pa dag gis ni dmyal ba pas ni dang po shes /
translated: The knowledge of the thoughts of another and the recollection of former abodes, obtained through birth, are, respectively, the first knowledge of the hell beings and of the gods.

original: ji srid du sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas ma nyen pa de srid du shes so //
analyzed: ji srid du sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas ma nyen pa de srid du shes so //
translated: As long as they are not tormented by the sensation of suffering, the hell beings know the thoughts of others.

original: 'gro ba gzhan na gnas pas ni rtag tu shes so //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan na gnas pas ni rtag tu shes so //
translated: The gods always know the thoughts of others.

original: mi la skye bas thob pa med //
analyzed: mi la skye bas thob pa med //
translated: There is no knowledge obtained through birth among humans.

original: mi rnams la ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa de skye bas thob pa med do //
analyzed: mi rnams la ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa de skye bas thob pa med do //
translated: Humans do not possess any knowledge obtained through birth, such as the knowledge of the thoughts of another, etc.

original: 'o na rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa gang yin pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa gang yin pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What then is the knowledge of former abodes that is innate in humans?

original: de dag gi de ni las kyi khyad par las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi de ni las kyi khyad par las skyes pa yin te /
translated: This knowledge is the result of a particular action.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The recollection of former abodes is of three types:

original: bsgoms pa'i @65b 'bras bu dang / skye bas thob pa dang / las las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i @65b 'bras bu dang / skye bas thob pa dang / las las skyes pa'o //
translated: 1. the result of cultivation; 2. obtained through birth; 3. arisen from the ripening of the action.

original: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi rnam par bshad pa las ye shes bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa'o //
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi rnam par bshad pa las ye shes bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh chapter of the Abhidharmakosa has been completed.

original: shes pa'i skabs kyis shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams ni bshad zin to /
analyzed: shes pa'i skabs kyis shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams ni bshad zin to /
translated: The qualities of knowledge have been explained in the section on knowledge.

original: // / rang bzhin gzhan rnams brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / rang bzhin gzhan rnams brjod par bya ste /
translated: The other qualities will now be discussed.

original: de lta bas na yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir dang po kho nar bsam gtan rnams brtsams te /
analyzed: de lta bas na yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir dang po kho nar bsam gtan rnams brtsams te /
translated: Since the absorptions are the basis of all the qualities, they are discussed first.

original: bsam gtan dag ni rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag ni rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The absorptions are of two types.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni mdor bsdu na skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni mdor bsdu na skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: In brief, there are two types of absorption: the absorption of birth and the absorption of meditative attainment.

original: de dag kyang bzhi /
analyzed: de dag kyang bzhi /
translated: They are also four.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas bzhi pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas bzhi pa'i bar ro //
translated: There are four absorptions from the first to the fourth.

original: de la bsam gtan du skye ba rnams ni yang mi brjod de /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan du skye ba rnams ni yang mi brjod de /
translated: The absorptions of birth are not mentioned here.

original: 'jig rten bstan pa'i mdzod kyi gnas su /
analyzed: 'jig rten bstan pa'i mdzod kyi gnas su /
translated: In the Treasury of Knowledge, which is a presentation of the world,üîΩit is said:

original: der skye ba dag rab tu bshad /
analyzed: der skye ba dag rab tu bshad /
translated: ‚ÄúThe absorptions of birth are explained there.‚ÄùüîΩWhat does it say?

original: ji skad du bshad ce na /üîΩder so so'i /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad ce na /üîΩder so so'i /
translated: It says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe absorptions of birth are the four absorptions.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan sa ni gsum pa yin //
analyzed: bsam gtan sa ni gsum pa yin //
translated: The third stage is the stage of the second meditation.üîΩThe fourth stage is the eighth stage.

original: bzhi pa sa ni brgyad pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa sa ni brgyad pa yin // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The fourth stage is the eighth stage.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meditations of meditative attainment should be mentioned.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /üîΩsnyoms 'jug dge ba rtse gcig pa /üîΩbye brag med par dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa / snyoms 'jug dge ba rtse gcig pa / bye brag med par dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan yin te /
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩMeditative attainment is a virtuous, single-pointed mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Without distinction, meditation is a virtuous, single-pointed mind because it has the nature of concentration.

original: rjes 'brang bcas na phung po lnga //
analyzed: rjes 'brang bcas na phung po lnga //
translated: If it is accompanied by its retinue, it has the nature of five aggregates.

original: 'khor dang bcas na ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas na ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If it is accompanied by its retinue, it should be understood to have the nature of five aggregates.

original: rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this called single-pointedness?

original: dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do //
translated: It is the single focal object.

original: de lta na ni 'o na sems dmigs pa gcig pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin gyi chos gzhan sems las byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na sems dmigs pa gcig pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin gyi chos gzhan sems las byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then only minds with a single focal object are concentration, but other phenomena that are mental factors are not.

original: sems rnams kho na ting nge 'dzin ma yin gyi gang gis de dag rtse gcig par byed pa'i chos de ting nge 'dzin yin la de nyid rtse gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sems rnams kho na ting nge 'dzin ma yin gyi gang gis de dag rtse gcig par byed pa'i chos de ting nge 'dzin yin la de nyid rtse gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: The mind itself is not concentration; the factor that causes the mind to be concentrated is concentration.

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt every mind concentrated, since all minds are momentary?

original: gal te gnyis pa de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te gnyis pa de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that concentration is the nondistraction of the mind from the object in a second moment following a moment of distraction,

original: mtshungs par ldan pa la ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa la ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin no //
translated: then concentration is useless, since nondistraction is explained as the possession of mindfulness.üîΩOr, if you say that concentration is the nondistraction of the mind from the object in a second moment following a moment of concentration,

original: gang kho na las ting nge 'dzin yin pa de kho na las sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig pa nyid du yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: gang kho na las ting nge 'dzin yin pa de kho na las sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig pa nyid du yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: then why not accept that the object of the mind in a second moment is the same as the object of the mind in the first moment?

original: ting nge 'dzin sa @66a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sa @66a * //
translated: You say that concentration is a universal mental factor,

original: mang po pa yin pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang po pa yin pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but it follows, absurdly, that all minds are concentrated, since concentration is a universal mental factor.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it does not follow,

original: ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the power of concentration is weak.

original: gzhan dag na re sems rtse gcig pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems rtse gcig pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin te /
translated: Others say that the mind itself that is one pointed is concentration.

original: 'di ltar mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las /
translated: A sutra declares:

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo ni bsam gtan bzhi yin no zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo ni bsam gtan bzhi yin no zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: The four absorptions are the principal means of training in superior mind and purifying the mind.

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of dhyana?

original: 'dis sems par byed pas na bsam gtan te /
analyzed: 'dis sems par byed pas na bsam gtan te /
translated: Dhyana is so called because it causes the mind to be attentive.

original: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'i phyir rab tu shes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'i phyir rab tu shes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is called attentive because it causes one to know perfectly as it is, since the mind is equipoised.

original: skad kyi byings 'di ni sems pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: skad kyi byings 'di ni sems pa'i don yin la /
translated: This verbal root means to be attentive.

original: sems pa yang shes rab yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems pa yang shes rab yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' las 'byung ngo //
translated: And the Abhidharma states that intention is wisdom.

original: de lta na ni 'o na ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that all concentrations are dhyana.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: phul du phyin pa dang ldan ba la de'i ming du btags pa'i phyir nyi ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phul du phyin pa dang ldan ba la de'i ming du btags pa'i phyir nyi ma bzhin no //
translated: because it is like the sun, which is so called because it possesses the highest degree of excellence.

original: phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the highest degree of excellence?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang yan lag dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang yan lag dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Concentration is endowed with members.

original: de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung ba'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang / lam sla ba zhes gsungs pas de ni shin tu yang sems par byed do //
analyzed: de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung ba'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang / lam sla ba zhes gsungs pas de ni shin tu yang sems par byed do //
translated: It is the easy path, for it is the natural outcome of the union of serenity and insight.

original: nyon mongs pa can ji ltar bsam gtan yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ji ltar bsam gtan yin zhe na /
translated: How can defiled concentration be a meditation?

original: log par nges pa sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par nges pa sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the reflection on a false certainty.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But this is an unacceptable consequence.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: de dang mthun pa kho na la de'i ming du btags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa kho na la de'i ming du btags pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the name is given to that which is similar to the true meditation.

original: sa bon rul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon rul pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a rotten seed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bsam gtan mi dge ba dag kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bsam gtan mi dge ba dag kyang gsungs so //
translated: The Fortunate One also speaks of unwholesome meditations.

original: yang dge ba rtse gcig pa bsam gtan dang po ni ji lta bu /
analyzed: yang dge ba rtse gcig pa bsam gtan dang po ni ji lta bu /
translated: What is the wholesome, the one-pointedness of mind which is the first meditation?

original: bzhi pa'i bar ni ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i bar ni ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the one-pointedness of mind which is the fourth meditation?

original: re zhig dang po ni /
analyzed: re zhig dang po ni /
translated: The first is twofold:

original: dpyod dang dga' dang bde dang ldan //
analyzed: dpyod dang dga' dang bde dang ldan //
translated: It is associated with vitarka and vicƒÅra, with joy and pleasure.

original: dge ba rtse gcig pa bsam gtan dang po ni dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no /
analyzed: dge ba rtse gcig pa bsam gtan dang po ni dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no /
translated: The first absorption, which is a single-area virtuous mind, is concomitant with investigation, joy, and pleasure.

original: dpyod pa smos pas rtog pa yang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: dpyod pa smos pas rtog pa yang bshad pa yin te /
translated: The mention of investigation also indicates applied thought,

original: lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir du ba dang me bzhin du /
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir du ba dang me bzhin du /
translated: because they are co-existent, like smoke and fire.

original: rtog pa med par ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i dpyod pa med do //
analyzed: rtog pa med par ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i dpyod pa med do //
translated: Without applied thought, there is no investigation concomitant with joy and pleasure.

original: bsam gtan lhag ma gsum ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan lhag ma gsum ni /
translated: The remaining three absorptions

original: @66b yan lag lnga lnga spangs pa yin //üîΩdge ba rtse gcig pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: @66b yan lag lnga lnga spangs pa yin // dge ba rtse gcig pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: are devoid of five, five, and one branches, respectively.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa ni dpyod pa spangs la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa ni dpyod pa spangs la /
translated: The second absorption is devoid of investigation and

original: dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: is concomitant with joy and pleasure.

original: gsum pa ni dpyod pa dang dga' ba spangs la bde ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dpyod pa dang dga' ba spangs la bde ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The third is devoid of investigation and joy and is concomitant with pleasure.

original: bzhi pa ni dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang bde ba spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang bde ba spangs pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is devoid of investigation, joy, and pleasure.

original: bsam gtan rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs med /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs med /
translated: Just as there are four absorptions, so too there are four formless states.

original: rnam pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what aspects?

original: de dag kyang skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis kyang yin la bzhi yang yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis kyang yin la bzhi yang yin no //
translated: They are also two or four types, as arising and meditative attainment.

original: de dag gi yang skye ba rnams ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag gi yang skye ba rnams ni bshad zin to //
translated: Their arisings have already been explained.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i gzugs med pa rnams ni bye brag med par dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa des bshad zin to //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i gzugs med pa rnams ni bye brag med par dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa des bshad zin to //
translated: The formless meditative attainments are explained by the general statement: They are the nature of virtuous, one-pointedness of mind.

original: 'khor dang bcas na ni /
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas na ni /
translated: But if they are considered with their retinue,

original: phung po bzhi rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po bzhi rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are formless and have a following of four aggregates.

original: 'og ma'i sa dben las skyes pa //
analyzed: 'og ma'i sa dben las skyes pa //
translated: The formless are born from the separation of lower levels.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa las dben pa las skyes pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa las dben pa las skyes pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched yin no //
translated: The base of infinite space is born from the separation of the fourth absorption.

original: de las dben ba las skyes pa ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched yin no //
analyzed: de las dben ba las skyes pa ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched yin no //
translated: The base of infinite consciousness is born from the separation of that.

original: de las dben ba las skyes pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched yin no //
analyzed: de las dben ba las skyes pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched yin no //
translated: The base of nothingness is born from the separation of that.

original: de las dben pa las skyes pa ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched yin te /
analyzed: de las dben pa las skyes pa ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched yin te /
translated: The base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is born from the separation from the base of nothingness.

original: de ltar na gzugs med pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs med pa bzhi yin no //
translated: Thus there are four formless states.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this separation?

original: lam gang gis ni 'og ma las rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: lam gang gis ni 'og ma las rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: It is the path by which one is separated from the lower level,

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one becomes free from attachment to the lower level.

original: gzugs med pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa de dag kyang /
translated: These formless states

original: nyer bsdogs gsum dang bcas par ni //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs gsum dang bcas par ni //
translated: are accompanied by three access concentrations,

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig ces bya //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig ces bya //
translated: because they destroy the perception of form.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig ces bya ba'i ming mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig ces bya ba'i ming mi 'thob bo //
translated: The access concentration to the base of infinite space does not obtain the name ‚Äúdestroying the perception of form‚Äù because it focuses on the fourth absorption.

original: de la ni gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig pa ma yin te /üîΩma bral zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la ni gzugs kyi 'du shes bshig pa ma yin te /üîΩma bral zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In that concentration, the perception of form is not destroyed,üîΩbecause one is not separated from the perception of form.

original: phung po bzhi zhes gang bshad pa re zhig gzugs med pa dag na gzugs med do zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phung po bzhi zhes gang bshad pa re zhig gzugs med pa dag na gzugs med do zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The four aggregates are the subject. The thesis is: There is no material form in the formless realm.

original: gal te yod na ji ltar na gzugs med pa rnams brjod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te yod na ji ltar na gzugs med pa rnams brjod par 'gyur /
translated: If there is material form, how can the realm be called formless?

original: gzugs cung zad cig yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs cung zad cig yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is a small amount of material form.üîΩLike the expression ‚Äúa little something.

original: cung zad zer ba bzhin no //üîΩre zhig de ni gzugs ji @67a * //
analyzed: cung zad zer ba bzhin no // re zhig de ni gzugs ji @67a * //
translated: It is like the expression ‚Äúa little bit.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩ

original: lta bu zhig yod par 'dod /
analyzed: lta bu zhig yod par 'dod /
translated: What kind of material form do you admit in the formless realm?

original: gal te lus dang ngag gi sdom ba tsam zhig go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus dang ngag gi sdom ba tsam zhig go zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the mere restraint of body and speech,

original: de dag med na ji ltar de dag gi sdom par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag med na ji ltar de dag gi sdom par 'gyur /
translated: how can there be restraint of what does not exist?

original: 'byung ba med par ni 'byung ba las gyur pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba med par ni 'byung ba las gyur pa mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for the derived material form to exist without the primary elements.

original: gal te zag pa med pa'i sdom pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zag pa med pa'i sdom pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is like the uncontaminated restraint,

original: ma yin te zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because the primary elements exist that are associated with the uncontaminated restraint.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la yang de dgag par bshad do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la yang de dgag par bshad do //
translated: We have already refuted the existence of meditative attainment.

original: 'on te lus kyang yod la dbang po gzugs can rnams kyang yod do zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'on te lus kyang yod la dbang po gzugs can rnams kyang yod do zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that the body exists and the material faculties exist,

original: ji ltar na de dag gzugs cung zad yod par 'dod /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag gzugs cung zad yod par 'dod /
translated: How do you know that they have a subtle body?

original: gal te bong tshod chung ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni chung ngu'i skye bo gzugs bltar mi snang ba dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bong tshod chung ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni chung ngu'i skye bo gzugs bltar mi snang ba dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that it is because their size is small, then it follows that the bodies of the beings of the small rebirth in the hells are not visible.

original: gal te dang ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te dang ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that it is because they are clear,

original: srid pa bar ma dag dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dag dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that the bodies of the beings of the intermediate state and the beings of the form realm are formless.

original: gal te gang las ches dang ba med pa yin no zhe na ni /üîΩsrid pa'i rtse mo kho na gzugs med pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gang las ches dang ba med pa yin no zhe na ni / srid pa'i rtse mo kho na gzugs med pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that it is because they are more clear,üîΩthen the summit of existence would be formless because it is the most exalted rebirth.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It would be like the meditative attainment of the formless realm.

original: bsam gtan du skye ba'i gzugs kyang sa 'og ma'i dbang pos mi zin pa'i phyir de dang yang khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: bsam gtan du skye ba'i gzugs kyang sa 'og ma'i dbang pos mi zin pa'i phyir de dang yang khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the difference between that and the form of the beings of the form realm, since the faculties of the lower level cannot apprehend it?

original: gal te gnyis kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa yin gyi gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnyis kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa yin gyi gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the name of the two realms accords with their meaning, but the name of the formless realm does not,üîΩthen it would follow that the formless realm would be formless.

original: de la rigs pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de la rigs pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the reasoning here?

original: gal te tshe dang drod gnyis 'dres par gsungs pa'i phyir dang / 'dam bu'i shog gnyis bzhin du ming dang gzugs dag phan tshun brten to zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang // rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / gzugs nas 'du byed rnams kyi bar las gzhan du rnam par shes pa 'ong ba'am 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod pa nyid du grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshe dang drod gnyis 'dres par gsungs pa'i phyir dang / 'dam bu'i shog gnyis bzhin du ming dang gzugs dag phan tshun brten to zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang // rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / gzugs nas 'du byed rnams kyi bar las gzhan du rnam par shes pa 'ong ba'am 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod pa nyid du grub bo zhe na /
translated: Form exists in the formless realm because it is said that life force and heat are mixed, because it is said that name and form mutually support each other like two bundles of reeds, because it is said that name and form have consciousness as their condition, and because it is said that consciousness does not come or go from form to formations.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this is to be investigated.

original: re zhig tshe dang drod gnyis 'dres pa nyid du gang gsungs pa 'di ci 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i tshe las dgongs te gsungs sam /
analyzed: re zhig tshe dang drod gnyis 'dres pa nyid du gang gsungs pa 'di ci 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i tshe las dgongs te gsungs sam /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement that life force and heat are mixed?

original: 'on te thams cad las zhes bya ba dang / gang yang ming dang gzugs dag phan tshun brten pa nyid du gsungs pa 'di ci 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa las dgongs te gsungs sam /üîΩ'on te @67b thams cad las zhes bya ba dang / gang yang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs pa 'di ci rnam par shes pa thams cad ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du gsungs sam /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad las zhes bya ba dang / gang yang ming dang gzugs dag phan tshun brten pa nyid du gsungs pa 'di ci 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa las dgongs te gsungs sam / 'on te @67b thams cad las zhes bya ba dang / gang yang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs pa 'di ci rnam par shes pa thams cad ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du gsungs sam /
translated: Or does it refer to all?üîΩOr does it refer to all?üîΩOr does it refer to all name and form?üîΩOr does it refer to all consciousness?

original: 'on te ming dang gzugs thams cad rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du gsungs zhes bya ba dang / gang yang gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan du rnam par shes pa 'ong ba dang 'gro ba bkag par gsungs pa 'di ci de dag thams cad med na de bkag gam /
analyzed: 'on te ming dang gzugs thams cad rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du gsungs zhes bya ba dang / gang yang gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan du rnam par shes pa 'ong ba dang 'gro ba bkag par gsungs pa 'di ci de dag thams cad med na de bkag gam /
translated: Or does it refer to some?

original: 'on te 'ga' zhig kyang zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'on te 'ga' zhig kyang zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya dgos so //
translated: This must be investigated.

original: gal te bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir dpyad par mi bya'o zhe na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir dpyad par mi bya'o zhe na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that one should not analyze because it is said that there is no distinction, then that is absurd.

original: tshe med par phyi'i dro ba yang yod par mi 'gyur la /üîΩphyi'i gzugs kyang rnam par shes pa la brten pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe med par phyi'i dro ba yang yod par mi 'gyur la / phyi'i gzugs kyang rnam par shes pa la brten pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that you should not investigate because it is said that there is no difference, then it would follow that external heat would not exist because life force does not exist.

original: khyad par med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, external form would be supported by consciousness because it would occur without distinction.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas bzhin du zas bzhi gsungs pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yang kham du byed pa'i zas yod par thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas bzhin du zas bzhi gsungs pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yang kham du byed pa'i zas yod par thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, it would follow that the four foods exist in the form and formless realms because the four foods are stated to exist while the consciousness that is the result of karmic maturation exists there.

original: gal te kham du byed pa'i zas za ba'i lha rnams las 'das te zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / dga' ba'i zas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na ni gzugs med pa dag na yang gzugs yod par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te kham du byed pa'i zas za ba'i lha rnams las 'das te zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / dga' ba'i zas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na ni gzugs med pa dag na yang gzugs yod par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that it does not follow because it is said that they transcend the gods who consume the food of rasa and because it is said that they consume the food of joy, then it would not follow that form exists in the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa zhi ba gang dag gzugs rnams las 'das nas zhes bya ba dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'i sems can dag yod ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa zhi ba gang dag gzugs rnams las 'das nas zhes bya ba dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'i sems can dag yod ces bya ba dang /
translated: and there are sentient beings who are not form.üîΩAnd because it is said,

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das nas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das nas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Totally transcending the perception of form,

original: gzugs shig yod na ni rang gi gzugs gdon mi za bar 'du shes par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs shig yod na ni rang gi gzugs gdon mi za bar 'du shes par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: if form existed, then it would definitely perceive its own form.

original: gal te sa 'og ma pa'i gzugs rags pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te sa 'og ma pa'i gzugs rags pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If it is said that the formless states are stated from the perspective of the coarseness of form of lower levels,

original: kham gyi zas la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: kham gyi zas la yang mtshungs so //
translated: then the same would apply to the food of morsels.

original: bsam gtan rnams kyang sa 'og ma pa las nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams kyang sa 'og ma pa las nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would follow that the absorptions would be formless because they are definitely released from lower levels.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa @68a * //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa @68a * //
translated: Because it definitely emerges from the feeling and so on of lower level, it is said that it definitely emerges from feeling and so on.

original: las kyang nges par 'byung ba yin bar ci'i phyir ma bshad de /
analyzed: las kyang nges par 'byung ba yin bar ci'i phyir ma bshad de /
translated: But why is it not said that it definitely emerges from feeling and so on?

original: gzugs kyi rnam pa zad par las 'das la tshor ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa las ni ma yin pas de'i phyir gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam pa zad par las 'das la tshor ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa las ni ma yin pas de'i phyir gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it definitely emerges from form because it transcends the aspect of form but not the aspect of feeling and so on.

original: srid pas srid pa las nges par mi 'byung bar gsungs pa ni de nyid kyis de las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / thams cad dang gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pas srid pa las nges par mi 'byung bar gsungs pa ni de nyid kyis de las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / thams cad dang gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that existence does not definitely emerge from existence because it does not definitely emerge from that existence itself and it does not definitely emerge from all existence and it does not definitely emerge from existence forever.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn also says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bsam gtan dag la ni gang de na gzugs kyi rnam pa yod pa'ang rung rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'i bar yod pa'ang rung zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bsam gtan dag la ni gang de na gzugs kyi rnam pa yod pa'ang rung rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'i bar yod pa'ang rung zhes gsungs la /
translated: If there is the aspect of form there, up to if there is the aspect of consciousness there.

original: gzugs med pa dag la ni gang de na tshor ba'i rnam pa yod pa'ang rung rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'i bar yod pa'ang rung zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag la ni gang de na tshor ba'i rnam pa yod pa'ang rung rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'i bar yod pa'ang rung zhes gsungs te /
translated: In the formless realms, there is no form at all, since it is said that there is no form there at all, whether it be a type of form or not, up to and including the type of consciousness.

original: de dag na gzugs kyi rnam ba zhig yod na ci'i phyir gzugs kyi rnam pa yod pa'ang rung zhes gsungs par mi 'gyur te de lta bas na gzugs med pa na gzugs med do //
analyzed: de dag na gzugs kyi rnam ba zhig yod na ci'i phyir gzugs kyi rnam pa yod pa'ang rung zhes gsungs par mi 'gyur te de lta bas na gzugs med pa na gzugs med do //
translated: If there were a type of form there, why would it not be said that there is a type of form there? Therefore, there is no form in the formless realms.

original: de ni ji ltar na de nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyi gzugs bskal pa mi nyung ba zhig tu gzugs rgyun chad pa las yang skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar na de nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyi gzugs bskal pa mi nyung ba zhig tu gzugs rgyun chad pa las yang skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does form arise again after a long time, since the continuum of form is interrupted for a long time for those who die in the formless realm?

original: gzugs ni sems las skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzugs ni sems las skye bar 'gyur //
