The faculty of pleasure is the pleasant sensation that arises in dependence on a contact that is conducive to pleasure, and it is a mental and physical pliancy.üîΩWhat is the faculty of pain? The faculty of pain is the unpleasant sensation that arises in dependence on a contact that is conducive to pain, and it is a mental and physical rigidity.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩtshig de ni 'ga' zhig gis sgro btags pa yin te /üîΩsde pa gzhan thams cad las lus kyi zhes bya ba kho na 'byung ba'i phyir dang / bde ba lus kyis myong la zhes rang gi sgras gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na / tshig de ni 'ga' zhig gis sgro btags pa yin te / sde pa gzhan thams cad las lus kyi zhes bya ba kho na 'byung ba'i phyir dang / bde ba lus kyis myong la zhes rang gi sgras gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is the faculty of mental pleasure? The faculty of mental pleasure is the pleasant mental sensation that arises in dependence on a contact that is conducive to pleasure.

original: gal te yid kyi lus kyis so zhe na ni ;üîΩde skad bshad pa la yon tan ci zhig yod /üîΩbsam gtan bzhi pa la shin tu sbyangs pa mang bzhin du bde ba ma smos pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yid kyi lus kyis so zhe na ni ; de skad bshad pa la yon tan ci zhig yod / bsam gtan bzhi pa la shin tu sbyangs pa mang bzhin du bde ba ma smos pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: What is the faculty of mental pain? The faculty of mental pain is the unpleasant mental sensation that arises in dependence on a contact that is conducive to pain.

original: gal te bde ba'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa bde ba yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te bde ba'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa bde ba yin no zhe na ni /
translated: What is the faculty of equanimity? The faculty of equanimity is the sensation that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant that arises in dependence on a contact that is conducive to equanimity.üîΩWhat is the faculty of coming to know what was not known? The faculty of coming to know what was not known is the faculty of one who is training, who is practicing the path in order to know the unknown, and who has not attained his or her goal.üîΩWhat is the faculty of perfect knowledge? The faculty of perfect knowledge is the faculty of one who has attained his or her goal, who has nothing more to practice, and who has nothing further to be known.üîΩWhat is the faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge? The faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge is the faculty of one who has attained his or her goal, who has nothing more to practice, and who has nothing further to be known.

original: gsum pa na yod pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa bde bar ma gsungs pa yang ci'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum pa na yod pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa bde bar ma gsungs pa yang ci'i phyir /
translated: Why is the pliancy existing in the third absorption not called pleasure?

original: gal te btang snyoms kyis bcom pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te btang snyoms kyis bcom pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you ask why, it is because it is destroyed by equanimity.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: snga ma gnyis pas de khyad par du 'phags pas btang snyoms kho nas de 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis pas de khyad par du 'phags pas btang snyoms kho nas de 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because pliancy is superior to the former two meditative attainments and it increases due to equanimity alone.üîΩAlso, because pliancy and pleasure are separately mentioned in this sutra:

original: gang gi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa'i bde ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa zhes 'byung ba'i mdo 'di las kyang shin tu sbyangs pa dang bde ba gnyis tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa'i bde ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa zhes 'byung ba'i mdo 'di las kyang shin tu sbyangs pa dang bde ba gnyis tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa
translated: When an ƒÅrya ≈õrƒÅvaka manifests the pleasure of complete seclusion with the body and then abides in it,

original: kho na bde ba ma yin no //
analyzed: kho na bde ba ma yin no //
translated: pliancy is not pleasure.

original: gal te snyoms par zhugs pa la ji ltar lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snyoms par zhugs pa la ji ltar lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung zhe na /
translated: If pliancy is pleasure, how does body consciousness arise in one who enters meditative attainment?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par las skyes pa shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rlung gis lus la rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par las skyes pa shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rlung gis lus la rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The special concentration produces a factor called pliancy, which is a kind of wind that spreads through the body and produces pleasure.

original: gal te phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mind falls away from concentration because it is distracted outwardly,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa lus kyi bde ba nang du 'byung ba'i lus kyi bde ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa lus kyi bde ba nang du 'byung ba'i lus kyi bde ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pleasure of concentration arises internally in the body, and the pleasure of the body is compatible with concentration.

original: gal te lus kyi rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i tshe langs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus kyi rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i tshe langs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mind rises from concentration when the consciousness of the body arises,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of that very reason.

original: gal te 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang pos gzugs na spyod pa'i reg bya la rnam par shes pa mi skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang pos gzugs na spyod pa'i reg bya la rnam par shes pa mi skye'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the body sense faculty of the desire realm does not generate consciousness of a tactile object of the form realm,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness of pliancy arises.

original: gal te yan lag cung zad cig ni zag pa dang bcas pa cung zad cig ni zag pa med pa yin na mi rung bas reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa zag pa med pa dag tu yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag cung zad cig ni zag pa dang bcas pa cung zad cig ni zag pa med pa yin na mi rung bas reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa zag pa med pa dag tu yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is not suitable that some parts are contaminated and some parts are uncontaminated, then the tactile objects and body consciousness would also be uncontaminated.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs @70b pas 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs @70b pas 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is asserted that pliancy of the body is a branch of enlightenment.

original: gal te byang chub kyi yan lag dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni zag pa med pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gal te byang chub kyi yan lag dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni zag pa med pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: If you say that is because it is compatible with the branches of enlightenment, then being uncontaminated is similar to that.

original: gal te zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: If you say that is because it is said, What are contaminated phenomena?üîΩas many eyes as there are,

original: mig ji snyed pa zhes 'byung ba'i mdo 'di dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: mig ji snyed pa zhes 'byung ba'i mdo 'di dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: that is contradictory to this sutra.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan las dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan las dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is stated with the intention of referring to tactile objects and body consciousness other than those.

original: gal te zag pa med pa la yan lag cung zad cig ni zag pa dang bcas ba cung zad cig ni zag pa med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zag pa med pa la yan lag cung zad cig ni zag pa dang bcas ba cung zad cig ni zag pa med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that some members of the formless realm are associated with pure absorption and some are associated with impure absorption?

original: cig car ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: cig car ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the problem if they are not simultaneous?

original: gal te bde ba dang dga' ba phrad pa med pa'i phyir yan lag lnga par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bde ba dang dga' ba phrad pa med pa'i phyir yan lag lnga par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the formless realm would not have five members because there is no contact with pleasure and joy,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: srid pa'i phyir bstan pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i phyir bstan pas rtog pa dang dpyod pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are taught as possible, like investigation and analysis.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are to be established,

original: sems rtsing ba dang zhib pa gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir dang / nyes pa smos pa'i phyir grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sems rtsing ba dang zhib pa gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir dang / nyes pa smos pa'i phyir grub pa yin no //
translated: that is established because it is contradictory for the mind to be both coarse and subtle, and because the S≈´tra on the Five Aggregates says:

original: de lta bas na bsam gtan dang po la yod pa'i yan lag lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag kho na las yan lag gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi bor nas bsam gtan gnyis ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam gtan dang po la yod pa'i yan lag lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag kho na las yan lag gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi bor nas bsam gtan gnyis ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the second and higher absorptions are posited by eliminating two, three, and four members, respectively, from the five members that exist in the first absorption.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan dang po la ni yan lag lnga nyid du bshad la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan dang po la ni yan lag lnga nyid du bshad la /
translated: For this reason, the first meditation is said to have five members.

original: de dag las thor bas ni bsam gtan phyi ma rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'du shes la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag las thor bas ni bsam gtan phyi ma rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'du shes la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The members are not sensation, etc., because the latter are scattered and because the subsequent meditations are established by the absence of the first two members.

original: yang na ci'i phyir lnga kho na yan lag nyid yin /
analyzed: yang na ci'i phyir lnga kho na yan lag nyid yin /
translated: Or else, why are only five members?

original: gal te phan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because they are beneficial,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis pas dran pa dang shes rab dag ches phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis pas dran pa dang shes rab dag ches phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because mindfulness and wisdom are more beneficial than the first two members.

original: kha cig de skad du rgol ba yod mod kyi sngon gyi slob dpon rnams ni ji snyed mngon pa de ltar mi ston te /
analyzed: kha cig de skad du rgol ba yod mod kyi sngon gyi slob dpon rnams ni ji snyed mngon pa de ltar mi ston te /
translated: Some raise this objection, but the former masters of the Abhidharma do not teach the Abhidharma in this way.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this should be investigated.

original: nang rab tu dang ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: nang rab tu dang ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this thing called internal clarity?

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i 'khrug pa dang bral bas rgyud rab tu zhi bar gyur pa ni nang rab tu dang ba yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i 'khrug pa dang bral bas rgyud rab tu zhi bar gyur pa ni nang rab tu dang ba yin te /
translated: The stream of consciousness that is free from the disturbance of investigation and analysis is internal clarity.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pas dkrugs pa'i rgyud ni chu bo dba' rlabs dang bcas pa bzhin du rab tu ma dang ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pas dkrugs pa'i rgyud ni chu bo dba' rlabs dang bcas pa bzhin du rab tu ma dang ba yin no //
translated: The stream of thought disturbed by initial inquiry and investigation is not clear, like water with waves and foam.

original: 'o na ni de rdzas gzhan ma yin pas ji ltar na rdzas su yan lag bcu gcig yin /
analyzed: 'o na ni de rdzas gzhan ma yin pas ji ltar na rdzas su yan lag bcu gcig yin /

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Thus,

original: rab tu dang ba dad pa yin //üîΩde ni bsam gtan gnyis pa thob pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag @71a * //
analyzed: rab tu dang ba dad pa yin // de ni bsam gtan gnyis pa thob pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag @71a * //
translated: Faith is clarity.üîΩFaith is clarity of mind.

original: pa'i sa las nges par 'byung ba la yid ches ba skye ste /
analyzed: pa'i sa las nges par 'byung ba la yid ches ba skye ste /
translated: When one obtains the second meditation, one acquires the faith that is clarity of mind, which is the result of leaving the stage of the first meditation.

original: de ni 'dir nang rab tu dang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir nang rab tu dang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is what is called internal clarity.

original: gzhan dag na re rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams kyang rdzas gzhan ma yin la nang rab tu dang ba yang rdzas gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams kyang rdzas gzhan ma yin la nang rab tu dang ba yang rdzas gzhan ma yin no //
translated: According to other masters, faith is not a separate substance; the same for internal clarity.

original: rdzas gzhan med na ji ltar sems las byung pa nyid du 'grub ce na /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan med na ji ltar sems las byung pa nyid du 'grub ce na /
translated: If it is not a separate substance, how can it be a member of the first meditation?

original: sems can gyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag kyang sems las byung ba yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: sems can gyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag kyang sems las byung ba yin no zhes zer te /
translated: The difference in the states of sentient beings is also a factor of the thought.

original: 'di ni bstan bcos kyi grub pa'i mtha' ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan bcos kyi grub pa'i mtha' ma yin no //
translated: This is not the final position of the treatise.

original: dga' ba ni yid bde ba yin no zhes gang bshad pa 'di ji ltar khong du chud /
analyzed: dga' ba ni yid bde ba yin no zhes gang bshad pa 'di ji ltar khong du chud /
translated: But how do you understand the statement, ‚ÄúJoy is mental satisfaction‚Äù?

original: gzhan ci zhig yin /
analyzed: gzhan ci zhig yin /
translated: What else is mental satisfaction?

original: ji ltar sde pa gzhan dag 'dod pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sde pa gzhan dag 'dod pa lta bu yin no //
translated: It is just as the other schools believe.

original: sde ba gzhan dag ji ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: sde ba gzhan dag ji ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: What do the other schools believe?

original: dga' ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dag kho na yin la yid bde ba ni bsam gtan gsum char gyi yang bde ba yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: dga' ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dag kho na yin la yid bde ba ni bsam gtan gsum char gyi yang bde ba yin par 'dod do //
translated: Joy is a factor of thought distinct from mental satisfaction. Mental satisfaction is the pleasure of the three meditations.

original: bsam gtan dag na yod pa'i bde ba ni yid bde ba yin par mi rung ba nyid kyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag na yod pa'i bde ba ni yid bde ba yin par mi rung ba nyid kyi /
translated: The pleasure that exists in the meditations cannot be mental satisfaction.

original: lus rnams gnyis phyir dga' yid bde //
analyzed: lus rnams gnyis phyir dga' yid bde //
translated: Joy is satisfaction, because it is associated with two sensations.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par sgyur ba'i mdo las bsam gtan gsum pa bka' stsal nas 'dir 'di'i yid bde ba'i dbang po skyes pa ma lus bar 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par sgyur ba'i mdo las bsam gtan gsum pa bka' stsal nas 'dir 'di'i yid bde ba'i dbang po skyes pa ma lus bar 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal la /
translated: The Blessed One, in the S≈´tra of the Questions of ParamƒÅrthasamudgata, has explained the third meditation in these terms: ‚ÄúThere, the sensation of pleasure diminishes and the sensation of equanimity increases and becomes vast.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni bde ba'i dbang po 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni bde ba'i dbang po 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: In the fourth absorption, the faculty of pleasure is blocked.üîΩAgain, it is said, ‚ÄúHaving abandoned pleasure and having previously abandoned pain, and also having abandoned mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction, they enter and abide in the fourth absorption.‚Äù

original: yang bde ba yang spangs te snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir yang bsam gtan gsum pa na yid bde ba'i dbang po med de /
analyzed: yang bde ba yang spangs te snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir yang bsam gtan gsum pa na yid bde ba'i dbang po med de /
translated: Therefore mental satisfaction does not exist in the third absorption.

original: de ltar bas na dga' ba kho na yid bde ba yin gyi bde ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bas na dga' ba kho na yid bde ba yin gyi bde ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus joy is mental satisfaction and pleasure is not.

original: ci nyon mongs pa can gyi bsam gtan dag la yang ji skad du bshad pa ltar yan lag de dag yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci nyon mongs pa can gyi bsam gtan dag la yang ji skad du bshad pa ltar yan lag de dag yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do afflicted absorptions have the branches explained for pure absorptions?üîΩThey do not.

original: med do // de dag na ci zhig med ce na /
analyzed: med do // de dag na ci zhig med ce na /
translated: What is absent in them?üîΩIn afflicted states there is no joy, pleasure,

original: nyon mongs can la dga' bde dang // dran dang shes bzhin dran pa dang // btang snyoms dran pa dag pa med //
analyzed: nyon mongs can la dga' bde dang // dran dang shes bzhin dran pa dang // btang snyoms dran pa dag pa med //
translated: mindfulness, full awareness, or pure equanimity.

analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la ni bde ba las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba med de /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa las dben ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: gnyis pa la ni nang rab tu dang ba med de /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni nang rab tu dang ba med de /
translated: In the second, there is no inner serenity,

original: nyon mongs pas rnyog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas rnyog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is troubled by defilements.

original: gsum pa la ni dran pa dang shes bzhin med de /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni dran pa dang shes bzhin med de /
translated: In the third, there is no mindfulness and vigilance,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi bde bas kun du rmongs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi bde bas kun du rmongs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are confused by defiled pleasure.

original: @71b bzhi pa la ni btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa med de /
analyzed: @71b bzhi pa la ni btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa med de /
translated: In the fourth, there is no purity of equanimity and mindfulness,

original: nyon mongs pas dri ma can du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas dri ma can du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is defiled by the defilements.

original: re zhig kha cig de skad zer ro //
analyzed: re zhig kha cig de skad zer ro //
translated: Some say this.

original: kha cig shin tu sbyangs btang snyoms //
analyzed: kha cig shin tu sbyangs btang snyoms //
translated: Some say: serenity and equanimity.

original: kha cig na re nyon mongs pa can dang po dang gnyis pa dag na ni shin tu sbyangs pa med la gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag na ni btang snyoms med de //
analyzed: kha cig na re nyon mongs pa can dang po dang gnyis pa dag na ni shin tu sbyangs pa med la gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag na ni btang snyoms med de //
translated: Some say: In the first and second wholesome absorptions, there is no serenity, and in the third and fourth, there is no equanimity.

original: de gnyis ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because these two are the many virtuous levels.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan gsum ni skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir g-yo ba dang bcas pa dag yin no zhes bka' stsal te //üîΩskyon brgyad las ni grol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan gsum ni skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir g-yo ba dang bcas pa dag yin no zhes bka' stsal te // skyon brgyad las ni grol ba'i phyir /
translated: The Bhagav√•n has said that the first three absorptions are fluctuating because they are flawed.

original: bzhi pa g-yo ba med pa yin //
analyzed: bzhi pa g-yo ba med pa yin //
translated: The fourth is not fluctuating because it is free from eight flaws.

original: skyon de dag kyang gang zhe na //
analyzed: skyon de dag kyang gang zhe na //
translated: What are these eight flaws?

analyzed: rtog dang dpyod dang dbugs dag dang // bde ba la sogs bzhi yin no //

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni skyon brgyad po de dag gcig kyang med pas de'i phyir de ni mi g-yo ba zhes bshad do //

analyzed: mdo las rlung med pa'i mar me dper mdzad pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: The example of a butter lamp without wind.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni dga' ba zhes smos pa'i phyir yid bde ba yod par bshad /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni dga' ba zhes smos pa'i phyir yid bde ba yod par bshad /

analyzed: gsum pa na ni bde ba /

analyzed: bzhi pa na ni btang snyoms yod par bshad na /
translated: Since the fourth absorption mentions equanimity, equanimity exists there.

translated: Do the feelings that exist in the absorptions of meditative attainment also exist in the absorptions of birth?

original: smras pa ma yin no /
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no /
translated: They do not.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /

original: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
analyzed: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
translated: In the absorptions of birthüîΩthere is mental satisfaction, equanimity,üîΩequanimity, mental satisfaction, pleasure and

analyzed: yid bde ba dang btang snyoms dang // btang snyoms yid bde bde ba dang // btang snyoms btang snyoms tshor ba yod // skye ba'i bsam gtan dang po na ni /

original: tshor ba gsum yod de /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum yod de /
translated: In the first absorption of birth there are three feelings.

original: rnam par shes ba'i tshogs gsum pa'i bde ba dang / yid kyis pa'i yid bde ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: rnam par shes ba'i tshogs gsum pa'i bde ba dang / yid kyis pa'i yid bde ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: The pleasure of the third aggregate of consciousness, the mental satisfaction of the mind, and the equanimity of the fourth aggregate of consciousness.

original: skye ba'i bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni tshor ba gnyis te /
analyzed: skye ba'i bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni tshor ba gnyis te /
translated: In the second meditative absorption of birth, there are two feelings.

original: yid kyi sa ba'i yid bde ba dang btang snyoms so //üîΩrnam par shes pa'i tshogs @72a * //
analyzed: yid kyi sa ba'i yid bde ba dang btang snyoms so // rnam par shes pa'i tshogs @72a * //
translated: Mental satisfaction and equanimity of the mental faculty.

original: gzhan med pa'i phyir bde ba dang / yid kyis pa'i yid bde ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: gzhan med pa'i phyir bde ba dang / yid kyis pa'i yid bde ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: Because there is no other aggregate of consciousness, there is no pleasure, no mental satisfaction of the mental faculty, and no equanimity of the fourth aggregate of consciousness.

original: skye ba'i bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni tshor ba gnyis te /
analyzed: skye ba'i bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni tshor ba gnyis te /
translated: In the second meditative absorption of birth, there are two feelings.

original: yid kyi sa pa'i yid bde ba dang btang snyoms so //
analyzed: yid kyi sa pa'i yid bde ba dang btang snyoms so //
translated: Mental satisfaction and equanimity of the mental faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gzhan med pa'i phyir bde ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gzhan med pa'i phyir bde ba med do //
translated: Because there is no other aggregate of consciousness, there is no pleasure.

original: skye ba'i bsam gtan gsum pa na ni tshor ba gnyis te /
analyzed: skye ba'i bsam gtan gsum pa na ni tshor ba gnyis te /
translated: In the third meditative absorption of birth, there are two feelings.

original: yid kyi sa pa'i bde ba dang / btang snyoms skye ba'i bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni btang snyoms kho na yod do //
analyzed: yid kyi sa pa'i bde ba dang / btang snyoms skye ba'i bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni btang snyoms kho na yod do //
translated: In the fourth meditation, which is the stage of equanimity, there is only equanimity.

original: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa la sogs pa dag na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum med pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang med na ji ltar na de dag gis mthong ba nas reg pa'i bar du 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa la sogs pa dag na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum med pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang med na ji ltar na de dag gis mthong ba nas reg pa'i bar du 'gyur /
translated: If there is no group of three consciousnesses in the third meditation and above, and if there is no initial inquiry and investigation, how can there be seeing, etc., up to contact?

original: ji ltar na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed ce na /
translated: How can there be the instigation of informative action?

original: de dag tu skyes pa rnams la mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med pa nyid kyang ma yin la rang gis pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag tu skyes pa rnams la mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med pa nyid kyang ma yin la rang gis pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not that those who are born in these meditations do not have visual consciousness, etc., but that they do not have the consciousnesses of their own stage.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is this?üîΩThe instigation of the informative action that exists in the second meditation and above belongs to the first meditation.

original: gnyis pa sogs na lus mig dang // rna ba'i rnam shes rnam rig slong //
analyzed: gnyis pa sogs na lus mig dang // rna ba'i rnam shes rnam rig slong //
translated: The body, eye, and ear consciousnesses of those born in the second meditation and above belong to their own stage.

original: gang yin de ni dang por gtogs //
analyzed: gang yin de ni dang por gtogs //
translated: The instigation of the informative action that exists in the second meditation and above belongs to the first meditation.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na ni sprul pa'i sems bzhin du gang gis na de dag gis mthong bas na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i bar bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i mig dang / rna ba dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang rnam par rig byed kun nas slong par byed pa mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na ni sprul pa'i sems bzhin du gang gis na de dag gis mthong bas na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i bar bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i mig dang / rna ba dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang rnam par rig byed kun nas slong par byed pa mngon sum du byed do //
translated: In the second absorption and so on, one manifests eyes, ears, and body of the first absorption level and the eye, ear, and body consciousnesses and the motivating mind that sees form and hears sound, just as one manifests a mind of emanation.

original: de lung ma bstan nyon mongs min //
analyzed: de lung ma bstan nyon mongs min //
translated: They are neutral, not affliction.

original: de dag mngon sum du byed pa bsam gtan dang bo'i sa pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag mngon sum du byed pa bsam gtan dang bo'i sa pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin gyi /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la /

original: dman pa'i phyir dge ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dman pa'i phyir dge ba yang ma yin no //

original: bsam gtan gyi bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bya ba rdzogs so /

original: // / yang dag pa sa la sogs pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams ji ltar 'thob ce na /

analyzed: de dang mi ldan 'dod chags bral //

analyzed: de ni skye bas 'thob pa med do //

analyzed: yongs su nyams pa las kyang nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'thob bo //

translated: Six arise immediately after the uncontaminated first absorption.

original: dag pa pa dang zag pa med pa gzhan dag go //
analyzed: dag pa pa dang zag pa med pa gzhan dag go //
translated: The pure and uncontaminated meditative attainments of its own level and the second and third absorptions.üîΩSeven arise immediately after the base of nothingness.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi mjug thogs su bdun te rang gis pa dang rnam shes dang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi sa pa'i dag pa pa dang zag pa med pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i dag pa kho na ste /

analyzed: zag pa med pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi mjug thogs su dgu ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa gzhan gyi mjug thogs su yang rdzas bcu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, ten substances should be added after the other absorptions and formless states.

original: 'di ni mdor bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bsdu ba yin te /
translated: This is a brief summary.

original: zag pa med pa'i mjug thogs su /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i mjug thogs su /
translated: After the uncontaminated,

original: ltag 'og gsum pa'i bar dge ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: ltag 'og gsum pa'i bar dge ba skye ba'o //
translated: virtuous states arise up to the third level.

original: dge ba smos pa ni dag pa ba dang / zag pa med pa gzung ste /
analyzed: dge ba smos pa ni dag pa ba dang / zag pa med pa gzung ste /

original: dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: After the substance of an uncontaminated meditative attainment, pure and uncontaminated states of its own level, lower levels and up to three levels arise.

original: thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug par byed pas gsum pa las phan chad du ni rgal bar mi nus so //
analyzed: thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug par byed pas gsum pa las phan chad du ni rgal bar mi nus so //
translated: One cannot skip over a third stage, because one enters meditative attainment by skipping over stages.

original: rjes su shes pa'i mjug thogs su gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug gi chos shes pa'i mjug thogs su ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i mjug thogs su gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug gi chos shes pa'i mjug thogs su ni ma yin te /
translated: One enters meditative attainment in the formless realm immediately after subsequent knowledge, but not immediately after knowledge of the truth of Dharma,

original: de'i rten dang dmigs pa 'og ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten dang dmigs pa 'og ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its basis and focal object are lower.

original: ji ltar zag pa med pa'i mjug thogs su bshad pa ltar dag pa las de bzhin /
analyzed: ji ltar zag pa med pa'i mjug thogs su bshad pa ltar dag pa las de bzhin /

analyzed: nyon mongs pas gzir ba ni 'og ma'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dag pa pa la yang dga' bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa can yongs su bcad nas 'og mar 'phon ni dge ba las 'phos pa yin gyi nyon mongs pa can las ni ma yin no//
translated: If one transfers to a lower level after eliminating afflicted meditative attainment, then one transfers from virtue, but not from affliction.

original: 'on te yongs su ma bcad na ni ji ltar 'pho zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yongs su ma bcad na ni ji ltar 'pho zhe na /

original: sngon 'phangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon 'phangs pa'i phyir te /

original: sngon 'di snyam du 'og ma'i dag pa ba ni bla'i gong ma'i nyon mongs pa can ni ma yin no snyam du 'dod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sngon 'di snyam du 'og ma'i dag pa ba ni bla'i gong ma'i nyon mongs pa can ni ma yin no snyam du 'dod par 'gyur la /

original: sngon gyi bsam pa yang sems can rnams kyi rgyun gyi rjes su 'brangs te /
analyzed: sngon gyi bsam pa yang sems can rnams kyi rgyun gyi rjes su 'brangs te /

analyzed: bsams nas gnyid log par 'dod pa'i dus su sad pa bzhin no //

original: zag pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su rnam pa thams cad du mi skye'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su rnam pa thams cad du mi skye'o //
translated: Uncontaminated states never arise immediately after afflicted states.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus kyi phyir dag pa pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa can kho na skye'i gzhan gyi sa pa ni ma yin no zhes de skad du bshad kyi /

original: 'chi 'pho dag las nyon mongs kun //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dag las nyon mongs kun //

analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba'i tshe skye bas thob pa'i dag pa pa'i mjug thogs su sa thams cad pa'i nyon mongs pa can skye'o //

original: nyon mongs can las gong ma min //

analyzed: dag pa pa thams cad las zag pa med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas skye ba yang ma yin no //

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /

original: dag pa nyams pa'i cha mthun sogs //
analyzed: dag pa nyams pa'i cha mthun sogs //

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ni rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ni rnam pa gsum yin te /

original: khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs so //

original: 'di'i mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan nyid ci zhe na /

original: de ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: de ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: They are respectively:üîΩconducive to the generation of affliction,

original: nyon mongs skye dang rang sa dang // gong dang zag med rjes mthun pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs skye dang rang sa dang // gong dang zag med rjes mthun pa'o //

analyzed: gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni rang gi sa @74a * //

analyzed: dang rjes su mthun pa'o // khyad par can gyi cha dang rjes su mthun pa ni sa gong ma dang rjes su mthun pa'o //

analyzed: zag pa med pa ni de las skye'o //

original: nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs so //

analyzed: de gcig pu skye'o //

analyzed: mngon par grub pa yin no //

analyzed: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan ba rnams ni rang gis pa'i srid pa la dmigs so //
translated: Those possessing enjoyment focus on their own existence.

original: srid pa smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gzung ngo //
analyzed: srid pa smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gzung ngo //
translated: Existence refers to all impure things.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir 'og ma la yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir 'og ma la yang mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not focus on lower levels because one is free from attachment to lower levels.

original: sa rnams ni srid pas yongs su bcad pa'i phyir gong ma la yang ma yin no //üîΩdge ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zag pa med pa la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sa rnams ni srid pas yongs su bcad pa'i phyir gong ma la yang ma yin no // dge ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zag pa med pa la yang ma yin no //
translated: They do not focus on higher levels because the levels are demarcated by existence.

original: bsam gtan dge yul yod dgu yin //
analyzed: bsam gtan dge yul yod dgu yin //
translated: They do not focus on uncontaminated states because it would then follow that they would be virtuous.üîΩThe object fields of virtuous absorption are all.

original: dge ba'i bsam gtan dag pa dang // zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan de'i dmigs pa ni 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas gang ci yod kyang rung ba thams cad yin no //üîΩgzugs mod dngos gzhi dge rnams kyi //üîΩspyod yul zag bcas 'og ma min //
analyzed: dge ba'i bsam gtan dag pa dang // zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan de'i dmigs pa ni 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas gang ci yod kyang rung ba thams cad yin no // gzugs mod dngos gzhi dge rnams kyi // spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma min //
translated: The object fields of virtuous pure and uncontaminated absorption are all conditioned and unconditioned states.üîΩThe object fields of the actual basis of the formless are not contaminated lower levels.

original: gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi dge ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni sa 'og ma pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi dge ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni sa 'og ma pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: The object fields of virtuous actual basis of the formless are not contaminated lower levels.

original: rang gi sa pa dang / sa gong ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa dang / sa gong ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: They do not focus on contaminated lower levels because they focus on their own level and higher levels.

original: dmigs pa zag pa med pa ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad yin gyi chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yang ma yin la sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa zag pa med pa ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad yin gyi chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yang ma yin la sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The object field of the uncontaminated path is all that is associated with subsequent knowledge, but not that which is associated with the knowledge of the doctrine, nor is it the cessation of lower stages.

original: nyer bsdogs kyi bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi dmigs pa ni sa 'og ma yin no //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs kyi bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi dmigs pa ni sa 'og ma yin no //
translated: The object field of the uninterrupted paths of the access concentrations is the lower stage.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnam pa gsum po 'di dag las /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnam pa gsum po 'di dag las /
translated: Among these three types of meditative attainment of the absorptions and formless realm states,

original: zag pa med pas nyon mongs pa rnams spong ngo //
analyzed: zag pa med pas nyon mongs pa rnams spong ngo //
translated: the uncontaminated path abandons the afflictions.

original: dag pa pas kyang mi spong na //
analyzed: dag pa pas kyang mi spong na //
translated: If the pure path does not abandon them,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyis lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyis lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: what need is there to mention the afflicted path?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir 'og ma la yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir 'og ma la yang ma yin la /
translated: They are not abandoned by the lower level because one is free from attachment to it.

original: de nyid de'i gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi sa na yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de'i gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi sa na yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not abandoned by the level itself because that itself is not the antidote to them.

original: ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir gong ma yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir gong ma yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not abandoned by the higher level because it is superior.

original: nyer bsdogs dag pas kyang /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs dag pas kyang /
translated: The access concentrations also abandon afflictions.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i nyer bsdogs ni dag pa pas kyang nyon mongs pa rnams spong ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i nyer bsdogs ni dag pa pas kyang nyon mongs pa rnams spong ste /
translated: The access concentrations to the form and formless realms also abandon afflictions through purity.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are antidotes to the lower level.

original: nyer bsdogs du zhig yod ce na //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs du zhig yod ce na //
translated: How many access concentrations are there?

original: de dag la ni nyer @75b bsdogs brgyad //
analyzed: de dag la ni nyer @75b bsdogs brgyad //
translated: There are eight access concentrations.

original: re re la gang gis de la 'jug pa re re yod do //
analyzed: re re la gang gis de la 'jug pa re re yod do //
translated: Each has one that induces it.

original: ci de dag kyang rnam pa gsum yin la de dag la tshor ba yang de dang 'dra bar yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de dag kyang rnam pa gsum yin la de dag la tshor ba yang de dang 'dra bar yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are they also of three types and do they have feelings like them?

original: smras pa / ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin te /
translated: No, they are not.

original: dag pa bde min sdug bsngal min //
analyzed: dag pa bde min sdug bsngal min //
translated: They are pure, neither pleasure nor pain.

original: de dag ni dag pa yang yin la btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan ba dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni dag pa yang yin la btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan ba dag kyang yin te /
translated: They are pure and they are concomitant with the faculty of equanimity,

original: 'bad de drang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sa 'og ma pa las yid 'byung ba dang ma bral ba'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro myang ba dang mtshungs bar ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bad de drang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sa 'og ma pa las yid 'byung ba dang ma bral ba'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro myang ba dang mtshungs bar ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: because they are to be induced through effort, because they are not free from the mental state of renunciation of the lower level and because they are the path of separation from attachment. They are not concomitant with enjoyment.

original: dang po 'phags pa'ang /
analyzed: dang po 'phags pa'ang /
translated: The first is ƒÅrya.

original: nyer bsdogs kyi dang po ni mi lcogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs kyi dang po ni mi lcogs pa med pa ste /
translated: The first access concentration is unrestricted anagamya because it is the antidote of all higher realms.

original: de ni dag pa yang yin la zag pa med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni dag pa yang yin la zag pa med pa yang yin no //
translated: It is both pure and uncontaminated.

original: nyer bsdogs kyi sems kyi snying mtshams sbyor ba nyon mongs pa can yin mod kyi mnyam par gzhag pa la ni nyon mongs ba can nyid dgag go //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs kyi sems kyi snying mtshams sbyor ba nyon mongs pa can yin mod kyi mnyam par gzhag pa la ni nyon mongs ba can nyid dgag go //
translated: Although the mind of access concentration is the link of the afflicted mind, it is said to be uncontaminated in equipoise, but it is not uncontaminated in terms of the afflicted mind.

original: kha cig gsum /
analyzed: kha cig gsum /
translated: Some say three.

original: kha cig ni mi lcogs pa med pa ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang 'dod do //üîΩnyer bsdogs zhes kyang 'byung /
analyzed: kha cig ni mi lcogs pa med pa ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang 'dod do // nyer bsdogs zhes kyang 'byung /
translated: Some say that unrestricted access concentration is also associated with enjoyment.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can zhes kyang 'byung na /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can zhes kyang 'byung na /
translated: It is called access concentration and also special absorption.

original: ci 'di'i don gcig pa zhig gam /üîΩ'on te don tha dad pa zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di'i don gcig pa zhig gam / 'on te don tha dad pa zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of these terms?

original: don tha dad ba yin te /
analyzed: don tha dad ba yin te /
translated: They have different meanings.

original: nyer bsdogs ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lam yin la /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i lam yin la /
translated: Access concentration is the path of separation from attachment.

original: rtog med bsam gtan khyad par can //
analyzed: rtog med bsam gtan khyad par can //
translated: Special absorption is nonconceptual.

original: bsam gtan dang po kho na rtog pa dang // mtshungs par mi ldan pa ni bsam gtan khyad par can yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po kho na rtog pa dang // mtshungs par mi ldan pa ni bsam gtan khyad par can yin te /
translated: The special meditation is not associated with initial inquiry and investigation.

original: bsam gtan gyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called special meditation because it is a special meditation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na rnam par mi gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na rnam par mi gzhag pa ste /
translated: That is why it is not distinguished in the second meditation and above.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not distinguished there because it is not distinguished there.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can de ni //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can de ni //
translated: This special meditationüîΩis of three types:

original: rnam gsum / ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang dag pa dang zag pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam gsum / ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang dag pa dang zag pa med pa yin no //
translated: it is associated with enjoyment, it is pure, and it is uncontaminated.

original: de bden min sdug min /
analyzed: de bden min sdug min /
translated: It is neither pleasure nor satisfaction.

original: 'di la bde pa yang med bas na bde ba yang ma yin pa sdug bsngal yang ma yin ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la bde pa yang med bas na bde ba yang ma yin pa sdug bsngal yang ma yin ba ste /
translated: It is neither pleasure nor satisfaction because it is neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩmngon par 'du bya ba dang bcas pas drangs ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mngon par 'du bya ba dang bcas pas drangs ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is associated with the faculty of equanimity.üîΩIt is not associated with joy because it is attracted by the effort that is associated with it.

original: dga' ba dang mtshungs par ldan ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang mtshungs par ldan ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not associated with pleasure because it is not of the stage of the first meditation.
